story:
PROVE THEM WRONG!

Growing up in Jerusalem was always a challenge for musicians, especially when it comes to rap music. Having no Record Labels has always made it hard for musicians coming out from Jerusalem to be heard. No musician had made it out from Jerusalem yet, due to the lack of concern in the music field by the stake holders (Music Institutions, schools, Media, etc...).

I was referred to different entities and organizations but i was turned down because none of them believed in my cause; non of them believed that we can make a difference.
Our society always claims that music will lead to nowhere. This is why people should get a job with a regular wage so that they can have an average life. So all dreams can be buried and forgotten. Wait! We should PROVE THEM WRONG! I believe that my music will get heard and one day will make it out to the whole world.

I recorded my first Album! -Adrenalin-. All seven songs are in Arabic and talking about different aspects of my journey; God, humanity, life, love, challenges, old memories and Jerusalem.

In this Album I allowed myself to talk about things that people are afraid to face in public; questioning traditions and customs that we are used to without having full knowledge of why we do them and what they lead us to. Along with mixing rap with eastern and western tunes; Blues, Rock, Arabic music, folk, Jazz and more, different instruments like Guitar, Kanoon, Drums, Saz, Duduk Wind woods, O'od, Darbouka, Keyboard and sound effects were used. All of this leads to allowing my community and anyone who hears the music to get introduced to a new style. My aim behind the lyrics and style is to take people's thinking and minds to a level where they haven't reach before; a level where they can think out of the box and expand. As a result this will lead to a more open minded and better future.

 



A journey always starts with a first step. The album is recorded and the first step should be taken; *A Tour, *A video clip and of course, *Marketing!
The tour will take place in four different cities; Jerusalem, Haifa, Ramallah and Bethlehem. Two video clips for the album are already done but this one will be consisted of footage from the tour.

I took out all my savings and had to spend $12000 to record the album Plus two music videos. By The Way, this amount  should have been way more, but people do a lot when they believe in you! 

See above for music videos, 'YA QUDS' video was made 3 years ago. The other 2 videos 'Admantek' + 'God -Allah' are the new ones!

It shouldn't stop here. People should know and hear more about my project.
To do so, and to bring it to the next level, I Need Your Support..
 

We Can Make It Together!


My goal of $21000 is to cover a full tour in four different places including a Music Video as mentioned above.
 

Below is the plan of how the money will be allotted.

Musicians plus Technical Riders: $3400 per show || $13600 for four shows.
Publicity, Press and Marketing: $2500
Music Video: $2520
Other Fees: $2480

And here is a detailed plan --->

Won't Back Down

I have been performing since i was 11 years old. The downs were more than the ups, but hey..Everything is different now, I have accomplished something I wanted to do years ago! To get this tour done would be something really special as it would bring the album to new places creating something out of nothing.

We Should pass 3 targets to get to our goal:
Target 1: $8792
Target 2: $13188
Target 3: $16704
THE GOAL: $21100

If I pass my goal I will collect all the extra money and help the children of a boarding school I used to go to located in Bet-Jala. (for more info about this boarding school, please contact me).

What would I do if I reach each target? Here you go!..

The Perks! 8 total-- This is what you get depending on the package you choose!..
You can view them up on the side as well ->

$10   $25   $50   $100    $200    $500   $1000   $3500 


No Money?.. I get it.. I DO!


Join me in my journey. I will be sharing my journey on this page as i move forward. Go like my Facebook Page, follow me on my social network and let your friends know about my music.

Help me get the word out! If you share to your social network, your email list, your fellow musicians, your friends, your staff, your family, and anyone that comes to your mind..you will heroically make everyone's contribution go a long, long way.

story:
Short Summary

Phil Dudley is an independent artist based in Birmingham, Alabama. As a third-generation musician, playing was not so much a choice as a calling, having been an integral part of his life for as long as he can remember. With influences drawing from Celtic Folk, Americana, Rock and Jazz, Phil Dudley's music blends these influences seamlessly, incorporating the styles of many of his favorite artists such as Tom Petty, Eddie Vedder and Jamie Cullum to create a musical tapestry that reflects his individualistic style.

Between the ages of 10 and 18, Dudley was classically trained on piano, attending weekly lessons and playing for hours on end every day. At age 19, he started writing original material and playing guitar. He started performing at venues in the Birmingham, Nashville and north Georgia regions, playing in clubs and restaurants 1-3 times a week. After 2 years of developing his skills, his band, and his catalog of original music, he released his debut album "Wonderland" on October 12, 2013.

After releasing his first album, he continued writing and performing. After a year of writing, arranging, rehearsing and producing he released his second album on May 9, 2015; The Phil Dudley Band "All in My Head". 

The Phil Dudley Band consists of 4 members; Phil Dudley, Jack Dudley, Erich Cousins and William Yarbrough. 


What I Need & What You Get

In order to produce a full length professional album, I need to raise enough funding for studio time, mixing, mastering, packaging, promotion and distribution. 

  • Out of the initial $5000 that I am trying to raise on Indiegogo, $4000 will go towards studio time. This includes tracking and mixing. 
  • The other $1000 will go towards having the album professionally mastered. 
  • Additional funding for packaging, promotion and distribution will be raised in the coming months through physical fundraisers, shows and merchandise sales.  
  • Check out the list of perks for contributing to this project on the right side of the screen! 
  • The new album "Seasons" will feature 10-12 new original songs. 
  • If the initial $5000 goal is not met entirely, all funds donated will be put towards the future production of the new album "Seasons" and all perks will be delivered as promised. 

The Impact

  • Your contribution will help me immensely on the road to fulfilling my dream as a musician and as an entertainer. 
  • With the funding that I have raised in the past through crowdfunding I have been able to share my previous albums with the world via iTunes, Amazon and Spotify. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't help financially? No worries; 

  • Please help by sharing my music and this campaign with friends and family over social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc.) 
  • Follow me on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and Youtube! 
  • Join my email list at phildudleymusic.com 
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Help!

I need this camera to get back to work helping our community grow, unite as individuals and gain the media tools they need at a realistic and honest price:

  • My name is Kevin and I have been into the music and arts my whole life.  I play multiple instruments and am a computer geek.  I love the weather and space and when I realized that a camera can encompass, capture and further the creativity of these things I was hooked.  
  • With this camera I can get filming again, it's that simple.
  • I believe in everyone supporting their local community, and media is absolutley nessecary in our world.  Artists and musicians need exposure as well as the local businesses.  What I do as just one person has been helping artists already, they went from no media to decent quality videos after one shoot.  I've seen bands take the raw footage I gave them and turned into a video themselves even.  If you check my social media links, especially Facebook you'll see it for yourself.  I support and I can't support as powerfully as I can when I have a camera.

What I Need & What You Get

 

  • I get a camera and the community gets back live shoots, music videos, promo ads, commercial ads and more.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate financially then a share, or even just set back and enjoy some of the videos of our local bands.  If you are not in "our local" then consider this yourself, or encourage others.  We need to fix this in our own backyards, these creative minds need to connect with their people.
  • Share on all platforms and even try the Indiegogo share tools.

Share on all platforms and even try the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Burns began playing and singing in 1960 while attending Miami University (Ohio) where he saw his first musical influence, Pete Seeger.  He lived for a semester (1962) in New York’s East Village, and encountered Bob Dylan at Gerde’s Folk City and the Bitter End. Playing on Bourbon Street in New Orleans for tips, he landed a real job playing and singing in a bar, at a dollar an hour.  Burns moved on to San Francisco, where he played the North Beach basket houses and on the street. From there, he went to St. Croix, where he helped to build an alternative school in the jungle, and worked with renowned trimaran designer, Dick Newick, to build the 46-ft trimaran, Three Cheers, for the 1972 OSTAR race. He returned to the San Francisco Bay area in 1973, where he met and played for most of that decade with folk icon, Rolf Cahn.  In 1980, he moved to Austin to be part of the exploding musical scene there.  

Moving from Austin to the Texas Riviera in 2007, Burns was active with the Rialto Theater in Aransas Pass as board member and talent buyer, presenting a series of musicians, many of whom are respected and revered throughout Texas (Kinky Friedman, Steven Fromholz,  Greezy Wheels,  Tish Hinojosa, Sara Hickman, Steve James)  He Hosted Woeful Wednesdays ~ formerly Blue Monday ~ a plugged-in blues Jam at the Tarpon Ice House in Port Aransas, and also hosted Folk Fridays. 

Burns presents a mixture of musical styles all his own, including old folk songs, blues, Texas Country, and a sizable helping of original, acoustic material. His 1967 Martin D-28 is an extension of his body; his unique, fluid style of playing intrigues many musicians- with a soft syncopation that enhances the lead rifts.

Among his songs of Americana and Texana are “Erika,” about the decline of the shrimp industry; “Darlene”, the shrimp queen; "Lucca", a German Shephard/Belgian Malinois United States Marine; and "Look Out New Orleans", a blues tune that'll make you want to weep. His discography includes “Borrowed Time”, "Island Off the Coast of Hell", and soon to be released, "Stuart Burns: Live at the Cactus".

You can find him playing and singing around Austin, or traveling the US and UK, performing at house concerts and listening rooms. For more information or to book Stuart, contact:

Tin Cup Management

(512) 738-2318

From Stuart, "After writing songs and performing across the US and the UK for over 50 years, the production of this CD and recording it live CD at the Cactus Cafe, is a dream come true. This is a room where the paint still recalls voices of the musicians who have come and gone. To perform in this venue to a group of friends is what I do best- and now, to get it on a recording, is exciting."

To make this happen, we need $3,500. All of this will go to the cost of recording, production, marketing, and advertising. All funds collected will go towards this project- even if we don't reach our goal. In exchange for your contribution, we offer the following perks:

For a $10 contribution, you get a signed poster of the event.

For $25, you get a Stuart Burns Live at the Cactus CD.

For $40, you get 2 CDs: a Stuart Burns Live at the Cactus CD, and Borrowed Time.

For $50, you get 3 CDs: a Stuart Burns Live at the Cactus CD, Borrowed Time, and Island Off the Coast of Hell.

For $500 or more, you get a house concert with Stuart Burns.

The CDs and posters will be mailed to you.

If you can't make a contribution, that's okay. check out my music at www.stuartmichaelburns.com or https://www.reverbnation.com/stuartmichaelburns or https://www.facebook.com/Stuart-Michael-Burns. 

The recording at the Cactus Cafe is January 19, 2017 at 8:00 PM. If you are in Austin, please come.

If it ain't live, it ain't music.

story:
Join the New Referral Contest!

Starting now until the end of this campaign on March 12, your referrals and their donations will count toward our new Referral Contest!

1st Prize: 8x12, Premium Canvas (Gloss) Poster

2nd Prize: Choice of Notebook ("Rose of Sharon" or "Lily of the Valley")

3rd Prize: Mousepad

Rules

  • To participate in this contest, simply be a backer of this campaign for any amount.
  • While signed into your Indiegogo account, click the "Link" button for sharing this campaign. You will then see a popup with your unique link. Copy your unique share URL and use your unique URL to share the campaign on social media, email your friends and contacts, write a blog post, etc. (More info here.)
  • To be eligable to receive one of the above prizes, you and your referrals must have together contributed a total minimum of $20 to this campaign.
  • 3 winners will be chosen according to the total amount they and their referrals raised between now and March 12!

That's it! Have fun, and good luck!

 

 

-----------------------------------------------------

Short Summary

I am collaborating with CBTTF Records to create a fresh new, surround-sound album of my original works, expected to be released in June 2017. The largest piece we want to include on this album is "Of Roses and Lilies," a seven-minute work featuring Soprano solo voice, women's choir, and small orchestra. It is a stirring, melodic, dramatic work, taken from the Song of Solomon. Listen to the live performance debut of it in the video above, and read more about the work's story, including the Lyrics, here!

What We Need & What You Get

We need a total of $4250 -- this will go directly to paying the musicians of our orchestra (minus fundraising fees). For supporting our professional musicians, you'll get your name AND photo of your choice listed in the album notes, as well as a copy of the finished album. Larger funding rewards include Sarah's current discography, a signed score of "Of Roses and Lilies," a one-hour Skype chat with Sarah, and more!

The Impact

We will be hiring between 20-25 trusted musicians for a three-hour recording session in April. We feel strongly that musicians deserve to be paid for their work in bringing brand new music of our times to life! Musicians spend a lifetime perfecting their ability to play their instruments with beauty and finesse, so that we can enjoy the finished product for years to come. This is a chance to make a difference in the lives of these musicians and society as a whole with the collaborative, team-creation of accessible, modern music that speaks to and unites listeners around the world. Without these musicians, the music we create would simply remain unheard.

Risks & Challenges

It seems like a lot of money, but when you divide $4000 between 25 musicians, you'll find that each musician will still be accepting very little for this project. If we raise more than this minimum, I'll be able to pay these musicians more for their time and effort! And any amount that we raise, even if we fall short, will go directly to these musicians.

Creating audible music is a lifetime effort of practice and dedication to the instrument; unfortunately the low price of consuming music these days doesn't cover the cost of paying our musicians, who create that music for us, very fairly. Much of the cost of music creation falls to the generous support of music-lovers like yourself. :)

Other Ways You Can Help

The best way to get these dedicated musicians paid for this project is to share this campaign wide and far! Whether you can chip in any amount or not, please use the tools Indiegogo has provided to share this opportunity with everyone you know! Thank you so much for your help!

story:
Blaine Long

Hello! I am Blaine Long, a singer/songwriter from Chandler, Arizona.  I have been playing music full time in the valley for the last 8 years.  I am a father of two, husband of one.  2016 was a big year for my music and my family.  I got a 1-album record deal with Bright Angel Records (thanks Grant!).  I also made it onto The Voice Season 11 (Team Blake).  I had a 3-chair turn which felt pretty cool! After my "minute" on the show, and my contract was up, I came back home and got to work on this album.  

This record is entitled "Scorpio". I don't really know why.  It is my sign, but for some reason that just feels good and makes sense.  It is being produced by Sean Cooney at 3-Leaf Post Recording.  He will also play some guitar.  Gigi Gonaway is on drums.  Al Ortiz is on bass guitar.  By the time this campaign is done, we will have added organ, piano, pedal steel and who knows what else.  I'm very lucky to be working with these guys. You're gonna love what they did with my songs! 

Why I Need Your Help

The album is basically finished.  Despite my "fame" from being on The Voice - I. Am. Broke.  

Your donations will help with...

  • Studio time
  • Musicians 
  • Mastering
  • Promotions
  • CD duplication

Your Perks

House concerts, T-shirts, a guitar, CDs, stickers, wardrobe from the voice (and lanyard pass), personalized songs, stomp board, download cards.  These are just a few of the AMAZING perks you can receive! 

Other Ways to Help

Even if you can't help financially, you can help spread the word about my campaign and share my music.  You can follow me and share this on Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, or FaceBook.   THANK YOU!!

story:
Mariachi Mestizo at Carnegie Hall

We are an ensemble of 14 young musicians, ranging in age from 10 to 20 years old, who make up the advanced performing group of The Mariachi Studio in Delano, CA. We have had the distinct honor of being invited to perform at Carnegie Hall (in the historic Stern Auditorium!) on April 10th at 8pm as part of the Carnegie Hall Youth Debut Series.

It is a once in a lifetime opportunity for students like us to be presented on a world-class stage -- an achievement not only for mariachi music, but for the greater Latino community.

The towns we come from are small, rural, farm working communities nestled in the heart of California's Central Valley. The music we study and perform plays an important role in our communities because it brings a strong sense of pride to our families and the many other immigrant families who live there.

Mariachi is a nostalgic music of early Mexico that has evolved into a modern international genre that transcends borders. Our formal training as musicians allows us to explore the full spectrum of the genre with a strong command of its technical requirements. We are very proud to represent our heritage at this level.

Mariachi Mestizo will be the first mariachi group from California to debut at Carnegie Hall since Los Camperos de Nati Cano played there in the 1960's. Our performance will even be recorded and archived in the venue's vault.

Since learning of our invitation to perform at Carnegie Hall, we (and our parents, of course!) have been busy raising funds for the trip. We organized three major concerts: Día de los Muertos, Christmas (Posada Guadalupana), and a Valentine’s Day dinner/dance. However, we are still short of our goal.

With less than a month before our performance, we are asking YOU to support us and help us reach our final goal! We are offering attractive perks to entice your support, which include live mariachi music performances, among other things. Check them out! And of course, please share this page with your friends

Thank you for your support! 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PS Here's some more cool stuff about us:

We have studied together under the direction of Mr. Juan Morales at The Mariachi Studio since 2012. Although there have been several generations of our group since 1998, ours has been by far the most active. In 2015, we won first place at the Battle of the Mariachis at Mission San Juan Capistrano, competing against groups from Los Angeles, San Diego, Las Vegas and Tucson, AZ. We were also featured as the opening act of the Mariachi USA festival held in the iconic Hollywood Bowl. Last year, we recorded an album at Capitol Records in the legendary Studio A, where Frank Sinatra recorded during his famous albums from the "Capitol Years". We also performed at the Waterfront Blues festival in Portland, OR, The Oregon Shakespeare Festival and at the prestigious Hardly Strictly Bluegrass festival at Golden Gate Park in San Francisco. In January of this year, we were featured at the famed folk music venue, Freight and Salvage, in Berkley, CA.

story:
Short Summary

 

In 2017 I will be celebrating 30 years in music!

WOW! It seemed like only yesterday, I was dragging my broom in our house in Gonaives, in front of every mirror pretending that I was singing for a huge crowd. Now 30 years later, this is no pretense: This is my life!

 

I feel immensely blessed for theses opportunities to bring Haitian music in so many countries around the globe: Japan, France, Seyschelles Island , Italy, Australia ,Burkina Faso, Guadeloupe, Martinique and more. Fortunate for having performed at venues such as Carnegie Hall, The Apollo theater, Lincoln Center, The Kennedy Center. Humbled and awed to share my songs with various presidents and dignitaries,

But more importantly, I am grateful for you! Because you are the fuel, the fire behind this body of work. 

With 10 albums, and countless shows you have helped me share the beauty of Haitian culture,values, and musical traditions with the rest of the worl,and I am forever grateful!

 

How did it all happen?

Coming from a family with no musicians in the backdrop from previous generations, a family where there was just enough to pay for the school tuition and food, but not enough for music lessons. Who were the instrumental figures? what were the highs? the lows, the victories, the lessons?

Retracing all the ups and downs ,the wins, and especially the joy that it brings to dare carry a song in my suitcase, a flag and see the world together in a dance.

Emeline Passionately, is an opportunity for us, to create together a piece of work that reminds us that nothing is impossible. This is a human tale, The story of any soul striving to reach a dream that seems unreachable.

A story to fuel, inspire, to uplift to remind us that when we trust, when we work hard and give it our all, dreams lead to reality.
 

The power of wanting it so bad that walls will fall to let it BE!

This is an opportunity to not only share my story, but to tell the story of "All dreamers who keep their feet on the ground"

Where Do you Come in?

When  you take a good look at  the profile of all my productions over the years, you will notice that for me quality is a must! For you nothing is too big... Only the very best!

Album productions/ concepts/ videos only the best!

I have the utmost respect for the trust you have invested in me.

This project is going to take hard work, and MONEY and this is where I need your full support to make this happen.

To travel to Haiti, Canada and various other states to meet and record the participants instrumental to the story  will require a lot. Travelling/ Filming crew/ studio recording /music and voice recording and editing this project will cost an estimate of $50,000.

We are shooting for an initial goal of $20,000 so we can get it started.

If you jump the net will appear!

 

THE IMPACT

Sharing this story is not just sharing my story.

It is an opportunity to share with the world the VALUE of faith, commitment, and determination. It will serve as a tool to inspire youth all over Haiti, the US, and the world.

Combined with classes and workshops, this documentary can show the young people that ART initiate change. Art touches lives. It touches not just the receiver, but the creator as well.

Their dream is where it all starts.

LETS START TOGETHER! LETS make this HAPPEN!
 

IT STARTS TODAY, WITH YOUR COMMITMENT.

You can expect nothing less than the VERY best when you support this project.

Give What You Can, Share the Project!

We big up the big....But we cherish and value everything and anything that comes from your heart.

Please share the project via social media and through email with friends and family.

May what you give be multiplied! And thank you for the love and the trust.

 

Anpil Lanmou,

 

Emeline

story:
Let's go back to 2008...

which is when I penned my first song a few months before graduating college.  Music had always been a part of my life but it wasn't until then that I felt compelled to write something of my own. I had something to say.  Most of my writings remained scribbled up in my journals but a year ago, I decided to venture out and perform my original songs in NYC.  So I sought out open mics and landed a few gigs here and there which helped me overcome my fears and insecurities, not only as a performer, but as a person in general.  Most importantly, it gave me the opportunity to share my heart and writings with you all, which I hope you've enjoyed and been encouraged by!  So many have of you have been so supportive and have persistently asked me over the years when I'd have my own material out.  SO, here's your chance to partner with me in producing that album you've been waiting for!

 

The EP

I named the EP Gray after one of the first songs I'd written straight from beginning to end. It's my heart and story of journeying into this new world of performing and songwriting.  It's been a process that has uncovered a lot of my own doubts, fears and insecurities as a singer and as a woman. It touches on relationships, love, and overall, believing that there is so much more in store for you if only you'd take that first step! Here are the track listings: 

1. Who Is This Girl?

2. Gray

3. Move On Over

4. Walls

5. So Much More

 

So what next? 

As you all know, albums ain't cheap! There are many costs and moving parts involved so here's the breakdown: 

  • $7,625 for production (includes booking studio time, musicians' fees, editing, mixing & mastering for 5 tracks)
  • $1,975 for marketing (includes a photoshoot at Ruby Bird Studio in Greenpoint, Brooklyn; photographer fee; 5 hi-res promo photos; CD manufacturing, and printing of my very own "lyric cards" <--I'll explain more in the perks section!) 
  • $200 contingency (this is for any unexpected miscellaneous costs that may come up)

Grand Total: $9,800

 

Can't contribute? That's okay!

$9,800 is a lot of money, I know.  Quite frankly, I'm intimidated by it myself BUT, I still value your partnership even if it's not monetary and here are some other ways to support:

  • Follow me on my social media @ jeanleemusic on Facebook, Instagram and YouTube, where you can stay updated on upcoming performances and other news
  • Spread the word out about my campaign!

 

Thank you for your partnership! 

With love, 

Jean

story:
The Who and the What: 

Meghan Yates & The Reverie Machine are preparing to share their third, full length album -- A Little Grace. This album is intimate, relevant, and a reflection of the changes, grief and personal and global revolutions we've gone through in the last few years 

The Reverie Machine has been a band of many, changing shape with need and circumstance -- and now is a primarily a duo: Meghan Yates and Mordechai Rosenblatt. Recorded as a duo with the assistance of Todd Hutchinsen of Acadia Recording, who co-created the bands last two albums: Not By Blood and The Brightest Night. To hear our previous work, go hear here! 

Budget: 

Our campaign to raise $3000 will cover portions of recording, mixing, mastering, design, production and travel. 

Should we raise more than expected, promotion of the album will more possible. 


Prizes: 

We're keeping this very simple. There are only a few perks perks: 1) a pre-order of the album and 2) a pre-order of the album with a discounted print of the albums cover art, The Angels Light Broke Through The Brambles by Meghan Yates. 3) a pre-order of the album with the original painting of the cover art.

There are options for those local to Bellingham, WA without shipping -- and all other orders are requested to select the version with shipping. 

If you'd like to contribute more to elevate us closer to our goal, we'd be most graciously grateful. 

If you're unable to contribute financially, we would greatly benefit from your support by sharing our campaign! 

Thank you, Thank you, Thank you! 

Meg n Mo!

story:
The Dave Ness Trio has been lucky to make music together for more than 20 years with Dave Ness on guitars, Kurt Barker on percussion and Matt Thompson on bass. Their first two recordings – Sketches and Layers – did really well with critics and fans. As fans of the Dave Ness Trio know, Dave writes tunes that show influences of many styles- jazz, classical, rock, funk and world music.

Here is what Chicago Jazz Magazine said about the Dave Ness Trio CD “Layers”:

“Musical globetrotting is one of the features of this delightful album, with influences ranging from flamenco to Brazilian genres.”  "...creatively accomplished record…”  “…eloquent and poetic acoustic guitar work.” “…intelligently crisp and emotionally gritty.”

It has been 4 years since that last Dave Ness Trio recording Layers. Dave has been busy composing and working on some new ideas with Kurt and Matt and they're ready to head back to the studio for our next recording. They want to release this new album – tentatively called Grooveness – in 2018.  But they need your help to achieve that goal.

Their previous albums featured just the trio. Their new recording project will add some great players on other instruments. Matt Karnstedt and Tim Barclay will join them on saxophones and Pete Benson will play organ.
Please check out our indiegogo site.  Check out the perks available.  You receive a perks at  different levels.

We hope you can join us in this journey.  Thanks for your consideration. Any contribution is appreciated.  Whether you contribute or not,  please help us spread the word and share the link with others.

In case you are interested, here is pie chart that breaks down expenses.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1deBCl2RLj90zYYJqGU3xdrdYbVB3_WSpoHG9okp3QwQ/edit?usp=sharing

Thanks for your support!  

Don't hesitate to contact us with any questions:

email:  davenesstrio@gmail.com

website: www.davenesstrio.net

story:
It all started when Mike Pence...

...attended Hamilton on Broadway, less than two weeks after we found out he was going to be VP of the United States.

After the curtain call, Brandon V. Dixon, the Tony and Grammy nominated actor playing Aaron Burr, addressed him from the stage reading a statement on behalf of the cast, creative team and producers, basically saying, "thank you for coming," and asking him to please address the concerns of "the diverse America who are alarmed and anxious that your new administration will not protect us...and uphold our inalienable rights."

You can read the full statement here.

As anyone with half a brain cell can see--including Mr. Pence--this incident was neither disruptive nor harassment by any reasonable stretch of the imagination.

As anyone with a basic knowledge of the Constitution can see, this was an example of a group of professional artists respectfully exercising their First Amendment rights of freedom of speech, freedom to peaceably assemble, and freedom to petition the government for a redress of grievances.

And as anyone involved with the performing arts knows, our work as artists has always gone far beyond just being shallow entertainment manufactured and distributed to turn a buck. And most especially a show like Hamilton.

So, as soon as the video of Brandon V. Dixon's statement was posted to the Hamilton Facebook page, I made this comment on the post...which was essentially a more coarsely-worded tl;dr of everything I just said.

Woke up the next day to find it had amassed nearly 8,000 likes, and within two days it surpassed 30,000. With this came dozens of replies...and hundreds of angry trolls on my personal page and in my inbox. While I didn't experience any real threats to my safety, I did experience a barrage of belligerent ignorance--mostly people attempting to devalue me as an artist, and by extension devalue the artistic community as a whole.

So naturally, I did what any sensible opportunistic attention whore--er, social ambassador-- would do: I directed them to my professional page, and spent the next few days responding to their messages, the good and the bad, with as much decorum, humor and factual information as possible. Not to change their minds, just to take the high road.

It was a bizarre experience, but one I never regretted for a moment. Since I received this much backlash for a single comment, you can only imagine the tidal wave of bigotry, hatred, and threats that was unleashed upon the Hamilton team, and I was proud to have even a small opportunity to stand up for them, for the artistic community as a whole, and most importantly, for every citizen of "the diverse America" that Mr. Dixon's speech referenced.

And at any rate, I've never been the type to let the trolls get me down. When I was a granola-crunching hippie nine-year-old who wanted to save the environment by spending my recess time cleaning up litter, a boy in my class disparagingly called me "Eco-Girl." And I thought, "That would be a great superhero name." So I made her a superhero. And I dressed like her for Halloween.

Likewise, when I had a substantial amount of Hamiltrolls saying, "Boycott Ashley Wool," the thought that naturally followed was,

"Well, that's my album title."

I've been writing songs since I was seven, and this album has been in the works for a long time, but it felt like a directionless endeavor simmering on the back burner of my artistic brain...until that title revealed itself to me.

Now I can't imagine calling it anything else.

Many of my songs are acts of defiance. They are about addressing conflict head-on. They reveal sides of me that aren't always pretty, but are nevertheless real. It's my hope that this album will be, not only a direct extension of my most authentic self, but also a means to allow others to access their authentic selves--even people who don't agree with me.

And what I've noticed about those people is that they always want to boycott people and entities that force them to look at themselves and their values differently. Hamilton. Beyonce. Colin Kaepernick. Planned Parenthood. Target, because of the bathroom thing.

So I say...go ahead. Boycott me. I'm in excellent company.

Is this album going to make the world a better place?

In the words of Pablo Picasso, "Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up."

My work as a performer and a teaching artist (as well as my dad's background as a public school administrative professional) has shown me firsthand the immeasurable value of the performing arts in education, and I am dead tired of people treating the arts like a luxury instead of a necessity. No child should grow up thinking that the arts are worthless...that their artistic talents and passions are worthless...that if they choose to pursue the arts, they will never be taken seriously as full human beings because they "only exist for our entertainment."

Well, I sure don't exist solely for entertainment. That's not all that I am. That's not all I want my album to be.

Therefore, a portion of the profits from this album will be donated to the Center for Arts Education, which is committed to funding and maintaining arts education programs in the New York City public schools.

Where's my money going if I contribute?

Well, in the literal sense, you're helping pay for:

The time, talent and energy of top-notch producers, arrangers, musicians, and co-writers (other than myself)

The equipment we're using in a major NYC recording studio

The distribution costs of digital and hard copies, as well as distribution across streaming platforms such as Spotify and Google Play.

Coffee, probably. (I'm just being honest here.)

But in the metaphorical sense, I'd like to believe that your money is one small-but-mighty way to make a statement to people who...

...say art isn't important

...think that artists cannot or should not use their platforms however they please

...think they have more ownership of those platforms--and by extension, more ownership of us as human beings--than we do.

...erroneously measure your worth as an artist or a person in how much money you make, or what you look like, or whether or not THEY PERSONALLY have ever heard of you.

I'm broke AF. Can I do other stuff to support the project?

Heck yeah! Here are a couple quick and free things you can do right this second, no matter who you are!

Follow me on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and Instagram! Followers help to elevate my profile and make me look famous, so that people with more money than you are more likely to invest in my stuff.

Follow me on Spotify too, and have a listen to some of my old stuff if you feel so inclined. It's much older and has a very different sound from what I'm going for now, but it's still there and it's still decent, I think. (And anytime you stream one of my songs, I make a tiny bit of money. Hey, 0.04 cents is 0.04 cents.)

Share this campaign on your social media accounts. Bonus points if you add some reverse psychology to fit the boycott theme--e.g. "Definitely DO NOT support this artist! She is just another whiny libtard no-talent hack and deserves zero of your heard-earned dollars! #BoycottAshleyWool"

Be an active champion of art and diversity in your daily life. Check out the projects of your other friends in the arts. See a show--there are plenty of free ones out there--even if it's not normally the kind of thing you'd be interested in. Openly challenge people's perceptions on what artists are and what they do and why they do it.

Can I donate perks in lieu of (or in addition to) monetary contribution?

Yes! Absolutely!

I'm most interested in perks that are directly related to the performing arts and artists' needs--for instance, classes or coaching sessions (voice/acting/dance), headshot photography, audition videography, any sort of music production services (transposing, transcribing, studio work, etc.), discounts on studio or performance spaces, show tickets, and the like. But if you have any product or service that you would like to contribute as a perk, please shoot me a message and we will talk!

I'm an artist too! Can I help you make stuff?

Of course you're an artist too! Picasso said you were born that way. And I'm always down for a barter, if you ever need a singer/actress/dancer/writer/barista/teaching artist/babysitter/cat sitter/driver/usher/Disney princess. I'm actively seeking people to do the following:

Become live band members--specifically seeking guitar, bass, percussion, and synths.

Create piano/vocal books of my music, so theatre geeks can use them for pop-rock auditions.

Direct a music video or two, if you're so inspired and inclined.

Help me re-learn the independent music scene, since I've been in semi-retirement from it since 2008ish. Know a great indie radio station or podcast you think my songs would be a fit for? A venue or open-mic event that I simply HAVE to play at? A music blogger or tastemaker who'd love my stuff? The right way to pitch songs to film/TV/Internet projects...or maybe YOUR film or TV project?

Introduce me to Brandon V. Dixon so I can thank him for being an excellent human and for indirectly contributing to my paradigm-shifting fifteen minutes of fame.
story_txt: It all started when Mike Pence......attended Hamilton on Broadway, less than two weeks after we found out he was going to be VP of the United States.After the curtain call, Brandon V. Dixon, the Tony and Grammy nominated actor playing Aaron Burr, addressed him from the stage reading a statement on behalf of the cast, creative team and producers, basically saying, "thank you for coming," and asking him to please address the concerns of "the diverse America who are alarmed and anxious that your new administration will not protect us...and uphold our inalienable rights."You can read the full statement here.As anyone with half a brain cell can see--including Mr. Pence--this incident was neither disruptive nor harassment by any reasonable stretch of the imagination.As anyone with a basic knowledge of the Constitution can see, this was an example of a group of professional artists respectfully exercising their First Amendment rights of freedom of speech, freedom to peaceably assemble, and freedom to petition the government for a redress of grievances.And as anyone involved with the performing arts knows, our work as artists has always gone far beyond just being shallow entertainment manufactured and distributed to turn a buck. And most especially a show like Hamilton.So, as soon as the video of Brandon V. Dixon's statement was posted to the Hamilton Facebook page, I made this comment on the post...which was essentially a more coarsely-worded tl;dr of everything I just said.Woke up the next day to find it had amassed nearly 8,000 likes, and within two days it surpassed 30,000. With this came dozens of replies...and hundreds of angry trolls on my personal page and in my inbox. While I didn't experience any real threats to my safety, I did experience a barrage of belligerent ignorance--mostly people attempting to devalue me as an artist, and by extension devalue the artistic community as a whole.So naturally, I did what any sensible opportunistic attention whore--er, social ambassador-- would do: I directed them to my professional page, and spent the next few days responding to their messages, the good and the bad, with as much decorum, humor and factual information as possible. Not to change their minds, just to take the high road.It was a bizarre experience, but one I never regretted for a moment. Since I received this much backlash for a single comment, you can only imagine the tidal wave of bigotry, hatred, and threats that was unleashed upon the Hamilton team, and I was proud to have even a small opportunity to stand up for them, for the artistic community as a whole, and most importantly, for every citizen of "the diverse America" that Mr. Dixon's speech referenced.And at any rate, I've never been the type to let the trolls get me down. story:
Hello!  My name is Mike (M.T.) Walker.  I'm a singer and songwriter from Toronto.  I am starting a campaign to raise money for my debut album. 

I am not new at music, however, this is a new avenue I am taking a risk on (and it took some coaxing from others who believe in it!).

I was in a band called "Turn off the Stars" in the early 2000's.  We toured a lot and were fortunate enough to play with some pretty well known artists.  Since then I've been focusing on folk songs that represent me.  All of my favourite artists have been able to use their music to reach people in powerful ways.  Music has healed me, taken me somewhere else, and has even changed what I think at times.  My goal is to hopefully create an album that can do the same for my listeners.

If you're a music lover, a friend, or a fan of what I've written in the past, I am asking you to please help me accomplish a dream I've had for the last 10 years (really, ask my wife, its been a well-waited dream!) As a fan of music myself, I have enjoyed being part of a journey an artist has taken.  Please join me in my journey and be a part of getting my music to people.

I have an amazing producer behind me and great musicians ready to contribute.  This all costs money and that is why I need your help.  As a contributor to my project, you will not only receive some pretty great perks for supporting me, you will also become part of an encouraging team of supporters (that I am very much in need of).  I really want this to feel like its not just me doing this on my own, but that I have people believing in me enough to help me make this happen.

The amount of funding I will need is $16,000.00.  This sounds like a lot, however there is a lot going into making this album something really special. I have multiple professional musicians that are willing to lend their talents to the album.  One of them being a very respected violinist and string arranger from Los Angeles.  There are mastering costs, and packaging costs.  Myself and Ben Pelchat, the producer of the album, have decided to manufacture the album in vinyl format.  We feel this will best represent the warm sound I am going for with my music.  All these elements to making the album sure do add up!

If you so graciously decide to give towards the making of my album, there are definitely some great perks once you have given.  When you give, you automatically get a copy of the album, but the perks go up from there.  There are opportunities to have me play a house concert, cover your favourite song on YouTube, have a songwriting session, a personal mention in the liner notes of the album, or even an executive producer credit on the album.

If you aren't able to contribute financially, no problem.  I would love it if you could spread the word about my campaign to friends that you think may be interested. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this. If you would please help me make this album happen, I would be so grateful!

-Mike

story:
We have been producing music as Jazz Spastiks for over 15 years and have released many albums and various projects on a variety of formats.

Together we love to create dusty, jazzy tracks incorporating the elements of classic hip hop and are very grateful to have listeners all over the world.

Our latest project comes in the form of an audio album and a book.

Each song has it's own smell and you can sniff along as you listen!

In our opinion 'Scratch and Sniff' is some of our best work to date and we are really excited about the concept of combining sound with scent!

Both of these senses are very powerful and we believe that together they will create a very unique and memorable experience.

There are various options available whether you want the album on it's own or with the book. 

You can also get Limited Edition T-Shirts, Pin Badges, Scented Candles and Tote Bags!

You will be able to select your size and colour of T-shirt and/or Tote Bag when we are closer to shipping. 

On top of all this you will receive instant download right now of 2 digital tracks from the album with any level of backing that you choose.

Be one of the first to check out 'Fresh Oranges' and 'Bubblegum'!

We can't wait to let people hear (and smell) this project as the music was completed a few months ago and keeping it a secret hasn't been easy!

Now we need to work with the manufacturers to create the special scratch and sniff books which is why we are doing this pre-order through Indiegogo.

Scratch and Sniff involves a process known as micro-encapsulation whereby different fragrances are injected into tiny bubbles and made into an adhesive paste.

Each page in the book has a panel painted with this special paste and the bubbles hold the scent until which time as they are burst by the user scratching the panel.

Creating the books for this project is a unique challenge for which we will be enlisting the services of the country's top experts to ensure a high quality and long lasting product.

You can help us by making a pre-order right now and by sharing this page and video with your friends.

If you need to use paypal please contact us jazzspastiks@gmail.com 

Thanks!!

Jazz Spastiks

story:
About Us:

My name is Rashmy Roshan, I come from the lovely city of Lutz, Florida. I am currently working with a company and  studying voice . I ‘ve also learned to play the Indian flute and violin..

My brother Suraj nair has done the music and he will be directing the video too..

We are  currently raising money for our  music video  “Scooter to Neverland”.  we want to create a visual world for our music and we  would be so grateful for any and every contribution we are able to get in order to put our team's vision to life. 

we will use every penny of the funds to pay for the video and promotion for the video.  Even if we are unable to reach our goal of $4000, we will still use whatever money we have raised towards the video.  we  need this amount of money in order to make the quality of the video we are looking to make, so that we  can reach a vast audience. 

Aside from donations, sharing this project and our music will help us more than you know! 

The Plan

It was my brother who composed the song . It was written by his friend Sid . I have lend voice to it . the model who we have agreed to act in the video is a Filipino named Angel,. … if you like my music or are blood related to me then please donate. If you can't donate then just give the campaign a share and kick up a bit of fuss around it. I promise I will make the best album I possibly can with whatever funds I get

About the Campaign

In 1999 my dad passed away leaving his old scooter in the garage. My brother drove it for a couple of years and then as time went by he moved from 2 wheeler to 4 wheeler.  During one Christmas day when my brother called me up in US and told me about a theme on which he is working I was really excited. The song was based on a scooter and a girls passion to ride. The song is about 2.34 min , a short one but definitely the video would give you a nostalgia , for those who have rode the old vespa and chetak scooters.. 

The scooter we have in mind is a Yamaha Fino sports (really cute ..check our teaser video)

What You Get

With your contributions come great perks! For only $7 you receive the audio download.  If you donate more, you can receive autographed photos,printed T shirts and scooter replicas and shout-outs on my social media! If you would like to go the extra mile, you can be the associate producer  (which receives all the said things above plus online album credits), and a personal thank you!

 

Risks & Challenges

I have started pre production with a talented editor at Silvermist  in India. He has worked with Indian film industry.  I have already recorded the music and it is under the last stage of mastering. I want to make the best Video album possible and to do that I have to hire technicians, camera crew and model. Whatever money I get from this will be going straight to recording video, post production work etc..

I need to plan the travel, plan the exact places i need to shoot the video, the camera equipments, permission from the concerned heads to shoot video on public roads. post production works and model remuneration.,

Sharing is Caring!

Please don't forget to share my campaign with your friends and family with Indiegogo's share tools.

story:
Short Summary

For over five years,  we have been travelling North America wide, sharing the songs that God has given us to powerfully touch lives of all nationalities.  We have received testimonies from all over the world of the joy, faith, inspiration, healing and presence of God that our music has brought to listeners.

While we have added two instrumental albums to our discography since 2013 (The Heavenly Peace, 2014; and Beginnings, 2015), we have not released a full album with vocals since Visions of Messiah in 2013. Everywhere we travel, people are continually requesting that anointed blend of heavenly vocals and inspired violin.  It is the fusion of these two that has most ministered to people through our concerts and previous recordings.

Draw Me Close has been much anticipated. We have been sharing many of the songs continent- wide for over two years, and after every event, the question is "When is this CD coming out?"  This is where YOU come in! 

By supporting this campaign, you will be helping us release powerful and anointed new music that has the potential to reach into tens of thousands of homes worldwide.  You will be helping to bring healing, comfort, joy, encouragement and most importantly, the Word of God, into the lives of thousands who truly need it.

The Project

Draw Me Close, Dan and Melissa's first vocal worship CD since Visions of Messiah (2013) will be a unique project in that it is an international collaborative effort between “next generation” Messianic believers from Canada, the U.S. and Israel.  The project includes not only Dan and Melissa’s anointed songs and styles, but also the contributions of:

  • Eli Ben Moshe (Future Vision Studios, Israel), editing and mastering
  • Andrew Gudgeon (Messianic worship leader, Maryland), guitars
  • David Wein (Rabbi in training, Virginia), songwriting
  • Scott Ogden (Messianic songwriter, Canada), songwriting
  • and others

The album is inherently Messianic: beginning with the Sh’ma; ending with the Aaronic Blessing; and centering on the person of Yeshua (Jesus).  Both powerful and intimate, filled with victory and faith, and focused on the Word, we believe that this album will be a tremendous blessing to the body of Messiah.

Songlist:

Sh’ma (Deut. 6:4)
Against Your Enemies (Deut. 20:3-4)
El Shaddai (Psalm 91)
Hodu L’Adonai (Psalm 136)
Draw Me Close (Psalm 27, Jaacov/James 4:8)
Yeshua (1 Corinthians 6:19-20)
Peaceful (Isaiah 26:3, Psalm 1)
Blessed is the Man (Jeremiah 17:7)
Message on the Hills (Mark 1:22)
We Wait / O Mighty One (Psalm 33, Psalm 24)
Aaronic Blessing (Numbers 6:24-26)
Bonus: Karaive Oti Elaicha  (Psalm 27, Jaacov/James 4:8)

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $15,000 CAD toward the release of this album.

  • $7000 Recording time, musicians
  • $4000 Editing and Mastering
  • $1500  Production of first 1000 copies
  • $1500  Promotion and Advertising (including printing songbooks)
  • $1000 Indigogo campaign administrative fees

The Impact

When we hear testimonies (via e-mail, written letters, messages on Facebook) of how people have been touched and blessed  by our music, it reminds us how urgent it is that we continue going strong in this calling and that we release this much-awaited CD.

Risks & Challenges

Over the past year, there have been delays in the recording process of this album -- mostly related to having a young family and a very busy travel itinerary. We have made consistent progress on the recording since August, and are now reaching the final stages (vocals and violin). We are committed to completing this album and therefore see the challenges being minimal at this particular time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to give at this time, perhaps you can prayerfully spread the word to a friend who sees the value of anointed new music and who may want to sow into this project whatsoever the spirit would lead them to give. 

Thank You and God Bless You!

story:
Nine Toes the Bard 

The song that started it all, "Nine Toes the Bard" written August 2015, is a story of a Bard with the unfortunate curse that no one can remember her name.  A Muse was born, and her story began to unfold.  In June 2016, I (Mama Gina) wound up in a St. Louis, MO hospital and lost a toe.  And now, I am truly Nine Toes the Bard.  Her world is amazing, her companions are genuinely strong and humorous, the music is astounding!  We are quite healthy now, and as I've toured this year, Nine Toes has taken the stage ... and she's ready for her very own first full length CD.

Nine Toes makes these Bardic tales and characters come to life with each performance, and we want to share the music with the world.  You likely already know this, and I'll say it again ... good studio time, a great engineer with an awesome ear, recording, extra-special musicians, quality production, mixing, mastering, printing beautiful and great-sounding CDs ... that takes a LOT of time (which we have plenty of) and a bit of money to achieve (that's where you come in).  Nine Toes can take over the world - YES!  World domination! Oh, um, I mean, make an absolutely fabulous CD that EVERYONE will want to hear over and over again ... with your help!  

DONATE AND GET FABULOUS STUFF IN RETURN!

You'll be rewarded for your generosity. Be ye Pirate, Dragon Lover, Naughty, or just love the Bard, there are perks for every one of you.  You'll choose to receive the music as a CD or digitally, and there are specially designed T-shirts and stickers.  There is graphic art inspired by Nine Toes the Bard and created especially for YOU - can anyone say, "I want THAT DRAGON art print on my wall!"??  There are even opportunities to hang out with the Bard in studio and join The Floggin' Frog Chorus on a couple songs.  

Speakin' of The Floggin' Frog, there are four songs that will be recorded, that will not be on the CD.  They are the Nine Toes Naughty, and will be available as a digital download for those of you who DARE!  

Please check out all the rewards, find the donation amount that is right for you, and support this very worthy Bard.

WHAT WILL I DO WITH YOUR DONATIONS?

$5,000 is truly needed to fund the creation of this CD.  I tour year round, sharing my Muse at festivals, shops, and house concerts, and while I have enough to pay my car insurance and my cell phone bill, and the occasional vehicle repair, most of my budget on the road goes to getting to the next gig.  I LOVE THIS LIFE, but I'm not gettin' rich.  A good day is breaking even and a warm bed to sleep in (and I do so love your generosity in opening your homes and hearths to me as I travel).  Alas, there is no extra for recording ... 

Studio time, paying my lovely engineer and a couple of very fine musicians to play a couple of sweet tracks, recording, mixing and mastering - all that will cost around $3,000.

Printing the actual CDs will be roughly $1,500.

And $500 should cover promotional/marketing stuff, T-shirts, and stickers.

This is a very tight budget, and my very incredible graphic artist is donating his time and talent to this project.  

That's the bare bones.  We aren't doing anything fancy, and yet, we'll create the absolutely BEST CD that we are able to produce!  And YOU will make it possible.  And you will get great music in return.

WORLD DOMINATION - ER, A FABULOUS NINE TOES THE BARD CD

Seriously, Nine Toes is a TRUE BARD.  Her stories, her songs, her life will touch you and you will be changed by her music.  Yes, there are drinking songs.  Yes, there are hilarious stories.  And there is music that will make you weep ... that will make you think ... that will make you want to find your own voice and step out bravely into the world and make a difference.  That's what this comes down to.  Nine Toes and I want to make this CD because we think ... no, we KNOW that this music will make a positive impact, will make a true and good difference in the world.

So, please support Nine Toes, choose your donation amount and rewards, and join us on this journey to create this CD.

HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP?

Glad you asked!  Share Nine Toes' story and our need for a little of the King's silver with all your friends and family - Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest - just share this page with EVERYONE!  Get on the e-mail list at www.mamaginamusic.com and get updates on all our adventures.  Check out the tour dates there, and come to a festival or concert, or host your own Nine Toes the Bard house concert!  Throw a Pirate Party, and bring the Bard!  And if you have a little time on your hands, and you're pretty good with this social media thing, I could use a couple extra hands gettin' the word out ... email me at mnemosyne7@hotmail.com and ask me how you can get on board with the Bard!

MUCH LOVE AND THE BARD'S DEEPEST GRATITUDE

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for taking the time to connect here.  One more time ... 'cause the marketing folks say I should mention it again ... YOU CAN HELP THIS BARD by getting the word out and by donating.  You'll be fabulously rewarded and you'll have my eternal gratitude.

PLEASE DONATE NOW!

Nine Toes the Bard and Mama Gina

story:
WOMEN IN JAZZ JAM FESTIVAL is back!

Sing Something!

We must continue to lift each other up. When we do, the quality of life for everyone improves.

As an artist you are always learning. And After years of performing and studying jazz, Kelle Jolly came to the conclusion that the contributions of women are often left out of the story jazz.

We all know Louis Armstrong, but maybe only a few are aware that  is wife Lil Hardin Armstrong was an accomplished pianist who encouraged him to work harder. He become the star the world fell in love with. Big band fans are familiar with Count Basie and Woody Herman bands but what about the Sweethearts of Rhythm, an all girl, multi racial big band of the 1940’s?

Kelle began to think about how this trend was affecting women in her own community. Who would lift up these women?

The idea for the Women in Jazz Jam Festival was born.

With no budget and a mighty vision, Kelle created a Facebook event with a date set in March, Women’s History Month. That Facebook event sparked the curiosity of many. She began to meet with supporters, many of whom were leaders in their organizations and businesses. A fundraising campaign was started.  A women led band was assembled. Regional artists like Christina Watson and Dara Tucker… Venus the all girl band, were invited to perform.

Women artists from all around  this region came to Knoxville, TN to collaborate, fellowship and showcase their talents. Attendance at the Knoxville Museum of Arts on the first night of the festival exceeded expectations with the biggest crowd in 10 years!

Audiences left every night of the festival feeling like they had experienced something unforgettable.

So many friendships have grown from this experience. Paths to other performance opportunities have been made. 

Overwhelmed is the best word to describe the feeling of planning a festival for the first time and having so many women sign up to play, volunteer, design, market, and plan together. The process felt organic and natural. And from it grew a network of women in jazz who  support each other in so many ways. Obviously the participants came away feeling inspired, but so were the men who played and volunteered. Some men made remarks like, "We needed to see that!"

The next Women in Jazz Jam Festival is March 10-12. #Don’t leave the women behind! Donate OR Sponsor today.

$10,000 is our goal!

We appreciate you and remember, if you don’t support we don’t exist.

Sharing this campaign with family and friends gives us more visibility. It also inspires those who are looking for a way to participate in making art . That helps so much. Thank you!

LIKE us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/WomeninJazzJamFestival/

FOLLOW us on TWITTER! https://twitter.com/WomeninJazzJam

www.womeninjazzjamfestival.com

story:
Hello!

We are Forest Floor Music Production, a music production company based in the Midlands. 

Many of us have strong Scouting and GirlGuiding links, and have grown up singing these songs - and we can't believe these songs are so hard to find on CD! We're so excited to create an album that will bring the atmosphere of being at a campfire into our everyday lives. 

We know we're not the only ones who feel this way, so we want everyone who loves these songs to be involved in this project! 

There will be a lot of time, effort and expenses involved in making this a reality. We can't make it on our own - but with your support we will be able to do these songs justice...

We are going to be crowdfunding £3000. This will go towards: studio hire, recording equipment hire, paying studio musicians and singers, CD duplication, creating the artwork, advertising/promotion, mastering costs, etc etc!! 

Your Involvement

At this stage, we are still looking for your input as to what you want from the CD. 

Please send us your thoughts in this short survey: surveymonkey.co.uk/r/SMSC69J 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a financial contribution, you can still be a BIG help. 

  • Like our Facebook page: facebook.com/campfiresburning 
  • Share our Facebook! Invite your GirlGuiding/Scouting/Campfiring friends to like it too, and make a noise about it socially! Use the hashtag #campfiresburning on Social Media. 
  • Find people to take our survey! surveymonkey.co.uk/r/SMSC69J
  • If you're involved in a group, you could talk to them about the album - it could even interlink with a Music badge or similar!

story:
Short Summary

   Vinyl is a very expensive endeavor and In order to make this a reality, We ask that those of you who have an interest in owning one of these limited edition copies of "Shackled and Enslaved" Simply Pre-order the record. This will allow us to fund this release and ensure you have direct access to it as well. This limited run will be hand numbered.

 

  For those of you who dont know who we are (I dont see how that could be if you are here but...) We are The New Plague, A Death Metal band Formed in the mid 90's, Dropped onto the Sacramento, CA metal scene and quickly ascended to being a well known and liked, seasoned trio of blackened death metal. We are a signed band on an indie label "Deathgasm Records" out of Georgia, but are taking this release into our own hands. In Light of a 3rd coming full length album in the works, we have decided to release out first and second record in limited quantities as a primer for your new album.

  • You want this record
  • If you don't get this record now, You might not get one
  • You will be a direct part of the creation of this LP version of Shackled and Enslaved

   We are not asking for help from anyone not wanting this album. WE WANT YOU TO WANT IT! We want you to look forward to putting this on your turn table and cranking it up like you might have done back when you first got the CD. In order to make this even more special, we will offer a few levels of commitment that will include some really cool perks. Keep reading:

     This record will cost more than this campaign is set at. Our ultimate goal is a gate fold 180gram LP. If the interest isnt there, we will release a standard LP regardless. lets not do that!
 
     Be a part of this and Pre-order you copy!
 
-The New Plague

story:
Short Summary

My name is Brian Teubl a husband, father and singer/songwriter from Cleveland, Ohio.          I have been in love with music all of my life and have always wanted to record an album of my original songs. I have played within several local bands since high school and have been a primary songwriter in each of them. 

I became a father in 2014 and welcome my second son this year in May. With a family it is difficult to financially support my musical goals and aspirations.

With your support I will be able to record and release an album of great quality to share with the world!

What I Need & What You Get

  • I am in need of $3,500 for the project. This will go towards the recording of a 6 song EP album, artwork and creation of a physical CD of the album.
  • Each contributor will get a physical copy of the album and their name listed in the album sleeve! (See Perks for More Information)
  • If the entire goal is not reached I will donate it to the Scleroderma Foundation (http://www.scleroderma.org). Scleroderma is a disease that my Aunt had passed away from at a young age in 2001.

The Impact

I have always wanted the world to hear my music but to hear it in a professional sounding way. I feel this album could be the stepping stone for a musical career and or showcasing my songwriting to potentially work with professional songwriters.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If unable to contribute I just ask if you could at the least please get the word out and make some noise about this project, I would greatly appreciate it!
  • There are simple to use Indiegogo share tools that can make sharing easy!
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Brian Teubl a husband, father and singer/songwriter from Cleveland, Ohio.          I have been in love with music all of my life and have always wanted to record an album of my original songs. I have played within several local bands since high school and have been a primary songwriter in each of them. 
I became a father in 2014 and welcome my second son this year in May. With a family it is difficult to financially support my musical goals and aspirations.
With your support I will be able to record and release an album of great quality to share with the world!

What I Need & What You Get

I am in need of $3,500 for the project. This will go towards the recording of a 6 song EP album, artwork and creation of a physical CD of the album.
Each contributor will get a physical copy of the album and their name listed in the album sleeve! (See Perks for More Information)
If the entire goal is not reached I will donate it to the Scleroderma Foundation (http://www.scleroderma.org). Scleroderma is a disease that my Aunt had passed away from at a young age in 2001.


The Impact
I have always wanted the world to hear my music but to hear it in a professional sounding way. I feel this album could be the stepping stone for a musical career and or showcasing my songwriting to potentially work with professional songwriters.

Other Ways You Can Help

If unable to contribute I just ask if you could at the least please get the word out and make some noise about this project, I would greatly appreciate it!
There are simple to use Indiegogo share tools that can make sharing easy!

story:
Jeannine Higgins' Debut Album

Thank you for being part of the community that brings my songs to life, and out into the world!

  • I have been singing and involved in music since I was a child. I studied cello and piano as a child and sang in choirs all while growing up in Bucks County, PA.  I put my passion for music on hold while raising my 3 boys.  Now I live in Texas and 5 years ago I started to play guitar and sing again at open mics. Soon I played my own shows at local Houston, TX venues.
  •  My life's passion has been to sing and to write songs.
  • Your contributions will make my lifetime dream come true.  Thank you.

What We Need 

We estimate that we will need approximately $7500 to cover the cost of  producing this album and getting it out to the public. We hope to raise a minimum of $3500. Here is what we are paying for:

  • Recording, Mixing, and Mastering of 8 songs by producer 
  • CD Baby - Digital Distribution
  • Disk Makers - CD production and CD Covers
  • Facebook Advertisements  
  • Krowdster 
  • Media Research and Press Releases
  • Studio Musicians 

What Perks Do You Get to Choose From?

-A download of my song "Would You?"

-A download of my debut CD

-A CD copy of my debut album

-An autographed  CD of my debut album with personal note

-A recorded copy of the cover song of your choice sung by me and a copy of my debut CD

-An acoustic house concert

-A full band house concert

 

Here are my songs...listen...

https://www.reverbnation.com/jeanninehiggins

 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We moved our fundraiser to Indiegogo to give us additional time to promote the new CD. 

We do not have to raise the entire $3500 in the goal with Indiegogo. We will be able to keep whatever we receive whether it is above or below $3500.  No matter what we raise, we are thankful for your support.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share my campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and other Social Media outlets
  • If you liked listening to my music share my campaign with local radio stations and press.  
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for helping make my dream come true!
