story:
SCRAPE Records is back and ready to launch!

With your support, SCRAPE Records is gearing up on our 20th Anniversary to raise 20k to combine with our own investment to assist SCRAPE Records - The Label release its first 4 SCRAPE Records titles planned in multiple formats for the first half of 2018 and beyond!

We have 1k, 5k, 10k, 15k, targets set along the way to get us to 20k, including a bonus 25k goal! You can find these targets and their details down below. Your support will help create SCRAPE Records - The Label! 

Deadline is Midnight New Year's Eve!

Your contributions will go directly towards our costs of production, licensing, manufacturing, distribution, shipping, marketing, advertising, publicity, management, web design, graphic design, social media, legal fees, insurance, accounting, office space, and signing new talent.

In return for your contributions, we have tons of wicked product for purchase that's not available anywhere else to get us to our respective targets listed below. However, it's not necessary to make a purchase to contribute. 

Distributors and wholesalers! Please contact us for volume deals!

You have the power! We have the know-how, drive and network. We're counting on the "DISCIPLE" to help SCRAPE reach its full potential! Buy some crap! Tax included!

Climb aboard "DISCIPLES" and get ready for the ZH ride!

It's not only SCRAPE Records' 20th Anniversary, it's also the 20th Anniversary of ZIMMERS HOLE’s debut album “Bound By Fire”,

SCRAPE Records are proud to announce their first label signing... ZIMMERS HOLE!

With your help, SCRAPE Records will reissue all 3 ZIMMERS HOLE albums on limited edition CD and Vinyl through the first half of 2018 and fresh ZH merchandise coming soon! All reissues and bundles will be available exclusively through SCRAPE Records.

Not available in stores! Limited supply! Limited pressings!

Plus a brand new ZIMMERS HOLE studio album on SCRAPE Records in late 2018!

Lots of stellar packages in the works! 

For those unaware, ZIMMERS HOLE  is a Vancouver-based band/project featuring guitarist Jed Simon aka "El Smooche" (STRAPPING YOUNG LAD, SCAR THE MARTYR, VIMIC) and bassist Byron Stroud aka "Sickie Moochmaster" (STRAPPING YOUNG LAD, FEAR FACTORY, 3 INCHES OF BLOOD) alongside legendary drummer Gene Hoglan aka "The Atomic Clock" (STRAPPING YOUNG LAD, TESTAMENT, DETHKLOK, DEATH, DARK ANGEL) and front-devil Chris Valagao aka "Lorde Heathen" (WEST OF HELL).

This will be a collaborative effort between SCRAPE Records and ZIMMERS HOLE, repackaging and reissuing limited edition pressings of the entire ZH catalogue (pending our various target goals down below) on CD, and for the very first time on VINYL!

"BOUND BY FIRE" is available now for pre-order in multiple configurations and bundles including various coloured 180 gram Vinyl in gatefold sleeves, hand-numbered, special edition CD Digi-Books / Vinyl autographed by the band, T-shirts and more! 

Each ZIMMERS HOLE reissue will feature original artwork along with additional and new liner notes, photos from the band, thoughts from long-time ZH friend/collaborator/producer DEVIN TOWNSEND.

New artwork and layout from acclaimed-artist TRAVIS SMITH (Opeth, Katatonia, Death, Nevermore). Check item descriptions on sidebar for more details. ETA March 2018

Pre-orders for "Bound By Fire" and other exclusive ZH items available now! 

Personal items from Lorde Heathen, Jed Simon, Byron Stroud and Gene Hoglan have been added as exclusive "Perks" to this campaign. More to come!

Here are the targets we need to hit along the way. These targets are a must or bust. We can do this! Deadline is Midnight New Years Eve!

1k Target

New ZH Logo T-shirts in Mens and Women's designs will be manufactured. ETA - Dec 2017

5k Target  

SCRAPE Records will release SCRAPE Records - The Label fundraising campaign vinyl sampler slated for Spring 2018 featuring SCRAPE's first label signing ZIMMERS HOLE along with more bands TBA.

Only 100 will be pressed and you can get your name in the liner notes! Only available with your contribution. 

If your band is interested in getting on the SCRAPE sampler, please drop us a line at orders@scraprecords.com 

All funds raised by these SCRAPE samplers will go directly into developing, expanding, growing the label, distribution, signing more bands and more. ETA - March 2018

10k Target   

SCRAPE Records will reissue and release ZIMMERS HOLE's debut album "Bound By Fire" on special edition CD limited to (500 hand-numbered) and for the first time on 180 gram Vinyl available on Limited Edition Black Vinyl (300 hand-numbered) and even more limited Red Vinyl (200 hand-numbered) housed in thick gatefold sleeves. Autographed original album cover art inserts available. Vinyl test pressings will also be available. ETA March 2018

15k Target 

SCRAPE Records will reissue and release ZIMMERS HOLE's second album "Legion Of Flames" on special edition CD and for the first time on 180 gram Vinyl housed in gatefold sleeves. Colours TBA. Autographed album cover art inserts available. Vinyl test pressings will also be available. 

20k Target

SCRAPE Records will reissue and release ZIMMERS HOLE's third album "When You Were Shouting At The Devil...We Were In League With Satan" on special edition CD and for the first time on 180 gram Vinyl housed in gatefold sleeves. Colours TBA. Autographed album cover art inserts available. Vinyl test pressings also be available. 

25k BONUS TARGET 

SCRAPE Records - The Label Launch Party and Concert headlined by ZIMMERS HOLE in 2018! 

Serious work begins on the brand new ZIMMERS HOLE studio album on SCRAPE Records.

SCRAPE Records - The Label will focus on specializing in limited edition/small run pressings on various formats. Once they're gone, they're gone. You snooze, you're not METAL. All product will have a high attention to detail. Including, but not limited to, coloured vinyl, digi-paks/books, assorted inserts, autographed product, clothing, paraphernalia and more. 

As fans ourselves, we know the quality and attention to detail you expect and SCRAPE can deliver. We have loads of killer ideas on how to make SCRAPE unique and stand out from the rest. However, these ideas do come at a cost. With your help, we can raise the additional funds and in return you'll get some wicked product!

SCRAPE Records - The Label will stay true to its roots working with bands of the Progressive, Death, Glam, Thrash, Fusion, Power, Viking, Shred, Speed, Doom, Black Metal and Hard Rock variety. We are currently in discussions of signing some bands. Send more our way! 

SCRAPE Records and ZIMMERS HOLE and  future label signings thank you in advance for your support. Every little bit helps and it all ads up. Support your METAL! 

We Ain't Done!

Check out our plethora of exclusive funding packages that are only available through this campaign featuring a variety of rare, autographed and one-of-a-kind items available from such artists as ZIMMERS HOLE, DEVIN TOWNSEND, ENSLAVED, HELLYEAH, SABATON, GRAVEYARD, OBITUARY and from SCRAPE Records! 

Need more crap?

You can also support us by making a purchase at our SCRAPE Discogs store featuring nearly 5000 new CDs and Vinyl. These titles are available and ready to ship now!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our target goal is 20K. We think this is attainable, but only with your help. Without the "DISCIPLE" there is no 'SCRAPE". Deadline is Midnight New Years Eve!

  • SCRAPE has nearly 5000 "Likes" on Facebook alone. If 1000 of those "Likes" or 1/5 of our total "Likes" each contribute $20, we'll reach our 20k goal!

  • 500 "Disciples" contribute $40 each, we'll reach our 20k goal! 

  • 666 "Disciples" contribute $30 each, we'll reach our 20k goal! 

  • In the unfortunate event we don't reach our 20K or our 5K goal, it will definitely slow down our progress and we'll have to adjust our budgets accordingly. We have tons of wicked ideas! You can make them a reality! Spread the word!

  • In the unfortunate event this campaign totally tanks (less than 5k), SCRAPE will still honour all items purchased through this campaign that isn't a ZIMMERS HOLE reissue or SCRAPE Vinyl sampler. 

  • ​We can also accept your contributions via E-transfer or Paypal to orders@scraperecords.com

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Any assistance you can provide with sharing this campaign in your various Social Media feeds would be much appreciated. It all helps!

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

  • Let's kill this together! Let's build on the loyalty and support you've shown SCRAPE for 20 years! 

  • SCRAPE's success is your success! Let's show the World that METAL is alive in Western Canada! Let's destroy this before New Years Eve!

story:
Short Summary

We are a band, we call us Death By Horse and we play Punk Rock! :D

We got great reviews on our first album and were nominated for best newcomers. Everything we have done to this point is made by our own sweat, tears and money. Now, in the process of making the second album, we want to step it up! Thats why we need your help! We really need your sweat and your tears, but first, we need your money! :D

What we want to do is record drums in a studio  and get the whole album mixed and mastred.

What You can get is our love, our music with the best possible sound ever... and some cool stuff!!

Check out our perks! I know you don't wanna miss this!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The total cost for this project is 5029 €. 

Recording drums: 1472 €

Mixing: 2944 €

Mastering: 613 €

 

OUR PERKS

  • Surprice

This is super fun! It can be anything... allmost! could be a crazy item signed by us, could be something totaly different. Are you a daredevil? ;)

  • T-shirt

This is our fabulous t-shirt, with the perfect fit for every human on this earth! Not tested on animals! :P 

  • CD

This is the uppcoming album in a nice CD press! The more money we get, the more fabulous the press and cover will get! You know you want it! :*

  • Video shout out

Do you want to be heard? Do you want the world to know that we love you? Well, no problem! With this perk you'll get a personal video that we post on our Facebookpage. We promise to make it special! :D

  • Painting

Let the painter out in us! Let us make you a special painting, just for you! Remeber that you will be the only person in the world with this masterpiece on the wall!

  • Special package

Can't decide?? Pas problemas my friend! With this package you get all of the above, and a personal written letter, just for YOU! couse we love you. yes!

  • Date

Fancy anybody special in the band? Or do you want us all? Or maby you just wanna show off with you cool rockstar date! ;) Then this is the perk for you! Wedding pics can be included! 

  • Tattoo on you, made by us

Do you want us to mark you for life, or just get under our hands? Let's hang out and have a fun tattoo day!

  • Tattoo on us, made by you

Tired of billboards? Why not put your stuff on a body insted? We will be your billboard! Lets hang out and have a crazy day! We have the machine, you have the idea!

  • Livingroom live show

Is your stereo broken?? No problems dude! With this perk we will come and play for you and your friends! Lets hang out and have a crazy day! 

 

You are so important

What would we be without each other? We nead each other! Everybody is a brick in a domino game! Today you help us, tomorrow somone helps you! It's as simple as that. We are here together, lets make it as cool as possible, with great music & great people. All is one!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Ain't got no casch? I know how it feels!

But you can help us in oh so many other ways!

per example:

  • Talk about us!
  • Write about us!
  • Make comments!
  • Listen to us!
  • Love us!
  • Hate us!
  • SHARE, share, share!

STAY COOL! :*

Do you want us to mark you for life, or just get under our hands? Let's hang out and have a fun tattoo day!
Tattoo on us, made by you
Tired of billboards? Why not put your stuff on a body insted? We will be your billboard! Lets hang out and have a crazy day! We have the machine, you have the idea!
Livingroom live show
Is your stereo broken?? No problems dude! With this perk we will come and play for you and your friends! Lets hang out and have a crazy day! 
 

You are so important
What would we be without each other? We nead each other! Everybody is a brick in a domino game! Today you help us, tomorrow somone helps you! It's as simple as that. We are here together, lets make it as cool as possible, with great music & great people. All is one!
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Ain't got no casch? I know how it feels!
But you can help us in oh so many other ways!
per example:

Talk about us!
Write about us!
Make comments!
Listen to us!
Love us!
Hate us!
SHARE, share, share!

STAY COOL! :*

story:
We are Skyfoot, a four-piece jamband from Boston, MA.  We’re thrilled to announce our third full-length album, Blindly On Through.  It was recorded in February at The Rotary Records in western Massachusetts and features nine original songs in a totally collaborative effort from start to finish.  It's all set to be released this August and we know it's our best work yet!

What We Need

We’re looking to raise $5,000 to recover recording costs, print CD's, promote the release, and tour the open road this summer bringing you the live versions of these songs.  Every penny that we collect in this fundraising effort will be utilized to get our music out to as many listeners and potential fans as possible!  This is our very first crowdfunding campaign in our seven year history and we're looking to YOU to help us out in this new and exciting way.  We're extremely lucky to have an amazing network of family, friends, and fans.  Here's hoping we reach our fundraising goal and bring more music to the world.

 

What You Get

Check out all of the various perks you can receive with your contribution:

  • Physical & digital copies of Blindly On Through (2018)
  • Physical copies of our first two albums, Eternal Bend (2012) & Room For Space (2014)
  • Skyfoot logo T-Shirts of all sizes
  • Signed copies of the album and album poster (11X17)
  • Stickers + handwritten "thank you" letter!

 

ALL SHIPPING IN THE U.S.A. IS FREE!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If a money contribution is not in the cards, you can still help out by sharing this campaign with your friends, social networks, and email lists.  Check out and use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out. Thank you for your generosity!

 

- Aaron, Eric, James, & Tyler

story:
SopraDuo and Emma Logan at The Music by Women Festival

 

Meet SopraDuo and Emma Logan

 

SopraDuo (Alexandra Iranfar, guitar and soprano & Timothy Sherren, guitar) is a unique ensemble dedicated to expanding the repertoire of music for two guitars and voice. Emma Logan is a Bay Area composer and curator of music, whose interests include presenting music by women. We recently commissioned Emma Logan to write us a song cycle based on the poetry of Sara Teasdale.

We were accepted to perform  Emma's song cycle at this year’s Music by Women Festival in Mississippi. We are very excited for the three day festival of performances, lectures, workshops all focusing on music by women. This year’s festival couldn’t come at a better time, as the national conversation centers on the role of women in the creative arts. 

Impact

  • Leading new music ensembles are programming only 8-22 percent of music by women, according to an article from New Music Box. This is a problem not only for women composers, but also for the performers and audience members who are missing untold musical voices. 
  • The responsibility shouldn’t only be given to women to advocate for themselves. It's up to everyone to listen and join the conversation.
  • We hope the further that conversation in Mississippi, and come away with concrete ideas and plans to close the gender programming gap.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Your support will help fund our travel and stay in Mississippi for the Music by Women Festival, which takes place March 1-3.
  • We have perks for all levels, including a personalized thank you on our Facebook and Instagram, SopraDuo’s unreleased CD, which features Emma Logan’s music, and even a house concert by SopraDuo! 

Challenges & Successes

  • Fundraising is always a challenge. Musicians rarely like advocating for themselves, especially when it comes to talking about money. However, we feel this is an extremely important cause, not just to us, but for everyone in the performing arts world.
  • We have met large fundraising goals in the past, including grant awards, as well as commissioning new instruments and music from composers. If we do not meet this flexible goal, the funding will still go towards our travel expenses. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us meet our goal by sharing this Indiegogo campaign with others!

Thank you, and see you in Mississippi!

story:
Hello Everyone!

Thanks for reading my thing! I have been obsessing over this for a long time so I will now go ahead and put all my cards on the table..
Basically, late last year I finally plucked up the courage to start a music project under the name Velveteen and finally got to work on some unfinished musings. Luckily enough my first demo received a little bit of love from the public so Im hoping now to take that next step and reach out to the US and record my debut EP. 
"Mess" (above) Is a song about being in a relationship with somebody who tends to drag up the past, Its a harsh reality and predicament, something I believe many of us can relate to. I tend to write from my personal experiences and switch them around so that I can stand in the shoes of the other person and see both sides of the story. Performing and Writing music makes me feel free, It helps me cope. 

I can't imagine not performing and writing music. To me, it's not a want, it's a need. A melody might pop into my head, and I just have to write it down or i'll go insane. And there's nothing in the world like writing something and performing it for a musician whom you respect, and having them say, "wow, you wrote that? that was beautiful." Not that I write just for a positive response. writing music is like... hm. having a child I guess. It's whiny, It's needy, It takes up all your time to feed the stinking thing but then you get to watch as the child grows and matures. You give of yourself but receive so much in return.

Ive always had a longing to travel overseas to pursue music. With your kind donations - you will not only help me achieve the great goal of making this happen, but furthermore; you will allow my inner visions to come to life as I've always dreamt they could!
I believe when an opportunity shows up and it feels right, you gotta go with it!


“I have not always chosen the safest path. I've made my mistakes, plenty of them. I sometimes jump too soon and fail to appreciate the consequences. But I've learned something important along the way: I've learned to heed the call of my heart. I've learned that the safest path is not always the best path and I've learned that the voice of fear is not always to be trusted.” 
― Steve Goodier

What the funds will be used for

Pay for session musicians overseas

Recording time & engineer 

Mastering & mixing 

Anything left over would be used to film a music video for my new track Mess!

Those who know me know I'm a hardworking Individual and usually not the one to ask for help, But I figure I would give it a shot! and to be frank I need your help

I am aiming to make it there this year! every bone in my body wants this so badly and ANY support is greatly appreciated. 

Thank you so much to those who have already loved and supported me and I hope this adventure makes you as excited as I am! Please help get the word out there! 

Lets do this! 
xx V xx




A bit about Velveteen

Velveteen was born in late 2014 and is the electronic indie solo project of Keira Jane Ephraims.


Velveteen checked out early from her Modelling career and began her music journey after performing at East West Studios in Los Angeles, a creative haven which has housed the projects of Michael Jackson, Madonna and the Rolling Stones. 



She returned to Perth, Australia forming the five piece indie pop band that has been distinguishing themselves in the Western Australian music industry though their dynamic sound and versatile original music. 



Velveteen made it's industry debut in mid 2014 at the sold out Astor Theatre which has catered to artists such as Chet Faker, Kimbra and Cat Empire. With some very exciting support slots coming up and a few new hit songs on the way,
Velveteen is one to watch out for. 




Testimonial
"The song might be called Mess but the music most certainly isn't. This perfectly timed, well executed masterpiece is the debut demo single from Perth artist Velveteen Jones (real name Keira Ephraims). The overall vibe - a crossover falling somewhere near electro, fairly close to indie and not too far afield from pop - is the magic that you hope for in an artist. You'll definitely remember this one."
-Mahalia Lovell (Love 'EM blog)

Thankyou so much for supporting me!

Keep your eyes peeled for the up and comings on Velveteens Facebook Page
New music will be uploaded to Velveteens Soundcloud Page

story:
About Rachael

Hello everyone! My name is Rachael and I'm a 23 year old singer-songwriter. For years I've been writing songs, playing the guitar, and improving my craft. Music has had a tremendous impact in my life and I'm at a place where I'm ready to share my songs with you.

I'm at the beginning stages of starting my music career and a very important facet of that is having actual music people can listen to. That is why I plan to release a 4 song ep titled The Status of Things.

What I Need & What You Get

Starting out as an independent artist means I have to work from the ground up, and recording music is not an inexpensive thing to do. All of the money will be going towards the production of the ep: studio time, mixing, mastering, and all of that fancy stuff. Time really is money!
I'm committed to doing everything I can to make this successful, but I do need your help whether you plan to donate money, spread the word, or a combination of both! In return, you'll be getting really neat things - including a digital copy of the ep!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, no worries. You can always help out by sharing this page on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and pretty much any other social media there is. Be sure to use the hashtag - #thestatusofthings .

story:
HELLO PEOPLES!!


My name is Scotty Grand.

[the baby]

Hopefully you were somewhat aware of that…having clicked on the link that brought you here in the first place right…?  By one of my alluring Instagram Posts or heart -wrenching Facebook Rants about being broke while tryna make it in Los Angeles as a songwriter, sleeping on floors and couches in order to make my dreams come true and all that shit, right?? LOL  Right. 
 Yeah I know. I have no filter. But hey…

I'm an Artist.


And…well, if you didn't know who, Scotty Grand, was before landing here on my page, I hope that once you listen and FEEL me thru my music, you will see clearly who I am. A man with a voice..in more ways than one!

But for now... Let me tell you why your here!
LONG STORY SHORT:   I'm a talent [Singer/Songwriter/Producer/Creative Director/WIPEOUT Winner] hailing from the musical epicenter known as New Orleans, Louisiana! Yup. I was "born by a river and just like that river I been runnin ever since." ....just Like Sam Cooke's "Change Is Gonna Come" says!! I been running for yearssss towards this one dream of mine! To sing MY SONGS!  I've spent years behind the scenes of many artists (Jordin Sparks, Jonas Brothers, Alicia Keys) making their careers shine and become what they've become. NOW ITS MY TURN.   If you've ever had a chance to come to one of my live shows or witness me do my thing on TV shows like BRAVO's "Platinum Hit" or "Showtime at the Apollo"…….I'd say you know that I'm not lying when I say I've known since the age of 8, that my reason on this earth was to create and then SING what i created!!
I call that, "A SONGWRITER'S RIGHT". 
And SING I shall!  


THE PRODUCT


"A SONGWRITER'S RIGHT"  will be an audio collection of some of my BEST songs tellin the story of my life of how I found 'true love' and the job it did on my heart not long after.  
With a planned 'Hard Release' of July 19th, 2015 (my birthday),  "A Songwriter's Right"  - P A R A G R A P H   O N E : Love is… ,  will really show the creative plight of a true song-smith in a very raw, honest, and relateable way. You'll get to hear voice notes of me creating the first piano rifts for songs that you will come to love as the series progresses with following P A R A G R A P H S   T W O   &  T H R E E.   Be a fly on the wall to recordings of conversations with my family, friends, co-writers, strangers that inspired songs you'll hear throughout "A Songwriter's Right". All narrated by me and the music.
I mean….I've lived half of my life on TV…right????……. making….."reality shows". But now….this reality will be mine. ALL mine. My Sweat, My Tears, My Voice, My Lyrics, My Production, , My Risks, My T.M.I.s, My Dreams, My Friends, My Foes, My Problems, My Chords, My Tempos,  My Songs. Telling my LIFE. 

[ I took this picture standing on the keyboard bench and broke it in the process. lol. big ass… lol. You can see my reflection in the screen of the keyboard if you look close.]

[my life. 2010 - 2014]



THE MISSION  


I've tallied up the bare essentials I feel I need to get my album on track:

1 - Get my website up and running and interactive with you guys 

2 - Finish the Mixing/Mastering phase of the album to get it to industry standard

3 - Get "A SONGWRITER'S RIGHT" on ITunes/Amazon/Googleplay/Spotify

4 - Shoot a high concept and quality video for next single, "WIth

5 - Secure a small but workable budget for Promotion and Marketing of my singles and album

…..'baby steps' as some would say! But hey...they're STEPS!


This tallied number came out to a nice and reachable number of $12,340.00 EXACTLY!!!

Last time we raised almost $10,000.......so I know with everyones help and spreading of the campaign via IG/TWITTER/FACEBOOK/Word of Mouth.....its a no brainer!


We can do this!!!!! BUT IT CANNOT BE DONE WITHOUT YOU!!!



THE BACKSTORY

 Now…as many of you know, my last campaign to raise the funds I needed for this release, failed (miserably lol) last December, only reaching 28% of our goal of $34K!  BUT that 28% still amounted to almost $10,000 of money pledged by my amazing supporters!!!The SAME SUPPORTERS that I will still need for the true success of THIS CAMPAIGN because as much as we raised last time….no cards were charged and no donations honored because we missed the overall goal of $34K! A little presumptuous? Maybe. But, then again...maybe NOT.
A few changes this time though.
I decided….why not set the goal LOWER this time, switch the campaign to a platform that LET'S ME KEEP EVERYTHING I RAISE.....and maybe we'll be successful this time around!!!!"    

 ....And either way.....I THANK YOU.....THANK YOU.....THANK YOU....THANK YOU  for all the continued support and even CLICKING THAT LINK TO BEGIN WITH!!! ;) 

At least you know me a little bit better now and know that, if someone else is bold enough to try and keep making their dreams come true, maybe you could too. ;)


8888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888

NOW     …..LET'S GET IT..!!       …...LET'S GET IT..!!     …...LET'S GET IT..!!


…and remember…


BE GRAND or BE GONE.



****************************************************************************

------>>>>>>     TAKE A LOOK AT MY PACKAGES TO THE RIGHT    ------->>>>>>

****************************************************************************





Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and you know what…I GET AND RESPECT THAT!!!! But HERES how you still can help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out via a post on FACEBOOK / INSTAGRAM  or even a simple TWEET…making some noise about the campaign.
  • ATTEND  one of my soon to be announce INDIEGOGO SHOWS where I will be singing to raise funds on the spot!! Tell a friend and see you there!

And that's all there is to it.

aaaaaaannnnnnnd GEAUX!!!!!!!!

I decided….why not set the goal LOWER this time, switch the campaign to a platform that LET'S ME KEEP EVERYTHING I RAISE.....and maybe we'll be successful this time around!!!!"    



 ....And either way.....I THANK YOU.....THANK YOU.....THANK YOU....THANK YOU  for all the continued support and even CLICKING THAT LINK TO BEGIN WITH!!! ;) 
At least you know me a little bit better now and know that, if someone else is bold enough to try and keep making their dreams come true, maybe you could too. ;)

8888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888888
NOW     …..LET'S GET IT..!!       …...LET'S GET IT..!!     …...LET'S GET IT..!!

…and remember…

BE GRAND or BE GONE.


****************************************************************************
------>>>>>>     TAKE A LOOK AT MY PACKAGES TO THE RIGHT    ------->>>>>>
****************************************************************************






Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, and you know what…I GET AND RESPECT THAT!!!! But HERES how you still can help:  Ask folks to get the word out via a post on FACEBOOK / INSTAGRAM  or even a simple TWEET…making some noise about the campaign. ATTEND  one of my soon to be announce INDIEGOGO SHOWS where I will be singing to raise funds on the spot!! Tell a friend and see you there!   And that's all there is to it.aaaaaaannnnnnnd GEAUX!!!!!!!!

story:
[UPDATE] 
Unfortunately I didn't reach the goal. So that means "Relic..." (#ROTM) will not be making the desired release date. I admit, it was an ambitious task but I had to try it out, and Ive learned so much from this experience over the last 30 days. 
Nevertheless, many great things have happened in the meantime. I will be getting a push from Gramatik with an EP release "Rise of the NecroDancer" on his Lowtemp U.S. based indie label featuring my latest works to boost my audience, and ultimately help strengthen my platform. 

RELEASE DATE IS MAY 13th on Lowtemp!!
AND SO, the campaign continues until I am able to raise enough money to make it happen. And I will take all of you supporters along with me on the journey to see it flourish, while showering you with exclusive content and free personalized gifts until I come with a definitive release date for #RTOM! More info will come to you all soon!
Thank you to all of the supporters. You have helped me so much on this journey so far!
If you're seeing this for the first time, go to www.iamtemu.com , join any of my pages to find out more.


My name is Temu, Im a Funk/Soul/R&B/HipHop solo artist, songwriter, composer, singer, producer, dancer, talkbox player, multi-musician and all around performer/entertainer. I've been active in the international urban dance (popping) community over the last few years through my musical contributions. Since popping and funk music go hand in hand so well, most of the music I make is meant to be uplifting, occasionally thought provoking, whilst maintaining a 'danceable' groove, musical depth and complexity. Im looking to raise funds to complete a relatively new funky project EP called "Relic of the Mothership". The plan is for it to be released in late May.  


I have never been signed to a major record/publishing label of any sort. And Im totally ok with that. My reputation since growing up in New York City to my livelihood and survival as an adult living in Europe, has relied solely on my level of skill within the arts from one degree to another. I like the idea of being an independent artist and having control over my own destiny. But it can be tough at times, however instead of knocking on record labels doors in vein to 'sign' me, I'd rather try another approach by reaching out to YOU, my network of friends, family and supporters worldwide to help me complete this next project and ultimately pave the way for more people other than myself, an opportunity to create a lifestyle change. I believe helping each other to help themselves is the way to go. 


About the project 

Relic Of the Mothership is a project I've actually been working on and off for about 3 years now. It started off as an album, but due to many obstacles, lack of time, inadequate working space, and of course money I haven't been able to complete it the way I would of liked to a couple years ago. Though over time I have released a couple of songs that would have been a part of that album. Now I would like to re-package the project into a smaller 'EP' format instead to give a look into what a full length album from me would be like. It will be a mixture of released and unreleased songs as some of them are interconnected with musical interludes. I plan to make it free to download for all those who supported before the release, free online for the world to stream via soundcloud and more, available to buy higher quality digital copies elsewhere, CDs, and a version mastered specifically to enjoy on vinyl is something I hope to do as well! 


You Help Me Keep The World Dancing


I've spent my life developing my skills, and the last few years working hard to build an adequate home studio while keeping my head above water that I am blessed to wake up to everyday. This 5+ year old frankenstein of a laptop, the one Im typing from now, despite its cracked screen and many breakdowns is the same laptop I used to create Boogaloo Blues, or record the talkbox work of Gramatik's "Talkbox Intended",  the infamous 'Looking at Me' talkbox acapella which has made its way through producers computers across the globe, along with so many other songs that people enjoy and dance to. Your support will help me most importantly keep this workspace afloat, build further, continue collaborating with artists worldwide, and ultimately continue bringing you some slamming music to make you feel good. 

Here's 50+ videos of people from all over the world; battling, performing and practicing to my music!


Now I'll tell you how I plan to use it.
Production
 If I had to pay someone else to fill the roles of the producer, songwriter, composer, tracking & mixing engineer, as many other solo artists do, the budget would be crazy. However, as one person wearing all those hats and being the solo artist, its a very demanding workload, but I wouldn't have it any other way for this project. Meeting this goal will not only grant me the money need to make some minor investments, but give me the time, space and wherewithal to switch roles with a sense of perspective, without having to constantly scatter my energy to make ends meet and complete the project within a reasonable time frame. Most of the music is written and composed, Im just missing some recording and time to edit/arrange/mix. I don't require a lot of expenses to do it, just what I need to keep things going. 
Mastering is a very delicate process and should be treated with lots of care. So that will be one of the things I will be allocating money towards to save time and ensure a final result of top level quality.

Releasing music 

Making a song available on iTunes or Spotify, or 'noticeable' by YouTube, etc costs money that must be paid in advance. Especially pressing music on CD's and vinyl. Usually the sales from a release on bandcamp provides just enough to front the costs to make it available on other sites. That and an occasional splurge on a cowbell or some acoustic foam:-)
Reaching this goal will make it possible for me to submit a project on all the various streaming sites and have physical copies on CD, vinyl (maybe more) etc ready BEFORE the actual release. Its one of the reason why many artists go forth with record labels. It's something I've always wanted to provide but have never been able to afford to do. I would like to do it on a very small scale and let sales determine whether more should be pressed.

Music Video 

I was lucky to have met up with the same guy who filmed and produced my very first music video "Keep On Dancing". It turned out he was working in NYC at the same time I was there recently. He and a colleague offered to help create visuals for my latest release "Temu's Talkbox Groove". They really went out of their way to make it happen, changed travel dates put up money out of their own pockets, I had nothing. We did a 18 hour outdoor/indoor shoot, they took care of everything and are now looking into the editing. For professionals of their caliber, surely $1500 normally wouldn't cover the work and risks they took. The least I can do is try to raise something symbolic for their work, it would have never happened if it weren't for them.
Promotion and Merchandise
Having a budget for these two aspects give the opportunity to invest in building promotional content, PR packages to get the word out, and ensuring quality merchandise to be prepared for whenever I hit the road.
 It's not imperative to me that this EP becomes a 'massive smash hit success' but more so that I can gain perspective on the entire process, the market, more work as a solo act, and whats the most effective aspects to focus on for future projects.  

All in all

Production (time, work, expenses)-$2500
Mastering- $ 500
Digital Release/CD/Vinyl pressing (approx/up to- 250 copies)$ 1500
Music Video $1500
Online Promo/Merchandise $1000
Check Out The Perks!
Be sure to take a good look through the perks and see if there is something for you! Im offering a slew of stuff from shout outs on the talkbox, to online lessons of all sorts and offers for shows. Many of the perks Im offering represent things I already do so you can sure it'll be handled with lots of love and care no matter what it is. (New perks like t-shirt and merchandise will soon be available so stay tuned)

 

The Worst That Can Happen...

Is that I would eventually put out the project anyway! Just maybe not in all of its $7K glory and it may take a little longer to finish.

This is the first time I've ever reached out to more than my immediate family or closest friends for help to the next step. This campaign stands somewhat as test of faith in my network and supporters. Reaching this goal will help me mobilize a small and effective team and learn more about the entire process from conceptualizing a song to selling merchandise on tour. And most importantly it'll give me incite as to how to help self-empower other upcoming local/international artists that I currently work with.

The vinyl & cd duplication would be the first to go or downgrade If I couldn't raise enough funding for example. Even less than 50% of the budget would still make it happen. I'm very aware that there are much more important things going on in the world and Im not trying to ask it to stop to give me money. What matters right now is that I keep giving something to the people that are already supporting and possibly gain the interest of a few more. 

The only thing to consider is that as of now, Im just one person managing all of this. I'll be promoting this campaign, reaching out to as many of my collected friends, family, supporters, followers and 'likers' as I possibly can. Pulling together logistics, communicating with duplication companies, handling every aspect of my online presence from uploading material to interviews to promoting my own merchandise, fulfilling perks, and a whole bunch of other things I have no experience with are in store for me on this adventure so, no matter how this goes, the one thing I ask for is your patience. 

However, if things go better than what I planned for, you can expect to see more perks, more forms of access to the music, maybe it could fund a full length album! Who knows?! 


Just Because You Don't Have Money...

Doesn't mean you can't be instrumental in this campaign. 

Maybe you have a dollar, but no credit card? (Hey, I know how that is), dont be afraid to ask a favor from a friend or family, they might also want to support too!

You could even be that person that showed it to another person that happens to make the biggest contribution. You never know!


Talk To Me!

If you have any questions dont be afraid to ask and get back to you soon as I can.
I want to hear your feedback and ideas on if there's any perks you would like to see or just anything constructive overall, whatever I can do better.
Thank you so much to all the people that have shown their support since the beginning and thank you in advance to the possible new comers to the campaign!
I will be constantly updating with more news and content during and after the campaign so STAY TUNED.
And If you actually read all of this, pat yourself on the back, seriously.

story:
Honestly, $5,000 is shoestring. I'm hoping to get enough support for $8,000-$10,000. I know this sounds crazy, but let me explain. I have always tried to stay true to where I come from and be honest in all I do not only in music, but the day to day life I live. Recently I had offers from labels would conflict with I guess you could say "creative freedom." Really it goes against the common sense view that I see how any business should be ran... Honest, Upfront, and No Bulls*&t. I'm choosing to do this with your help and believe me, I'll feel better about the product and  your help to be a part of this,

Recording is relatively cheap in this town when you know enough people that are willing to be on your team, which I am blessed to have. Half of the money will go to PROMOTION. This is why artists want a label, because that's really what costs money. Today anyone can make a record, but needs outside promotion to get it on radio, print, and other media literally needs financial backing. I plan on doing what a label does, without a label!

Also, we want rewards right? CD's koozies, tshirts....I have to pay for that too. In nine years in Nashville, I stumbled on the American Dream. I have a home, wife, cars, and my two "sons" Bacon and Elvis. I want the original dream to come to fruition, and I don't want to put it in the hands of a record company...I want it to be OURS! So please help out, Thank you so much!

Vince

www.ostrandermedia.com

story:
PLEASE NOTE: Our festival has been postponed until 2016. However, our Indiegogo campaign will continue until the deadline due to Indiegogo's restrictions on ending campaigns early. We are still accepting donations...but please be advised they will be for the inagural 2016 event! Any questions, please get in touch.


Introducing...
Northern Nights Music and Dance Festival!


This new Alaska music festival aims to bring world-renowned musicians and dancers to Fairbanks, Anchorage, and the rural communities of Alaska each June. This highly collaborative festival will emphasize not only great performances, but community workshops (including entry-level options) and dance events for listeners, participants, dancers, and musicians of all ages and abilities.


Above: Pearl Django

2015's inaugural festival will feature nationally-renowned Swing, Gypsy Jazz, Irish, and Bluegrass musicians and dancers, as well as local favorites Steve Brown and the Bailers and the Westcott Allstars. Seattle's "Pearl Django" will headline our event, featuring former Ester resident Michael Gray on violin! Events will include performances by individual bands at Fairbanks's favorite local venues and nightclubs, a collaborative concert featuring all musicians and dancers, day-time workshops in music and dance for all ages/abilities, a jam session, a contradance, a dinner dance, and a few outdoor events as well, since it's summertime in Fairbanks.

Co-directed by Kurt Byers (who has countless successes organizing music and dance events in the interior and most importantly is a top-notch dancer himself!) and myself, Caitlin Warbelow (originally from Fairbanks, currently a professional violinist in New York City performing with the Riverdance Company, Sting's Broadway musical "The Last Ship," Grammy-nominated Cherish the Ladies, etc), we hope to make this a premier summer arts event for Alaskans and visitors alike. 


Above: Ray and Erika, fabulous Fairbanks dancers!

We are at a pivotal stage in our fundraising. Through our existing contacts in the arts community, we already have significant support and a small army of volunteers who will help host musicians, cook food, provide transportation, and organize the festival. But we are still looking for individual and corporate financial and in-kind donations in order to meet the costs of the events.

This is an opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new Alaskan arts organization. We'd love to have you on board as a financial or in-kind donor or sponsor. If you're a business interested in sponsoring, we'd love to feature your logo in our print and online materials - please take a look at our "perks" for more information.

Above: Playing tunes on the tundra near Anaktuvuk Pass

What We Need & What You Get

Because this is our first year and we're starting from scratch with a short deadline, we're looking for help with various aspects of the festival. These include:

-Financial donations to help cover musician fees, sound equipment, venue fees and insurance, advertising, plane tickets, car rentals, and meals for our very hungry musicians!

-In-kind donations of mileage tickets, companion tickets, homestays, hotel or B&B rooms, loaner cars, food/meals, etc.

-Volunteer help! We can use some help now with organizational tasks, and we will be able to use help immediately prior and during the festival in order to keep everything running smoothly. And of course, getting the word out is a big help as well!

We've created some cool rewards for both corporate and individual donors, which you can find on in the "perks" section of this campaign. If you don't see what you want, email us and we'll see what we can do!

Above: Yours truly and Steve Brown and the Bailers rocking out at the Howling Dog

The Impact

As a child growing up in Fairbanks in the 80's and 90's, I took our arts scene for granted because I assumed everyone had the same access to music, dance, and art that people in Fairbanks (especially children) did. Little did I know at the time, but the education I received from both public and private arts and music programs was world-class, and it was that education and experience that allowed me to become a successful professional musician in NYC. Now, I come back to Alaska many times each year to teach and perform (and get out of the big city!) My goal since moving away has been to return as frequently as possible to give back to the community.


Above: Festival co-director, Kurt, burning up the floor at a Fairbanks area lodge.

This summer, I'll use my festival and performance expertise and connections both in Alaska and around the country to found this new festival. Together with Kurt Byers, my co-director, who has a long history of organizing music and dance events, and with help from you and other supporters of the Alaska arts and entertainment scene, we will make this one of Alaska’s premier annual music and dance festivals, which eventually will attract participants from throughout Alaska and the nation.


Risks & Challenges

The primary challenge for Northern Nights Music and Dance Festival is the short time span we have set for ourselves...in particular, the difficulty in raising a large amount of money in a short amount of time. Both Kurt and I have significant experience organizing arts, music, and dance events, and through our connections in Alaska and nationally, we feel we will be able to overcome the difficulties of organizing a festival on short notice.

This Indiegogo campaign, in combination with corporate donations and sponsorships, and the generosity of our volunteers, will allow us to overcome our primary financial burden and allow us to use our time and energy to create the best experience possible for listeners, musicians, and dancers in Fairbanks.

Above: Fairbanks swingers kick up their heels at a local nightclub.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially? No problem at all! We'd still love to have you involved in the festival. Come out to a concert, attend a workshop, or dance the night away when June rolls around. In the meantime, tell all your friends about this new event coming their way! Sharing this campaign on Facebook would mean the world to us. :)

Want to volunteer or donate something other than money? Awesome! Just email northernnightsfestival@gmail.com to let us know you'd like to help. Here are some things we can use:

-Organizational/marketing skills
-On-the-ground help during the festival
-Meal preparation for artists during the festival
-The use of cars/vans during the festival
-Homestays for artists and dancers
-Donation of mileage or companion codes on Alaska, Delta, or United
-Grantwriting/fundwriting expertise


THANKS!

We're really looking forward to making this happen, in collaboration with the incredible arts, music, and dance community in Fairbanks. Keep in touch, and let us know all of your thoughts, ideas, and suggestions! Thank you in advance.

Above: Summer in Fairbanks...nothing is better!

_____________________________________________________________________________

Northern Nights Music and Dance Festival is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non‐profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Northern Nights Music and Dance Festival must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” and are tax‐deductible to the extent permitted by law.
story_txt:
PLEASE NOTE: Our festival has been postponed until 2016. However, our Indiegogo campaign will continue until the deadline due to Indiegogo's restrictions on ending campaigns early. We are still accepting donations...but please be advised they will be for the inagural 2016 event! Any questions, please get in touch.  Introducing...Northern Nights Music and Dance Festival!

 This new Alaska music festival aims to bring world-renowned musicians 
and dancers to Fairbanks, Anchorage, and the rural communities of Alaska
 each June. This highly collaborative festival will emphasize not only 
great performances, but community workshops (including entry-level 
options) and dance events for 
listeners, participants, dancers, and musicians of all ages and abilities.



Above: Pearl Django2015's inaugural festival will feature nationally-renowned Swing, Gypsy Jazz, Irish, and Bluegrass musicians and dancers, as well as local favorites Steve Brown and the Bailers and the Westcott Allstars. Seattle's "Pearl Django" will headline our event, featuring former Ester resident Michael Gray on violin! Events will include performances by individual bands at Fairbanks's favorite local venues and nightclubs, a collaborative concert featuring all musicians and dancers, day-time workshops in music and dance for all ages/abilities, a jam session, a contradance, a dinner dance, and a few outdoor events as well, since it's summertime in Fairbanks.Co-directed by Kurt Byers (who has countless successes organizing music and dance events in the interior and most importantly is a top-notch dancer himself!) and myself, Caitlin Warbelow (originally from Fairbanks, currently a professional violinist in New York City performing with the Riverdance Company, Sting's Broadway musical "The Last Ship," Grammy-nominated Cherish the Ladies, etc), we hope to make this a premier summer arts event for Alaskans and visitors alike. 


Above: Ray and Erika, fabulous Fairbanks dancers!We are at a pivotal stage in
our fundraising. Through our existing contacts in the arts community, we already
have significant support and a small army of volunteers who will help host musicians, cook food, provide transportation, and organize the festival. But we are still looking for individual and corporate
financial and in-kind donations in order to meet the costs of the events. 
This is an opportunity to get
in on the ground floor of a new Alaskan arts organization. We'd love to have
you on board as a financial or in-kind donor or sponsor. If you're a business interested in sponsoring, we'd love to feature your logo in our print and online materials - please take a look at our "perks" for more information. 


Above: Playing tunes on the tundra near Anaktuvuk Pass
  What We Need & What You Get Because this is our first year and we're starting from scratch with a short deadline, we're looking for help with various aspects of the festival. These include:
-Financial donations to help cover musician fees, sound equipment, venue fees and insurance, advertising, plane tickets, car rentals, and meals for our very hungry musicians!
-In-kind donations of mileage tickets, companion tickets, homestays, hotel or B&B rooms, loaner cars, food/meals, etc. 
-Volunteer help! We can use some help now with organizational tasks, and we will be able to use help immediately prior and during the festival in order to keep everything running smoothly. And of course, getting the word out is a big help as well!We've created some cool rewards for both corporate and individual donors, which you can find on in the "perks" section of this campaign. If you don't see what you want, email us and we'll see what we can do!  


Above: Yours truly and Steve Brown and the Bailers rocking out at the Howling Dog
  The Impact As a child growing up in Fairbanks in the 80's and 90's, I took our arts scene for granted because I assumed everyone had the same access to music, dance, and art that people in Fairbanks (especially children) did. Little did I know at the time, but the education I received from both public and private arts and music programs was world-class, and it was that education and experience that allowed me to become a successful professional musician in NYC. Now, I come back to Alaska many times each year to teach and perform (and get out of the big city!) My goal since moving away has
been to return as frequently as possible to give back to the community. 



Above: Festival co-director, Kurt, burning up the floor at a Fairbanks area lodge.
This summer, I'll use my festival
and performance expertise and connections both in Alaska and around the country
to found this new festival. Together with Kurt Byers, my co-director, who has a
long history of organizing music and dance events, and with help from you and other
supporters of the Alaska arts and entertainment scene, we will make this one of
Alaska’s premier annual music and dance festivals, which eventually will attract
participants from throughout Alaska and the nation. 

  Risks & Challenges The primary challenge for Northern Nights Music and Dance Festival is the short time span we have set for ourselves...in particular, the difficulty in raising a large amount of money in a short amount of time. Both Kurt and I have significant experience organizing arts, music, and dance events, and through our connections in Alaska and nationally, we feel we will be able to overcome the difficulties of organizing a festival on short notice. 
This Indiegogo campaign, in combination with corporate donations and sponsorships, and the generosity of our volunteers, will allow us to overcome our primary financial burden and allow us to use our time and energy to create the best experience possible for listeners, musicians, and dancers in Fairbanks.  


Above: Fairbanks swingers kick up their heels at a local nightclub.
  Other Ways You Can Help Can't contribute financially? No problem at all! We'd still love to have you involved in the festival. Come out to a concert, attend a workshop, or dance the night away when June rolls around. In the meantime, tell all your friends about this new event coming their way! Sharing this campaign on Facebook would mean the world to us. :)Want to volunteer or donate something other than money? Awesome! Just email northernnightsfestival@gmail.com to let us know you'd like to help. Here are some things we can use:-Organizational/marketing skills-On-the-ground help during the festival-Meal preparation for artists during the festival-The use of cars/vans during the festival-Homestays for artists and dancers-Donation of mileage or companion codes on Alaska, Delta, or United-Grantwriting/fundwriting expertise
THANKS!

We're really looking forward to making this happen, in collaboration with the incredible arts, music, and dance community in Fairbanks. Keep in touch, and let us know all of your thoughts, ideas, and suggestions! Thank you in advance. 


Above: Summer in Fairbanks...nothing is better!_____________________________________________________________________________
Northern
Nights Music and Dance Festival is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a
non‐profit arts service organization. Contributions for the
charitable purposes of Northern Nights Music and Dance Festival must be made
payable to “Fractured Atlas” and are tax‐deductible
to the extent permitted by law.

story: My husband Ben and I LOVE music! Our whole lives we have dreamed of sharing our music with others. We write and perform our own songs as well covers of bands and artists we love and admire. For years things have stood in our way, like time consuming jobs or lack of funds for decent equipment. So we decided to ask YOU to help fund our dream! We need a good reliable PA system and misc supplies like: guitar strings, microphones, microphone stands, new drum heads & mixing software. This is music on our terms and with no strings attached. A bit of the American dream, and you can be a part of it. We hope to compile an album soon! Please help us share our art and do what we love!!

story:
(English Below)

¿Por qué realizar "Sonidos Nómades"?

En un contexto social en que se recalca la diferencia, la segregación, el prejuicio facilista y, por tanto, la desconfianza, nos resulta urgente el acercamiento y la valoración de aquellos elementos que, como raza humana, nos unen. Todos respiramos, todos amamos, todos comemos, todos creamos. En toda cultura hay agricultores, constructores, sanadores, MÚSICOS. Este último, nuestro oficio, es desde donde queremos profundizar y emprender la búsqueda de una esencia común, que permita la comunicación mas allá de los idiomas, diferencias culturales y distancias geográficas. Tener la VOLUNTAD de acercarse.  "Sonidos nómades" es nuestra voluntad de acercarnos. 

¿Quiénes somos?

Somos Ser o Dúo, un proyecto enfocado en la creación e interpretación de música instrumental que transita entre el mundo académico y popular, entre la improvisación y la escritura, entre lo local y lo global. Nos presentamos: Tomás Carrasco en instrumentos de viento de diversos orígenes (quena, flauta traversa, bansuri, kaval búlgaro, ney turco, entre otros) y Moa Edmunds en la guitarra, ambos somos jóvenes músicos profesionales de Valparaíso, Chile, con una vasta experiencia presentando nuestros trabajos en conciertos y festivales en nuestro país y en otros como Argentina, Colombia, Bolivia, Paraguay, Francia, Alemania, Turquía y Bulgaria. Además, nos desempeñamos como profesores, gestores, compositores e intérpretes comprometidos con la escena musical local. En este respecto, somos miembros fundadores del Colectivo "La Grieta", organizadores del Festival Internacional de Música "A ras de cielo", que ya cuenta con 3 versiones realizadas.

Conoce un poco de nuestra música:

- "Aire de libra" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KQmhZ_fS98M

- "Quirquincho" con Jonatan Szer https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7AoJwswKjbQ&amp...

- "El mar en el río" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2VRMfyRpHfE

¿Cómo nació "Sonidos Nómades"?

Todo esto comienza a partir de un viaje que realizó Tomás el año 2015, estudiando instrumentos y compartiendo músicas y cotidianidades de otras culturas del mundo: en Bulgaria estudió el kaval búlgaro, en Turquía el ney turco y en España el Shakuhachi japonés.  A nivel personal, esta fue una experiencia que lo enriqueció tremendamente, despertando  en él la convicción de que la música tiene el poder de acercar. 

A partir de esta experiencia y del trabajo colaborativo que viene realizando con Moa en diversos proyectos, nace "Sonidos Nómades".

Este es el plan:

Previo al viaje, adquiriremos el equipamiento técnico necesario para el registro audiovisual (cámaras, grabadora de audio y accesorios afines), para lo cual nos asesoraremos con la productora Transeúnte Films (www.vimeo.com/260415309), quienes serán, además, los encargados de la posproducción del documental. 

Nos reuniremos en Mumbai, India, en mayo de 2019 para dar inicio a este viaje. La ruta estará definida por dos ejes: el primero es documentar el encuentro con músicos ya comprometidos con nuestro proyecto: Shubam Modi y Anubhab Singh en India, Hamid Behrouzinia en Irán, Fulya Özlem en Turquía y Nikolay Doctorov con Damian Yordanov en Bulgaria (ver video de presentación).  Como segundo eje,  estaremos abiertos a las colaboraciones que vayan surgiendo durante el viaje, producto de nuevos contactos y lugares visitados. De esta forma, iremos paso a paso aunando diversas voluntades de acercarse. 

Esta modalidad de trabajo nos otorga mucha flexibilidad y oportunidades, como también riesgos y desafíos. 

¿Para qué se utilizarán los aportes?

El dinero reunido será utilizado para:

- Comprar equipo audiovisual: cámaras de video, micrófonos, trípodes...todo el equipo necesario para filmar un documental de buena calidad. Para esto, tenemos considerada una inversión de $4000 dólares

- Financiar parte de los costos del viaje: estimamos que estaremos en ruta mínimo un año. ¡Eso es mucho tiempo! Con su ayuda, podremos mantenernos y movilizarnos con mayor efectividad en y entre cada lugar que visitemos.  Para esto, consideramos sumar a nuestros fondos ya existentes una cantidad de $4000 dólares. 

- Costos de posproducción: la magia no está sólo en registrar, sino que también en el arte de  ordenar y presentar esos registros, creando así una propuesta estética atractiva e impactante. De este trabajo se encargará la productora Transeúnte Films, quienes tienen una larga trayectoria en torno al cine documental. Te invitamos a conocerlos en el siguiente link: www.vimeo.com/260415309. Este trabajo tiene un valor de $2000 dólares.

Esto es Sonidos Nómades. Se parte de él ayudándonos a lograr nuestra meta y así poder llevar a tu pantalla nuestro viaje - documental. Comparte desde Indiegogo con el mundo nuestra campaña para así llegar a más gente. Gracias!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

English

Nomadic Sounds - Sonidos Nómades

Documentary about the journey of 2 chilean artists sharing music with people from distant cultures.

We want to share. We think that the best way of knowing something or someone is sharing, recognizing the things that unite us over those that divide us. Our project consists in the creation of a documentary about our journey and the encounter with musicians from distant land´s cultures, traveling from India to Bulgaria (so far).

The money that we will raise will be used for buying audiovisual equipment, financing travel expenses and postproduction costs.

Join us!

- Why realice “Nomadic Sounds”?

In a social context where difference, segregation, easy prejudice and, therefore, distrust are emphasized,  it turns urgent for us to get closer, to value those elements which, as human race, unit us. 

We all breathe, love, eat, create. In every culture there are farmers, constructors, healers, MUSICIANS. This last one, our craft, is from where we want to deepen and start looking for a common essence, that allows communication beyond idioms, cultural differences and geographical distances. Having the WILL to get closer.

“Nomadic sounds” is our will to get closer.

- Who are we?

We are Ser o Dúo, a musical project focused on creation and interpretation of instrumental music, which goes between the academic and the popular worlds, between writing and improvisation, between global and local music. We present ourselves: Tomás Carrasco, playing many flutes from diverse origins (quenas, silver flute, bansuri, bulgarian kaval, turkish ney, among others) and Moa Edmunds, who plays the guitar. Based in Valparaíso, Chile, we have vast experience presenting our work in concerts and festivals in Chile, Argentina, Paraguay, Bolivia, Colombia, Germany, Spain, France, Turkey and Bulgaria. We work also as teachers, cultural promoters, composers and music performers fully committed to the local scene. We are founders of “La Grieta” collective, with whom we organize “A Ras de Cielo” International Music Festival (this will be the 4th year), and many other cultural instances. 

-How was “Nomadic sounds” born?

This began with a journey that Tomás made back in 2015, studying instruments and sharing music and everydayness from other world cultures: in Bulgaria he studied the bulgarian kaval, in Turkey the turkish ney and in Spain the japanese Shakuhachi. In a personal level, this was a very enriching experience, and gave him the conviction that music has the power to bring closer people and cultures.

Starting from this experience, and from the collaborative work with Moa in diverse projects, “Nomadic sounds” is born.

- This is the plan:

Before the journey, we will acquire the necessary technical equipment for audiovisual recording (cameras, sound recorder and accessories), for which we will be advised by the producers Transeúnte films (https://vimeo.com/260415309). They are also who will make the work of postproduction for the documentary.

We will start this journey in Mumbai, India, in May of 2019. The route will be traced by 2 axis: the first we is to meet and record the encounters with musicians that we have already met and that are committed to the project: Shubam Modi y Anubhab Singh in India, Hamid Behrouzinia in Iran, Fulya Özlem en Turkey y Nikolay Doctorov with Damian Yordanov in Bulgaria (watch the presentation video). Also, we will be open to collaborate and share with people that we will meet on the road, because of new contacts and places that we visit. In this way, we will gather, step by step, multiple wills of getting closer and sharing.

- How will the money be spent?

The money that we raise will be used for:

  • Buying audiovisual equipment: video cameras, microphones and everything we need for shooting a good quality documentary. For this, we consider an amount of $4000, plus the equipment we already have.
  • Finance part of our travel expenses: we think we will be traveling for at least 1 year: That is a lot of time! With your help, we will be able to live and mobilize in and between places with best comfort and effectiveness. We already have some money for this, but we need to raise $4000 more. 
  • Postproduction costs: the magic is not only in registering, but in the art of arranging and presenting these registers, creating an attractive esthetic. TRANSEUNTE films will make this work, whom have a long trajectory in documentary realization. We invite you to meet them at the following link: www.vimeo.com/260415309 . This work has a price of $2000.

 

This is “Nomadic Sounds”. Become a part of it helping us to achieve our goal, making it possible to bring our journey documentary to your screen. Share with the world our project from Indiegogo`s page, so we can reach more people.Thanks!

Join us!

Perks in English:

1- A big thank you!  $5

   We welcome you to our project with huge gratitude and personalized messages trough our social media and e-mail. 

2- Our single is yours!  $10

   We will send you the single of our music album "Testimonio", for you to listen to ir anytime you want! Also we welcome you to our project with huge gratitude and personalized messages trough our social media and e-mail. 

3- A letter has arrived! $50

   You will receive a monthly exclusive report with photos, videos and stories about our journey, so you will know how is our project developing. You will also get our deep gratitude on social media and the single from our music album "Testimonio". 

4- Our music album: "Testimonio" $70

   We will send you our full music digital album for you to download it. Connect with us through sound! You will get also our deep gratitude on our social media and our monthly exclusive report. 

5- Nomadic sounds on your screen $100

   You will get the digital documentary on your computer, so you can watch it whenever you want! You will also get our deep gratitude on our social media, our monthly exclusive report and our full music album: "Testimonio"

6- Be the first one! $150

  You will be invited to the premiere of the documentary, on first row in Valparaíso, Chile, whit live music and conversation with the production team and ourselves. All questions are welcome! You will also get our deep gratitude on our social media, our monthly exclusive report, our full digital music album: "Testimonio" and the digital documentary. 

7- Your name on the credits! $200

   Your name will be on a special space on the documentary reserved only for important collaborators. You will also get our deep gratitude on our social media, our monthly exclusive report, our full digital music album: "Testimonio" and the digital documentary. 

8- This musical composition is yours! $600

   We will compose a special piece of music for you, which will be inspired by the name you choose. We will record it and send it to your e-mail. You will also hear parts of it on the documentary! You will also get our deep gratitude on our social media, our monthly exclusive report, our full digital music album: "Testimonio", the digital documentary and your name will be on a special space on the documentary reserved only for important collaborators.

9 -Ser o duo at your home! $1500

   We we come back to Chile, we will have a lot of new music and stories for sharing. We will make a private concert at your home or other place you choose for you and your friends! If it is outside Chile, you will have to take care also for airplane tickets and accommodation. You will also get our deep gratitude on our social media, our monthly exclusive report, our full digital music album: "Testimonio", the digital documentary, your name will be on a special space on the documentary reserved only for important collaborators and you will get your own piece of music composed on the name you choose!

10- Become an executive producer! $3000

   Join our team! We will hear to your ideas and proposals about the process and will share with you the status of the project at all time. Become a key member of our team! You will also get our deep gratitude on our social media, our monthly exclusive report, our full digital music album: "Testimonio", the digital documentary, your name will be on a special space on the documentary reserved only for important collaborators,  you will get your own piece of music composed on the name you choose and you will get a private concert at the place you choose! (If it is outside Chile, you will have to take care also for airplane tickets and accommodation). 

Welcome to Nomadic Sounds!

Buying audiovisual equipment: video cameras, microphones and everything we need for shooting a good quality documentary. For this, we consider an amount of $4000, plus the equipment we already have.
Finance part of our travel expenses: we think we will be traveling for at least 1 year: That is a lot of time! With your help, we will be able to live and mobilize in and between places with best comfort and effectiveness. We already have some money for this, but we need to raise $4000 more. 
Postproduction costs: the magic is not only in registering, but in the art of arranging and presenting these registers, creating an attractive esthetic. TRANSEUNTE films will make this work, whom have a long trajectory in documentary realization. We invite you to meet them at the following link: www.vimeo.com/260415309 . This work has a price of $2000.
 This is “Nomadic Sounds”. Become a part of it helping us to achieve our goal, making it possible to bring our journey documentary to your screen. Share with the world our project from Indiegogo`s page, so we can reach more people.Thanks!Join us!Perks in English:1- A big thank you!  $5   We welcome you to our project with huge gratitude and personalized messages trough our social media and e-mail. 2- Our single is yours!  $10   We will send you the single of our music album "Testimonio", for you to listen to ir anytime you want! Also we welcome you to our project with huge gratitude and personalized messages trough our social media and e-mail. 3- A letter has arrived! $50   You will receive a monthly exclusive report with photos, videos and stories about our journey, so you will know how is our project developing. You will also get our deep gratitude on social media and the single from our music album "Testimonio". 4- Our music album: "Testimonio" $70   We will send you our full music digital album for you to download it. Connect with us through sound! You will get also our deep gratitude on our social media and our monthly exclusive report. 5- Nomadic sounds on your screen $100   You will get the digital documentary on your computer, so you can watch it whenever you want! You will also get our deep gratitude on our social media, our monthly exclusive report and our full music album: "Testimonio"6- Be the first one! $150  You will be invited to the premiere of the documentary, on first row in Valparaíso, Chile, whit live music and conversation with the production team and ourselves. All questions are welcome! You will also get our deep gratitude on our social media, our monthly exclusive report, our full digital music album: "Testimonio" and the digital documentary. 7- Your name on the credits! $200   Your name will be on a special space on the documentary reserved only for important collaborators. You will also get our deep gratitude on our social media, our monthly exclusive report, our full digital music album: "Testimonio" and the digital documentary. 8- This musical composition is yours! $600   We will compose a special piece of music for you, which will be inspired by the name you choose. We will record it and send it to your e-mail. You will also hear parts of it on the documentary! You will also get our deep gratitude on our social media, our monthly exclusive report, our full digital music album: "Testimonio", the digital documentary and your name will be on a special space on the documentary reserved only for important collaborators.9 -Ser o duo at your home! $1500   We we come back to Chile, we will have a lot of new music and stories for sharing. We will make a private concert at your home or other place you choose for you and your friends! If it is outside Chile, you will have to take care also for airplane tickets and accommodation. You will also get our deep gratitude on our social media, our monthly exclusive report, our full digital music album: "Testimonio", the digital documentary, your name will be on a special space on the documentary reserved only for important collaborators and you will get your own piece of music composed on the name you choose!10- Become an executive producer! $3000   Join our team! We will hear to your ideas and proposals about the process and will share with you the status of the project at all time. Become a key member of our team! You will also get our deep gratitude on our social media, our monthly exclusive report, our full digital music album: "Testimonio", the digital documentary, your name will be on a special space on the documentary reserved only for important collaborators,  you will get your own piece of music composed on the name you choose and you will get a private concert at the place you choose! (If it is outside Chile, you will have to take care also for airplane tickets and accommodation). Welcome to Nomadic Sounds!

story:
The Brian Swartz Quartet - "The Tuesday Sessions"

Left to right: Guitarist Steve Cotter; Trumpeter/Vocalist Brian Swartz; Bassist Chris Colangelo; Drummer Kendall Kay.

  • Trumpeter Brian Swartz has appeared on multiple Grammy Nominated and Winning recordings. He has released 4 jazz albums as a leader, the last of which, "Portraiture," was funded on Indiegogo.
  • The Brian Swartz Quartet has been performing together every Tuesday for over 5 years. This quartet thinks and plays as one.
  • When you fund this project you'll be helping to bring the magic of this quartet to a worldwide audience.

Here's what your contribution goes to:

  • We need funds to be able to pay for studio costs, the band, guest artists and post production costs like mixing, mastering, clearing song royalties, product manufacturing and distribution.
  • Premiums include: downloads, copies of the new CD, copies of my past CD's, autographed sheet music, thank you's in the album liner notes, and even co-producer credits for larger contributions.
  • All money raised will go towards the production of this project.

Why should you fund this project?

  • The Brian Swartz Quartet has been performing at Perch in Downtown Los Angeles for over 5 1/2 years and is ready to record tried and true material with some of LA's best players.
  • My last project, "Portraiture" (Summit Records 2014), which was funded on Indiegogo, received critical acclaim and made it into the top 100 on the JazzWeek.com charts for 5 weeks.
  • Your contribution will help to bring The Brian Swartz Quartet's unique brand of jazz to a wider audience.

The long, persistent journey of jazz.

I've had a long road in this amazing world of jazz. You never know where it will take you. Now, I'm beginning a new chapter and literally lending my voice to my story. I've been playing the trumpet for 40 years now and I had always told people that I was a backup singer....when I sang, people backed up! But now, life has shown me what these songs mean and I'm on a mission to extract the true meaning out of the Great American Songbook and put my own personal stamp on it. My experience as a trumpeter, arranger, composer and a teacher has kept me searching for the truth in music, authenticity and integrity.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, do whatever you can to help with this project. Any contribution is important. If you can't contribute financially, take a moment of your time and share this project with anyone that you think would like to help. Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word and help get this project funded and done.

Thank you most sincerely,
Brian Swartz
Trumpeter, Vocalist, Composer, Arranger, Instructor
www.brianswartz.com
