story:
Nahardelah

Chanter. Contempler. Ressentir.


Vie Charles (auteur-compositrice pour Nahardelah) Crédit Photo : Nicolas Fontaine

Nahardelah prit naissance par désir de mettre la voix et l'humain au centre de l'expérience musicale, pour ainsi mieux l'ancrer dans sa réalité, autant dans ses parts d'ombres que de lumière. En s'inspirant du courant populaire, folk et classique, voix et musique vous guiderons dans un monde profane et sacré, où les harmonies et les textes évoqués peignent de vives images. 
 

Le EP '' Nigredo '' et ses participants

《 Nigredo》, mot latin qui signifie " oeuvre au noir "

(Gauche à droite) Nicolas Fontaine, Gabriel M. St-Pierre et Ian-Olivier Bégin. Crédit photo : Vie Charles

Ce EP représente la première étape vers une transmutation intérieure, exigeant la matière brute à traverser une longue nuit de l'âme. Bien accompagné cependant, l'obscurité est moins terrifiante, même accueillante...

Voici les participants à l'enregistrement du EP '' Nigredo ''

  • Vie Charles (composition, textes, chant)
  • Jasmine Seamour-Desbiens (chant)
  • Daniela Charles (chant)
  • Etienne-Joseph Charles (chant)
  • Ian-Olivier Bégin (guitares)
  • Julian Rice (violon)
  • Gabriel M. St-Pierre (percussions)
  • Nicolas Fontaine (contrebasse)

Musiciens émergents, indépendants et étudiants basés à Montréal, tous ont donné temps, bienveillance et énergie pour enfin voir naître ce projet.
 

Nos défis financiers

1. Enregistrement, mastering et impression de EPs physique
- 2014,64 $

Nous avons eu le plaisir de collaborer avec Nikolas Benoit Ratelle (mixing, ingénieur de son) qui fit preuve de professionnalisme et d'une grande sensibilité artistique lors dès 5 jours d'enregistrement intensifs qui ont eu lieu au début du mois de juin.

Notre mastering sera pris en charge suite à son travail.

2. Art de couverture et marchandise Nahardelah
- 552,26$

Pour bâtir ce qui fera notre première identité visuelle, nous avons eu le plaisir de collaborer avec Chloé Vert - Petite Plume Jewleries (bijoux Nahardelah), Erin Tremblay (illustration et design de couverture de EP) et Merk Bolduc (signature Nahardelah).

Défi total : 2566,9 $
Nous arrondissons à : 2567 $

L'impact de vos dons

Direct et impacts collatéraux


(Gauche à droit) Daniela Charles, Jasmine Seamour-Desbiens, Nikolas Benoît Ratelle (ingénieur de son) et Etienne-Joseph Charles. Crédit photo : Vie Charles

En épongeant une partie du stress financier relié à la naissance d'un projet musical, vous nous encouragez directement à rester dans notre authenticité. La précarité peut amener les artistes créateur à prendre des décisions hors de leur vision artistique primaire !

Lorsque vous faites un don, achetez un enregistrement physique ou sa marchandise dérivée, vous contribuez à soutenir le travail d'artistes Québécois et leur promotion : composition, interprètes, illustration, design, mixing, mastering, et marchandise.

Si notre objectif est dépassé, on fera quoi de l'abondance ?

Il faut prévoir, on ne sait jamais !

Si la générosité abonde, nous aimerions :
1. Payez notre prochaine séance photo professionnelle 
2. Payez pour du matériel ou effets de scène intéressants (décors, éclairagiste)
3. Ajouter de la marchandise Nahardelah 
 

Envie de nous aider autrement?

On a quelques propositions pour vous !

  • Être bénévole à un de nos spectacles ?
  • Lifter un musicien du point A au point B à l'occasion d'un spectacle ?
  • Envie d'une collaboration artistique ? (danse, musique, mode, vidéo, média etc.) 

    Toute contribution est précieuse !

Parler, c'est partager 

Partagez notre lien de campagne de socio-financement Indiegogo avec quelques mots pour mettre vos collègues et amis en contexte. Dans la marée d'information des réseaux sociaux, vos mots feront toute la différence.

https://igg.me/at/nahardelahpremierep

Nahardelah vous dit merci  !

story:
Short Summary

Hello citizens of Earth! I am ROZEE. An Indie Recording Artist and Songwriter based in Los Angeles. Some of you know me, many of you may not. I am releasing my single "DEJAVU" on 6.29.18 and I need your help to film an EPIC Music Video! I need your Moooniiiess(Not a Typo).

Have you ever been fresh out of a relationship and everything you do reminds you of your past love? Well, thats exactly what DEJAVU is about. It's about that nostalgic feeling you get when you roll to the right side of the bed only to realize that there's no one there. It's about the sinking feeling in your chest every time you think about them being gone. Love and Heartache are such powerful emotions so I want to tell this story with and amazing visual.

I am releasing this song and also working on completing my First STUDIO ALBUM and let me tell ya... It's ALOT of work, but I wouldn't want to be doing anything else.

I've got a great film production team behind me (see "Blue Sky" music video) and I want them to have everything they need to create a great music video.

What I Need 

So here are the necessities that are breaking the bank. It takes a lot to make a song successful, and I'm not talking Spotify plays only.

Expenses will include: 

  • Director
  • Cinematographer
  • Crew
  • Video Editor Fees
  • Location Rental
  • Equipment Rental
  • Production Design 
  • Marketing & PR: PR Agency, Blogs, Radio Play, Song & Video Placement (Spotify, Apple Music, BET,MTV,etc.) Spotify Playlists, Youtube Promo, Facebook Promo
  • If I don't reach the entire goal, The funds will still go toward making this beautiful piece of art. But I KNOW that you all are going to Show Up, Show Out and help me exceed my goal!

The Impact

I started this professional journey in the music industry about 4 years ago. Many of you know that I've been singing since childhood. I'm the Daughter of a Minister and a Musician, so music is in my blood. Even though I've lost both of my parents, their music lives on in me.

I'll always remember how I felt when I first heard Sade Adu on the radio. Her music was so intriguing, and to this day I still get that feeling of nostalgia whenever I hear her. I always blast the radio! That's the impact I'd like my music to have on the world. I understand the value of timeless music. Music is a universal language because there is no other language the can express the things that we think and feel so perfectly. Think about it. There is literally a song for everything; from ABC's till Death do us part.

With your help, I can reach audiences around the world. More chances for more people to relate to something they may be experiencing. More chances for healing. "Blue Sky" was my first  visual release and in all honesty, it did 'ok'. I say ok, because as amazing as it was, I did not have the resources available to push the song the way I would have liked to. I don't have a label, or an angel investor backing me; this is all out of pocket. A lot goes into making a successful record. So I don't just Want your Contribution, I NEED it.

Risks & Challenges

Over the years, I've had a Love/Hate relationship with this industry. I even walked away from music when I first moved to LA. But at the end of it all, I love making music that people can connect with. I've been fortunate enough to meet with and work with very talented creatives. We are all working artists and have to make a living. Many of us just want to make a comfortable living while doing the thing we love most. I work two jobs just to make a living while continuing to make music. It takes a lot of courage and strength to persevere in this cutthroat industry. I've heard it all and yet still I'm here with my hater blockers on, staying on course.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you ain't got no money, Take Your B..... Mouse/Finger and CLICK SHARE !!

  • Sharing is better than Nothing. If you have visit this page and don't have a dollar to your name, I urge you to share!

Thank you in advance for all your love and support.

ROZEE

story:
About Me

I come from a Cretan family that has a long music history, my grandfather played the Cretan lyra, my father the lute, and all my uncles are either professional folk musicians or played some Greek folk music instrument. I, however, got involved mostly with the classical studies of music, first learning the piano and after some years I realized that I was more interested in composition being inspired by Bach, Mozart, Beethoven, Schubert, Chopin, Mahler, Stravinsky, and others. Beethoven, Chopin and Mahler are the ones that have infuenced me the most. Being very interested in metaphysics I consider and use music as a means for meditation and relaxation and so over time I have worked on several projects involving meditation music and poetry which you can see below, in the "samples of my other projects".

 

Music tradition of my Cretan family

 



The "Seven Piano Nocturnes" is a set of seven music pieces for Piano that sound more as Reveries and Meditations than following the "Nocturne" form as developed by John Field and Frédéric Chopin. I consider them as nocturnal pieces for relaxation and meditation.

The composition of the Nocturnes is almost completed and the score of three of them, and now I need the time for putting everything together so that the project gets completed in its entirety. They are listed below with their approximate duration, as they might change since they are still in development.

Nocturne no.1 - Reverie ................... ~ 4:21
Nocturne no.2 - Meditation ................ ~ 7:25
Nocturne no.3 - Anamniseis / Reverie ...... ~ 5:38
Nocturne no.4 - Reverie ................... ~ 7:47
Nocturne no.5 - Meditation ................ ~ 7:17
Nocturne no.6 - Meditation ................ ~ 8:10
Nocturne no.7 - Reverie ................... ~ 4:07

Your financial support will give me the opportunity to concentrate more on finishing the music, score, and production of the "Seven Piano Nocturnes". So, your financial assistance will greatly help the progress of this project and its final completion the best way possible ...

The goal of $3710 will go towards covering expenses of the various aspects of this project, such as, performance, studio expenses (such as, recording & mastering), score publishing, promotion, copyright registration, etc. More details below:

Performance: ................ $1200
Studio: .....................  $900
Score publishing: ........... $1150
Promotion & other expenses:    $460
---------                     -----
Total: ...................... $3710

Score

The complete sheet music of all seven nocturnes will be produced and be available bound in one book. If you want you will also be able to get only three (3) nocturnes (1st, 3rd & 7th), by choosing the appropriate perk. You have also the choice to get the digital version of the Score along with the music album and the accompanying booklet, or have the printed score mailed to you.

If you choose to be a "Sponsor" you will get the printed score and your name will be mentioned in the score along with my deep appreciation. The primary Sponsors will get an Autographed Score!

Below is the entire score of the 3rd Nocturne ...

Perks

This work in progress needs you and your support!... You can choose to support this project by offering any amount of money you are able to contribute or by choosing a perk. There are many perks to choose from: You can get from the music album to even have a nocturne composed just for you, and many combination choices in between.

Note: Most perks are provided in digital format mostly because of consideration for the environment. For example, CD's nowadays are in rare use and people listen to music mostly thru their mobile phones or other digital means. The Score in digital format (PDF) can easily be printed on a regular (A4) page or larger if necessary, or it can be viewed using a tablet which I would recommend if possible.

Copyright

Initially the "Seven Piano Nocturnes" will be released under a 'Creative Commons' license. This means, the Music and the Score can be freely shared, but not commercially without a permission. I plan, in the future, to release both Music and Score in the public domain. For the time being this work will be under the following 'Creative Commons' license:

Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International
CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

Timetable

The composition of the Nocturnes is almost completed and the score of three of them. I plan the main body of the project to be ready and available by October 2018. The especially composed music is planned to be available by November. The Sponsors will be able to get the digital copies of the Music & Score a month earlier, on September 2018!

This is my first crowdfunding campaign and I hope I won't face many unexpected difficulties but I'll keep you updated anyway.

Some samples of my other Projects

Any kind or amount of help is greatly appreciated ...

Some people just can't contribute financially and that's completely understood ... However, that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways by making some noise about this campaign! You can help by sharing this campaign with your friends and through your social networks, and explain to people why you like this project! ...

You can use Indiegogo's great sharing tools and help spread the word! ...
story_txt:
About Me
I come from a Cretan family that has a long music history, my grandfather played the Cretan lyra, my father the lute, and all my uncles are either professional folk musicians or played some Greek folk music instrument. I, however, got involved mostly with the classical studies of music, first learning the piano and after some years I realized that I was more interested in composition being inspired by Bach, Mozart, Beethoven, Schubert, Chopin, Mahler, Stravinsky, and others. Beethoven, Chopin and Mahler are the ones that have infuenced me the most. Being very interested in metaphysics I consider and use music as a means for meditation and relaxation and so over time I have worked on several projects involving meditation music and poetry which you can see below, in the "samples of my other projects".
 
Music tradition of my Cretan family










 






The "Seven Piano Nocturnes" is a set of seven music pieces for Piano that sound more as Reveries and Meditations than following the "Nocturne" form as developed by John Field and Frédéric Chopin. I consider them as nocturnal pieces for relaxation and meditation.
The composition of the Nocturnes is almost completed and the score of three of them, and now I need the time for putting everything together so that the project gets completed in its entirety. They are listed below with their approximate duration, as they might change since they are still in development.
Nocturne no.1 - Reverie ................... ~ 4:21Nocturne no.2 - Meditation ................ ~ 7:25Nocturne no.3 - Anamniseis / Reverie ...... ~ 5:38Nocturne no.4 - Reverie ................... ~ 7:47Nocturne no.5 - Meditation ................ ~ 7:17Nocturne no.6 - Meditation ................ ~ 8:10Nocturne no.7 - Reverie ................... ~ 4:07
Your financial support will give me the opportunity to concentrate more on finishing the music, score, and production of the "Seven Piano Nocturnes". So, your financial assistance will greatly help the progress of this project and its final completion the best way possible ...
The goal of $3710 will go towards covering expenses of the various aspects of this project, such as, performance, studio expenses (such as, recording & mastering), score publishing, promotion, copyright registration, etc. More details below:

Performance: ................ $1200Studio: .....................  $900Score publishing: ........... $1150Promotion & other expenses:    $460---------                     -----Total: ...................... $3710





Score

The complete sheet music of all seven nocturnes will be produced and be available bound in one book. If you want you will also be able to get only three (3) nocturnes (1st, 3rd & 7th), by choosing the appropriate perk. You have also the choice to get the digital version of the Score along with the music album and the accompanying booklet, or have the printed score mailed to you.
If you choose to be a "Sponsor" you will get the printed score and your name will be mentioned in the score along with my deep appreciation. The primary Sponsors will get an Autographed Score!
Below is the entire score of the 3rd Nocturne ...

There are many perks to choose from: You can get from the music album to even have a nocturne composed just for you, and many combination choices in between.

Note: Most perks are provided in digital format mostly because of consideration for the environment. For example, CD's nowadays are in rare use and people listen to music mostly thru their mobile phones or other digital means. The Score in digital format (PDF) can easily be printed on a regular (A4) page or larger if necessary, or it can be viewed using a tablet which I would recommend if possible.



Copyright
Initially the "Seven Piano Nocturnes" will be released under a 'Creative Commons' license. This means, the Music and the Score can be freely shared, but not commercially without a permission. I plan, in the future, to release both Music and Score in the public domain. For the time being this work will be under the following 'Creative Commons' license:
Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 InternationalCC BY-NC-SA 4.0




Timetable
The composition of the Nocturnes is almost completed and the score of three of them. I plan the main body of the project to be ready and available by October 2018. The especially composed music is planned to be available by November. The Sponsors will be able to get the digital copies of the Music & Score a month earlier, on September 2018!
This is my first crowdfunding campaign and I hope I won't face many unexpected difficulties but I'll keep you updated anyway.

story:
Sparrow and the Dirty Kids

Sparrow and the Dirty Kids is a music project from Nathan Dickerson inspired by the sounds of joy and inclusion. Inclusion of one life into another. Of friends who carry each other wherever they go. But ultimately by the sounds of a good Papa who delights in us and who through the person of Jesus has revealed our true origin, our true home and our true belonging. The family of God.

​We carry these songs in our hearts as we travel down our unique paths of life, releasing light and love along a journey of 1,000 roads.

 

Needs and Perks

The Needs:

  • We need about $10,000 to finish off this project. The album is more than halfway complete but still needs a lot of attention. This will require another trip to Florida which will need flights, hotel, car and many more expenses including all the post production costs. 

The Perks:

  • Other than the obvious once in a lifetime experience of launching this project with me, there are many perks to choose from that include things like merch, and even some private(online) songwriting courses(2). For those who are already in love with my music that you've heard and you want me to come to your church or gathering and bring the atmosphere of heaven, there are special perks for you too! 

The Vision

These songs have come from a deep place in my heart from intimacy with the Father. I truly believe that this will hit home for you in a fresh way and my hope is that you would encounter Jesus through these songs. 

This project is also important to me because of the other platform I have in my life, and that is one that consists of kids who have lived on the streets the majority of their life in Nicaragua. I'm currently training at an MMA gym to be a boxer, and plan on taking boxing down to Nica to open a youth/rehab center. This project is connected because whatever profit I make from this album and more to come, directly helps to support me on this journey of social justice for the children of the world!

 

Risky Business

Our biggest risk is getting the album finished up in a timely manner that allows us to reach our goal of a releasing the EP by April of 2019. Monetary gain can help with this challenge of getting it wrapped up and ready to launch by then. 

Another obstacle would be having the crew be able to go on tour together and it not just be Sparrow(Nate Dickerson). There is nothing wrong with this but of course we would love to take the whole crew on tour! Again, money could be an advantage  to this challenge and each purchase and pre-order will help us accomplish this desire. Also, if you'd like us to come to your church or gathering, please do not hesitate to reach out to us and to purchase the tour package that will be available!

Share the Love

If you are able at this moment to pre-purchase the EP or any merchandise, there will be plenty of opportunity to do so at a later date. But it costs nothing to share this fundraiser and help spread the word about Sparrow and the Dirty Kids! The more you talk about us to your friends, play us on Spotify when the album drops, blast us in your car the more people will know about us and want to purchase our album and bring us in to worship Jesus with them!

BIG THANKS

Special shout out to Chris Lee for shooting the video and Cynthia Massey Herms for the photos! And Andres Mejia for being an amazing, patient producer! And Emily Shilts for my soon coming artwork and logo, and Brian Shilts for all his encouragement and tips! And Matt Spinks for believing in me even when I don't! Love you guys so much! And the biggest thanks to Zach Pratt! Without your love and support man I wouldn't even be as close to the finish line as I am with the first of many albums!

And of course YOU! We appreciate your support and love on every level. Each and everyone of you is precious on our sight!

Love,
Sparrow and the Dirty Kids

story:
I'm an independent recording artist; I'm a singer/songwriter, musician & worshipleader. Currently I'm living in London with my wife Shannon; I'm working as Worship Pastor at St John's Church Hoxton an inner city church in the heart of central London. Although I am originally from the UK I lived in the USA for over 20 years and much of my life and ministry was and still is connected with Southern California. Just before I moved  back to London from Los Angeles, I felt a stirring to gather together a group of great musicians, I rented a fabulous studio and laid down a dozen or so backing tracks for a new album of songs written about Grace, Mercy, Redemption and the walk. The sessions were great and we came out with some very exciting music. I've been plugging away ever since laying down guitars and vocals working towards finishing the album on my own and the good news is it's about 65% there. It's been an inspiring and at times a humbling experience as I've been stretched as a writer, musician, recording engineer and producer. I'll be honest it hasn't always been easy working alone and at times I've almost felt like giving up, but I believe the Lord had told me at the beginning of this project through Matthew 25:25 not to bury the"talents" He has given me.

So here I am, and I need your help to take the project to the next level and really make it shine! I literally can't do it without you. It is my intention to take the tracks back into the studio to finish the album, some of it will be recorded here in the UK and the rest in California with my long term friend and producer Tom Lillo,

My previous album Broken Bones Rejoice also produced by Tom Lillo, received rave reviews,

"Steve's music.....gives it to you raw and real, talking about things like desperation and the majestic nature of God." 
Worship Leader Magazine, Sept 05

"If you think the phrase "dirty guitar" means getting a finger print mark on your nice clean Taylor acoustic during the Contemporary Worship service then beware; this is worship music played from the hip on a Les Paul with the guitar strap worn at its longest setting!"
Andy Piercy, producer (Delirious, Matt Redman, Rita Springer) London Oct 2005

"a studio worship album packed with vibe and free from musical cliché ........ with a raspy soulful passion." 
Cross Rhythms, Mike Rimmer Sept 05 

"...if you need to take a hammer to the candied musical stasis you find in the local Bible bookstore, grab a copy of Broken Bones and swing away." 
Worship Leader Magazine, Sept 05

The Cost

Here's an estimated breakdown of cost, approx $6000 to finish the album I've also included an additional $4000 for promotion including a video to the budget if we raise more is needed for the Album production.


$1500 for additional musicians 
$3000 for studio and engineer 
$350 for mastering the album
$350 for CD Artwork
$800 for CD manufacture/ Printing etc. 

$2000 for Video
$2000 Promotion 

 

Any gift amount is appreciated.

 

I understand some people just can't afford to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please join the prayer team and please pray for me and the project.
  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools! It makes it easy to be a part of the team   

Thank you for your support and prayers.

Steve Counsel
 

This Album is dedicated to the memory of my good friend Colin Cameron who played bass on most of the album and sadly passed away before it's completion, I'm honoured to have this music as a part of his musical legacy, he was a fantastic musician and truly wonderful human being. 

I would just like to thank Martin Butcher and Neil Edwards for putting the promo video together for me. If you need some video work done give them a shout over at

Yodo Creative

Directing | Filming | Editing

+44 (0)787 963 8910

http://yodocreative.com/

story:
QUI EST PAUL SAREAULT, FONDATEUR DU GROUPE UMANY?

Je suis un musicien-artiste-créateur qui prend un malin plaisir à mettre les mots dans un ordre précis et qui rajoute des mélodies sorties tout droit de ma tête pour en faire des chansons. Concours, festivals, studio, albums, collaborations, spectacles, font partie de mon cheminement depuis des années.

J'ai fondé le  groupe UMANY au début des années 2000 dans le seul et unique but de réunir des musiciens pour mettre au monde mes chansons et de faire ce que j'aime le plus; de la musique!

Avec le temps, j'ai compris l'immense potentiel de ce talent et je souhaite vivre de cette passion.Toutefois, il n'est aucunement question de vendre mon âme et mon sang à tous les intermédiaires de cette industrie qui s'en mettent plein les poches au détriment des artistes,  de leurs talents, et surtout de leurs désir de réussir à tout prix!

LE PROJET ET L'OBJECTIF

L'objectif de notre campagne de financement sur Indiegogo est de 20 000$, Le projet consiste à enregistrer des nouvelles chansons, d'en faire la promotion, la diffusion, de les distribuer dans les radios web et conventionnelles partout dans la francophonie mondiale et pouvoir générer des revenus grâce aux redevances de vente, de droit d'auteur, de droit de production et j'en passe. Par le fait même, cela me permettra de devenir autonome et de posséder ma propre entreprise.

Cela peut paraître énorme pour un projet musical indépendant mais c'est peu lorsqu'on compare aux moyens des grosses machines bien huilées. Aujourd'hui, il est possible de réaliser de bonnes choses avec des moyens et des budgets restreints. Il suffit d'avoir un bon plan pour y arriver.

VOICI COMMENT M'AIDER

Il y a deux façons de contribuer à la réussite du Projet musique Umany.

La première est d'acheter une contrepartie soit : un Coup de main, un Coup double, un Coup de pouce, un Coup de coude, un Coup franc ou un Coup de pied. Ce sera pour vous un véritable Coup de génie ou encore un Coup de maître.

La deuxième est de partager le lien du projet et de la vidéo au plus grand nombre de personnes possibles et inimaginables: amis, collègues, camarades, familles, citoyens de la vie !!!

Grâce à vous, je pourrai ainsi réaliser ce projet qui me tient à cœur depuis toujours.

Merci infiniment!

story:
My name is Peggy Stern, and since its inception, I have been the Artistic Director of the Ritenuto Foundation, a 501 c 3 organization dedicated to the presentation of fine music.

For 12 consecutive years we have presented The Wall Street Jazz Festival "where the traditions meet the progressives, and all the leaders are women". This is a free outdoor event held in lovely Uptown Kingston, NY. The Festival is held each year on Labor Day weekend. This year it will be held on August 29th.

The Festival was founded in 2004, with the principle of women-led ensembles. It differs from being a women’s festival, in that the women are free to choose their own personnel; simply said, the bandleaders are in charge of the music they present.

The presentations have been elegant and professional, but the environment has been intimate enough to be very personal. We intend to keep that hometown flavor; it works in our favor to see neighbors enjoying this world-class music for free. We are also drawing an audience from beyond our borders, from Albany to NYC.We have been growing each year; people stream into the street of our festival all evening; estimates of numbers are well beyond 2000 at this point. 

The Festival has developed into a very precious community event, very beloved. We are particularly proud of the level of music we are presenting, and consider it a great gift to the community ( and a free one at that!) However, it costs a great deal of money to continue to produce this yearly event, which is why we are asking for your help this coming year, 2015.

We are very unusual in presenting the works of female composers year after year, and have made our reputation for the past eleven seasons on this fact. The past and present leaders of the bands, who have experienced our festival and concept firsthand, include Ingrid Jensen, "Sweet" Sue Terry, Jay Clayton, Dena Derose, Teri Roiger, to name a few. 

We invite you to peruse our website, http://wallstreetjazzfestival.com for more information. And we hope you join us in our effort in keeping the project going forward.

story:
Intro

 I'm Amy, a singer-songwriter and medical school dropout. 

Yup. I've made quite a few scary decisions and sacrifices to pursue my music career, but...this is all I've ever wanted to do. Make music and make a difference. 

This campaign is a game-changing step for me: I am raising money for professional radio promotion. Radio airplay! I mean..this is the big leagues peeps. 

The deets

There are different levels of radio airplay. I look at it like applying to collges. Here is the breakdown: 

  • $1,800 will fund a college radio campaign. (Remember your "safety" schools?)
  • $4,650 will fund a college radio campaign and a triple A radio campaign.  Triple A is where many artists like Adele create career foundations. (Good fit).
  • $11,650 will fund a College radio, Triple A, and Commercial Campaign..think Disney and XM Sirus Radio. (My reach goal).

The Impact

  • The more people that know about my music and the kick-booty community around it...the more people it can positively impact! 
  • Imagine, you are a teenage girl, going through a rough patch and feeling lonely. All of a sudden you hear this new song on the radio. It's an artist you've never heard of and when you google them, you find a  new community of people who love music, love supporting each other, and love learning ways to live happier, healthier lives! **Can I get a woot woot?!**

The Challenge of the Underdog 

The challenge of this campaign is...nobody can guarantee that a record will be played and the more mainstream the radio station, the less likely it is that they will play an unsigned artist.
 I am definitely the underdog in this arena, however the people I am choosing to work with have decades of experience cultivating relationships with tastemaskers, radio program directors, and DJs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, I still want you to be a part of this journey! Share this campaign with 3 people and head over to amyleo.com to sign up for fresh music and fresh ideas designed to create more love and less stress in your life.

story:
Dear Fans, Friends and Family,

Thanks for all your past support and well wishes. It really makes a difference and gives me the inspiration to continue on my musical journey, now over 30 years in the making. The road has been long but deeply rewarding and I press on.  Now, I could use your support to record and release a brand new album on three formats - Vinyl, CD and High Resolution download. 

2014 was real good to me and my music. After moving to LA and being here for just a short time,, I was fortunate to be in the company of some great musicians and we had lots of fun playing a number of shows in support of my 7th studio album "Circus Town". To top that off, I received the Americana Artist of the Year and Male Vocalist of the Year awards at the 24th Los Angeles Music Awards and equally excited for the nominations for Musical Group and Americana Album.  

The songs for the new album "The Things I Know" were arranged and written specifically for the current band. They're a mix of love songs, travel songs, toe tapping sing alongs and personal narratives. As a bonus, I'll be releasing a 25 minute film "The Phil Celia Band - In the Family Room". Beautifully captured last November, it features interviews with band members, insight into the making of the film and live acoustic performances of some of the albums new songs.  

THE GENESIS OF THE BAND 

In 2013, along with my brother Perry Celia, we recorded the album "Circus Town" and self-released it on Dark Moon Records. During the recording of the album, I was introduced to Abby Posner (string instruments) and Cara Batema ( accordion), two great musicians who were key in giving "Circus Town" it's genre defining sound. The album received critical acclaim, excellent reviews and garnered several award nominations. Abby, Cara and Perry joined me for the live shows and shortly afterwards we added Lelah Simon (acoustic bass) and son David Celia (drums and percussion). 

ALL IT TAKES IS ONE SET OF EYES

We held a CD release party for "Circus Town" at The Mint in Los Angeles and were fortunate to secure LA's premier music publication Music Connection to review the show. The review was excellent and caught the attention of Al Bowman, founder of the Los Angeles Music Awards now in it's 24th year. Al began to follow us which led to four category nominations and two category awards. In addition, the Hollywood Music in Media Awards recognized my song "Out of Tune Guitar" as Americana Song of the Year. To top it off, Music Connection Magazine named us one of the Top 100 bands in the US for 2014! 

SUPPORT US AND BE A PART OF THIS PROJECT 

As an independent artist, I established Dark Moon Records in 1996 to release my own music. I currently have several albums in distribution either as a solo artist or with the bands I've led.  Dark Moon Records has depended on music fans worldwide for their support. We currently distributes through iTunes, Amazon, CD Baby, E-Music, Spotify, Beats Music and dozens of other music sites that promote and distribute music. With your support, the budget for this project will be used for recording the new album and its packaging for release. Your support will also help launch the distribution and promotion for the album. As a bonus, we have completed a 25 minute short film, to be released in high-definition, as a companion piece to the new album by way of HD download.  

YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP WITH ....

- Recording session costs, including studio rental, engineering and production 

- Mastering and preparation for CD, HD digital download and Vinyl distribution 

- HD digital distribution of the film

- Worldwide distribution launch through all music E-tailers

- Initial promotional campaign

story:
ACHTUNG! ATTENTION!

Indiegogo only accepts Creditcard. If you want to support me through PayPal etc, you can write me directly. 

Indiegogo akzeptiert nur Kreditkarten. Möchtest du mich zB per Paypal unterstützen dann geht das an guitarraphael@yahoo.com

 

The world is my home.

Hello my friend, you probably know me from one of the many shows i have done throughout the years or maybe we just met somewhere at a party. 

This campaign will fund the making of my full length album plus all the promotional material i need to promote it.

Making this album would be a dream come true, and you would help me make this dream happen.

__________________________________

Hallo du kennst mich sehr wahrscheinlich von einer meine vielen Shows oder wir haben uns auf anderen Wegen kennen gelernt. 

Dieser Kampagne wird mein erstes Album und alle damit verbundene Promotion Aktionen finanzieren.

Dieses Album fertig zu machen würde ein Traum wahr werden lassen.

 

What I Need & What You Get, Was ich brauche & was du bekommst.

?? In order to make this record a success,  i need to do a lot of promo, which means promo on social media platforms, make videos, ask other artists to help me and pay several different people to make all this happen.

Are you thinking about funding me? I will make it worth your while. I will give out free albums, sofa concerts, full concerts, studio visits and more.

If we do not reach the full amount i am aiming for i will still use the funds to make my videos and do promo, and try to reduce the costs for recording etc by doing a lot of these things myself. 

Instead of having someone professional film me, i will ask a friend for instance

__________________________________

Damit dieses Album ein Erfolg wird, muss ich viel Promo machen auf sozialen Medien, Videos produzieren, andere Künstler dazu holen und einige Leute bezahlen müssen.

Überlegst du mich zu unterstützen? Ich werde dich nicht enttäuschen. Es wird gratis Alben geben, Sofakonzerte, Studiobesuche und mehr.

Erreiche ich den vollen Betrag nicht, werde ich das verdiente Geld trotzdem für die Produktion von Videos und Promotion verwenden und versuchen die Kosten der Aufnahmen zu reduzieren.

 

The Impact, die Auswirkung.

I believe and have always believed that music connects us, it is the global language. With my studio album i want to cross boundaries. Get people to come closer. The world is in a bad place right now, and we can use all the help to feel that we belong to something and are able to communicate with each other and i think this record will achieve that. 

I have been lucky enough to travel the world with my music and with this record i believe i will be able to do more of the same, but on a larger scale. I will also be able to go the places that need inspiration, and show them what can be achieved if you believe in something.

___________________________________

Ich glaube fest daran, dass Musik uns verbindet. Musik ist für mich die globale Sprache. Mit meinem Studioalbum möchte ich Grenzen überqueren und Menschen zusammenbringen aus verschiedenen Kulturen. Die Welt befindet sich gerade in eine globale Krise und ich glaube es wird Menschen inspirieren, Teil eines Projektes zu sein, was uns miteinander verbindet.

Ich hatte das Glück die Welt bereisen zu dürfen mit meiner Musik und dieses Album wird es mir ermöglichen, das auf einer größeren Skala machen zu können. Menschen in aller Welt zu inspirieren und zeigen, dass wenn man fest an etwas glaubt, kann man es auch erreichen.

 

Risks & Challenges

In this day and age social media has become more important than ever, and i believe i have proven to be quite good at managing it. But it does not mean this will be easy. There is so much competition out there and I am certainly not the youngest among the artists. But i am making a totally different record, something most artists are scared off. I am leaving the red line and i am focusing on making something that touches base in different musical genres, different languages, etc. In one sentence, i am trying to make an album for the whole world to enjoy, wherever they might be

Promoting "the world is my home" successfully will probably be my hardest challenge, but also fun to do. And because i believe my fans know what i am about i will be able to overcome that challenge.

_____________________________________

Soziale Medien sind wichtiger denn je und ich glaube ich habe bewiesen, dass ich mich damit relativ gut auskenne. Was nicht heißt, dass Promotion einfach wird. Es gibt momentan so viel Konkurrenz und ich bin auch nicht mehr der jüngste. Allerdings mache ich ein Album was total unterschiedlich ist von den meisten anderen. Ich halte mich nicht an einen roten Faden, sondern versuche Musik-Genren aus aller Welt zu vereinen und auch verschiedene Sprachen. Ich werde ein Album machen, das überall auf der Welt gehört werden kann. 

"The world is my home" zu promoten wird wahrscheinlich die schwierigste Aufgabe, die ich bislang hatte, aber auch Spaß machen. Da ich fest daran glaube, dass meine Fans wissen was Loopro ausmacht, werde ich auch das schaffen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course i do not expect everyone to be able to donate funds to my project. These times aren´t hard only for me, but for many of us. 

But if you do want to help me, you can always create a shoutout or a post on social media. Tell a friend about my project. I will be thankful for all the help i can get.

And of course you can use the indiegogo tools to share my project with your friends and family.

_____________________________________

Natürlich erwarte ich nicht von jedem, dass er mich finanziell unterstützt. Diese Zeiten sind nicht nur schwierig für mich, sondern auch für einige andere.

Wenn du trotzdem helfen möchtest, könntest du zB einen Post teilen auf den sozialen Medien oder deinen Freunden von meinem Projekt erzählen.

Indiegogo bietet verschiedene Möglichkeiten an, dieses Projekt auf den sozialen Medien zu teilen.

story:
Hey everyone! I'm recording my debut record! The whole album is written, but In order to cover the costs of recording, paying my amazing collaborators, I am searching for support from awesome and kind people like you. Thanks in advance for backing me and the other creatives like me, and for helping me make this dream a reality. Anything you are able to give is very much appreciated!

I'm from Poway, California - 'The City in the Country'.  Before my exciting adventures began in the punk rock world with my band Agent 51, I received a world-class musical education in Country Music, Americana and Folk Music as a kid traveling the Rodeo circuit with my family.  Country music is my home. I've always wanted to make a record that expresses those roots of where I come from. Returning to those roots and exploring those influences with a sound that brings together the integrity of punk and the honest storytelling of Americana Country Music. I moved to Nashville in 2017 to explore these roots and met some amazing friends and musicians! I'm also bringing along many of my new musician friends I met while adventuring in there over the last 4 years! I have some great stuff for you in the vein and sound of Tom Petty, Charlie Pride, Marty Robbins, Creedence Clearwater Revival, Guy Clark and Willie Nelson to name a few. I hope you'll join me in exploring this next phase of my musical journey!

In days past, the only options were either doing it alone with very little chance of success, or signing your musical soul away on the dotted line to a few businessmen in suits who once stood as gatekeepers to what you could listen to; but crowdfunding has opened up an alternative to those gatekeepers, and given musicians the ability to control their art with the help of the myriad of those who support them as they make their way down the highways and byways sharing their craft.


Huge chunks work and goes into writing 7-8 original songs, but only when you're ready to set foot in the studio, that's where the real expenses begin with the myriad of steps needed to take to bring a tune that's in your head to a finished song ready to be played for you all to enjoy.  These expenses include studio mixing fees, studio session fees for musicians, mixing fees,  mastering fees, cd printing fees, and then one big expense which I haven't been able to do in the past, but a very important one: marketing and publicity fees to get the word out about the new album!  All these make it very expensive to bring to life an album, and your help is huge in helping me bring that about.
I'll be posting updates, pictures, and videos from the studio process so you can be a part of the journey with me.  Jump on in for the ride - I'm pretty stoked about this project and can't wait to share it with you guys!  THANK YOU from the bottom of my boots, everyone!

 

 

I've put a lot of time and effort (and some money) into this record already, but I don't mind that. I've recorded many of the tracks for the songs at my home studio in San Diego and some in Nashville,  but need help to get the album mixed and mastered and out to you! We estimate that this will cost  $5,500 to complete. These costs include:

Booking Recording Studio in San Diego for 2 days for mixing (8 hours per day)

CD Reproduction Costs

Online Album Promotional/Marketing Costs (Merchandise, Photoshoot, T-shirts, Website, stickers, and shipping costs for mailing backer perks.

Session musician costs for additional recording and CD-release show performance.

 

You can be a co-creator of this album! And of course, we're offering some pretty cool stuff for those of you who help us make this dream happen!

Here are just a few of the cool things you can get for contributing:

Digital Download of the new album

Digital Download of a live acoustic “Stripped” version of the new album

Digital Download of Bonus songs 

Signed CDs

Exclusive T-shirts

Your Name in CD Jacket Thank You's

Producer Credit on the album

An acoustic version of Your Favorite Song 

A live House Concert for you and all your friends

And much more!

 

 

If you're a fan of Americana/Country, Tom Petty, Neil Young, etc or just like a good tune to be your highway companion, this record can be with you for years to come. 

Working with great people, I've had great success in the past building album campaigns that offered tons of value and content to backers just like you. Let's do it again and offer even more value to appreciators of music just like you!

This campaign gives appreciators of music just like you a chance to contribute and make a difference in a real way! With customized content for each backer, we've created a platform where every backer gets great value in return.

 

 

The main hurdle is making sure we hit the deadline in time to offer all backer incentives to their fullest fruition. Having had great success in the past with Crowd-funded projects being both the music maker, graphic designer, and meeting deadlines, I honestly believe we can make this one the best yet!

The Plan is simple. The 60-day deadline gives my team more than enough time to get all necessary songs mixed, mastered, and all merch designed and ordered. We can't wait to get it to you.

 

 

Some people just can't contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Here are a few ways you can help us spread the word and achieve this goal:

Share this campaign with others via social media, email, or good 'ole word of mouth!

Spread the word about the album to your friends & family, and encourage people to follow us on YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, and at my website ChrisArmes.com!

Stream or download our existing music wherever you consume your tunes: just search for "Chris Armes"

Thank you for reading, giving, listening, etc. It's difficult to express in words how much your support means to me and all other artists out there that want nothing more than to make their songs a reality. Thank again from the bottom of my heart! I cannot wait to get this record out to you guys.

 

If at anytime any of you have questions about anything, feel free to email me.

We estimate that this will cost  $5,500 to complete. These costs include:Booking Recording Studio in San Diego for 2 days for mixing (8 hours per day)CD Reproduction CostsOnline Album Promotional/Marketing Costs (Merchandise, Photoshoot, T-shirts, Website, stickers, and shipping costs for mailing backer perks.Session musician costs for additional recording and CD-release show performance. You can be a co-creator of this album! And of course, we're offering some pretty cool stuff for those of you who help us make this dream happen!Here are just a few of the cool things you can get for contributing:Digital Download of the new albumDigital Download of a live acoustic “Stripped” version of the new albumDigital Download of Bonus songs Signed CDsExclusive T-shirtsYour Name in CD Jacket Thank You'sProducer Credit on the albumAn acoustic version of Your Favorite Song A live House Concert for you and all your friendsAnd much more!  If you're a fan of Americana/Country, Tom Petty, Neil Young, etc or just like a good tune to be your highway companion, this record can be with you for years to come. Working with great people, I've had great success in the past building album campaigns that offered tons of value and content to backers just like you. Let's do it again and offer even more value to appreciators of music just like you!This campaign gives appreciators of music just like you a chance to contribute and make a difference in a real way! With customized content for each backer, we've created a platform where every backer gets great value in return.  The main hurdle is making sure we hit the deadline in time to offer all backer incentives to their fullest fruition. Having had great success in the past with Crowd-funded projects being both the music maker, graphic designer, and meeting deadlines, I honestly believe we can make this one the best yet!The Plan is simple. The 60-day deadline gives my team more than enough time to get all necessary songs mixed, mastered, and all merch designed and ordered. We can't wait to get it to you.  Some people just can't contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean you can't help!Here are a few ways you can help us spread the word and achieve this goal:Share this campaign with others via social media, email, or good 'ole word of mouth!Spread the word about the album to your friends & family, and encourage people to follow us on YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, and at my website ChrisArmes.com!Stream or download our existing music wherever you consume your tunes: just search for "Chris Armes"Thank you for reading, giving, listening, etc. It's difficult to express in words how much your support means to me and all other artists out there that want nothing more than to make their songs a reality. Thank again from the bottom of my heart! I cannot wait to get this record out to you guys. If at anytime any of you have questions about anything, feel free to email me.

story:
Short Summary

Deadly diets, pandemics, stay-at-home orders, mask mandates, political corruption, economic ruin, and that was just 2020. To what extent are musicians and artists making creative music that reflects this time?

We are setting out to create a revolutionary album of epic music that reflects the world with which we live. We endeavor to create life-changing music. Music that can transform the consciousness of the listener. The music will remove obstruction and energize the weakest of bodies:

  • Prof. Spira & Brother Air: Fire Music Project is known for their intense free improvisational music-making,  creative arrangements of jazz standards, funk-infused groove-oriented pieces, unique “jazz” treatments of pop tunes, as well as original compositions. The collective specializes in captivating audiences with their palpable creativity, superb musicianship, intense groove, and fascinating instrumentation. 
  • We are raising the production costs for our new album.
  • We are going to put everything we have into this album and produce something that will stand the test of time and bare witness to this era. We aspire to follow in the footsteps of the many musicians that created music that became the "soundtrack" of their eras. 

Check out our promo reel: 

 

What We Need & What You Get

These funds will cover studio time in a world-class studio with world-class engineers, editing, marketing, equipment, and other expenses needed to make this album a reality.

For Your Donations: 

1/15/2021 Gifts

The Giver

  • $10 - A Sincere Thank You!

The Downloader

  • $25 - In keeping with the times..."The Downloader" is a deluxe digital download package including high-resolution digital downloads of the full-length album, album art, and full-color digital print files of the lyrics & storylines in the album (containing the lyrics for the entirety of the album).

Included Items

  • Pre-Release Album Download
  • Digital Copy of Lyric Book
  • Digital Art Package

The Helper

  • $50 - A Sincere Thank You!
  • For those who want to help but don't want any perks. Thank you very much for your support and contribution!

The Disc Spinner

  • $75 - CD with Cover Signed by the Band
  • Pre-release album download
  • Digital Copy of Lyrics & Storylines
  • Digital Art Package

The Supporter

  • $100 - A Sincere Thank You!
  • This is for those who want to help but don't want a perk. Thank you so much for your support and contribution!

The Patron

  • $200 - All of the previous perks, plus
  • 15 minute video call with Prof. Spira & Brother Air
  • Copy of the Annotated Mucusless Diet Book Autographed by Prof. Spira (free shipping for U.S. residents)
  • Digital copies of all 7 Mucus-free Life books. 

The Impact

We want this music to be transformational to all who listen. To identify and exorcise the pain of the era, and vibrationally move to a state of liberation and inspiration:

  • Few musicians, especially with jazz backgrounds, are making music for THIS MOMENT. Few are following in the footsteps of musicians such as Archie Shepp, Charles Mingus, John Coltrane, and others who created music that defined their historical eras. 

Check out our promo reel: 

 
  • With that shared, the sound of our band has been evolving, and our concept album will be on a whole other level!

Risks & Challenges

We are determined to make this album, but if we do not have funding to market it properly, no one will have the opportunity to hear the music. We want to be able to produce the album and market it properly!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute but would still like to help us out:

  • Get the word out about our campaign. Share the link on your social media and encourage your friends to support us. 
  • Use the Indiegogo Share Tools. 

 

To see bios of the members and more media, visit www.firemusicproject.com

story:
For those who have missed the sound and experience of live music for the last 18 months, it’s finally back. And your attendance at a very special concert will benefit so many people who have suffered huge losses from the pandemic.

“Concert for Peace” on September 11th

On September 11, 2021, Musicians For Harmony (M4H) will bring music back to the concert stage in a live celebration of our 20th Anniversary. This event, hosted at Kaufman Music Center’s Merkin Hall in NYC, will feature performances by:

  • The Juilliard String Quartet
  • Syrian clarinetist Kinan Azmeh with his CityBand
  • ETHEL
  • Musique Sans Frontières, led by Patrick Derivaz

This concert will be simultaneously live-streamed to viewers around the world.

Musicians Have Suffered

For the last year and a half, musicians have been struggling. At first, just a few performances were postponed — but then came the mass cancellation of concerts and tours everywhere. Within a matter of weeks, the coronavirus outbreak had put the entire music industry on hold, and musicians lost what was left of their livelihoods.

Musicians For Harmony wants to help. Our “Concert for Peace” on September 11th – which coincides with the 20th anniversary of 9/11 and commemorates the memory of those lost that day – will serve as a fundraiser for musicians impacted by the pandemic. Once we have met our expenses, proceeds from ticket sales will go to organizations supporting these artists. Online concertgoers will also be encouraged to donate to these groups.

Why We Need You

We know you want to see musicians back on stage just as much as we do! To offset the costs of our event – such as hall rental, concert production, and videography for the live broadcast – we are seeking the support of music fans like you.

Donors who give $150 or more will receive a free pair of tickets to the in-person concert on September 11th.

About Musicians For Harmony

Musicians For Harmony was founded in the wake of September 11 to foster and advance the cause of peace through music.

Our performances have been featured in The New York Times (“sounds rising above prejudice”), The New Yorker (“an annual testament to peace”), New York Daily News (“an international peace-keeping force”), Crain’s New York (“concerted effort for good will”), The Associated Press and Time Out NY, among others.

M4H’s educational workshops and mentorship programs have reached hundreds of young musicians over the years, both in NYC’s public schools and through cultural exchange programs overseas.

Risks & Challenges

We understand that sometimes things happen. Living in the era of Covid has only added to our level of uncertainty, and has created huge challenges for musicians who want to perform in front of live audiences.

While we feel confident that our in-person concert will be fully realized, we have created a live-streaming option to ensure that everyone who wants to join us on September 11th will be able to watch the concert. We are committed to creating a safe and inspiring environment for all our guests - both live audience and remote.

story:
Resumen corto

Más que un equipo ministerial, Para Su Gloria es un movimiento de hermanos y hermanas en la fe cristiana que anhela ver la Palabra de Dios llenar y guiar cada uno de los ministerios de nuestras Iglesias. 

Creemos que la Biblia es autoritativa en todo lo que concierne a nuestro caminar y crecimiento en la fe cristiana, y que debe llenar tanto el mensaje que se predica desde nuestros púlpitos, como nuestra devoción congregacional (nuestros cantos, oraciones y servicio).

Con el deseo de proveer recursos que animen a la Iglesia a abrazar la Palabra de Dios en sus cantos grabamos hace tres años un álbum con abundante contenido bíblico y centrado en la soberanía de Dios, el cual se llamó “El fin desde el principio”. Este contaba con 11 canciones, de las cuales 5 fueron inéditas y escritas pensando en suplir de nuevos himnos contemporáneos a la Iglesia hispanohablante.

Con tu contribución a este proyecto, nuestro segundo álbum, podremos continuar impactando a iglesias de habla hispana en todo el mundo con contenido bíblico de alta calidad.

Lo que necesitamos

Para este proyecto, que consiste en la grabación en vivo de nuestro segundo álbum y todos los costos que eso supone, nuestro objetivo de recaudación de fondos es de US$17,300. Este monto incluye:

  • Costos de grabación de audio y video en vivo.
  • Costos de postproducción de audio y video.
  • Honorarios de equipo técnico que no es voluntario.
  • Logística y transporte de la banda.

En caso de que no alcancemos el objetivo completo de esta campaña particular, utilizaremos los fondos adquiridos por esta vía para cubrir lo que podamos y continuaremos activando iniciativas hasta alcanzar el objetivo. Siempre confiando en el perfecto plan de Dios con este proyecto.

El impacto

Luego de numerosas interacciones con líderes y pastores, hemos visto a “El fin desde el Principio” servir no solo como una provisión de canciones cristianas, sino también como el punto de partida de un avivamiento de Dios en nuestras iglesias hispanohablantes. En vista de esto, sentimos hoy más que nunca que nuestro llamado y compromiso como ministerio es seguir proveyendo a la iglesia del Señor de canciones que exalten Su gloria y le reflejen fielmente.

A casi dos años del lanzamiento de nuestro primer álbum, nos hemos propuesto grabar en mayo del 2021 nuestra segunda producción si el Señor así lo permite. Esta será grabada en vivo en Lakeland, Florida y constará de 14 canciones inéditas saturadas de la Palabra de Dios. Al igual que en nuestra primera producción, hoy recurrimos a nuestros hermanos, amigos y colaboradores para poder recaudar los fondos necesarios para este reto.

Tu colaboración

Antes de tomar la decisión de apoyar este proyecto, te pedimos que ores para que Señor ponga en tu corazón la forma en la que deberías colaborar con nosotros. 

Aquí te dejamos algunas opciones, adicionales a apoyar esta campaña:

  1. Ora por nosotros. Aunque esta es nuestra segunda producción, y pensamos que sabemos un poco más cómo llevar este proyecto a cabo: seguimos necesitando del mismo Dios que necesitamos en la primera vuelta. Siempre que nos recuerdes, por favor, preséntanos delante del Señor en ese instante.
  2. Escucha nuestro primer album (en lo que el segundo termina de cocinarse). Esto nos ayuda a posicionarnos mejor en las diferentes plataformas de reproducción de música, y así, cuando el próximo álbum esté listo, podremos alcanzar un mayor número de personas.
  3. Comparte esta campaña. Aunque no puedas colaborar financieramente, sí puedes ayudarnos haciéndote eco de la campaña y dando nuestro proyecto a conocer.
  4. Sigue nuestro proceso. Acompáñanos, aunque sea a la distancia y de manera virtual.

Cualquiera que sea la versión de tu colaboración, la agradecemos muchísimo. ¡Bendiciones!

story:
Patrick’s new Album!

It’s been an unprecedented year and I am SO excited to be looking at a new year of opportunity as we open back up together. I am back in the studio working to bring new music to life, and giving you, my fans and supporters, an opportunity to help in the process through my crowdfunding campaign. This has been in the works for some time, but my schedule prevented me from realizing this project sooner.  I have been writing new music and preparing a new album for release in the very near future, and now this feels like the right time. I invite you to become a partner in this new musical endeavor. Thank you in advance for your consideration and support!

The Impact

Your contribution will be integral in the success of this record.  There are many costs associated with making an album such as:

* Recording costs-studio time, musicians, mastering

* Promotional costs-radio, print, internet campaigns

* Photo/video shoot

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't support financially, you could be a huge help in the following ways:

* Follow me on social media (Facebook, Instagram, etc.)

* Sign up for my mailing list

* Share this campaign and let people know

 

Thank you so much!

story:
Mer Sal is the singer and plays some bass tracks on Adjustments.  
Scott Kinsey plays the keyboards and he is also the producer and engineer. 

We think we’ve got a great jazz-synth-prog-pop album that explores our unique talents when put into one band. 
We’ve spent two years in the studio on what we think is a stellar creative endeavor!
We don’t want incredible efforts of brilliant and hard creative work to go to waste - we would like Adjustments to see the light of day. 
Therefore it’s important that we raise the money to hire a publicist in today’s market.  


If you contribute to us, you will help Scott Kinsey, an artist who already stands out, to gain more recognition - perhaps even outside of the fusion world where he is always making a splash. 
Scott Kinsey is a pioneer at the forefront of the jazz synth - who has worked with Tribal Tech (with Scott Henderson and Gary Willis), David Holmes, Matthew Garrison, Robben Ford, Danny Carey, Joe Zawinul, Zach Danziger, and so many others.

Mer Sal is a newcomer to this scene, but her hard work and talent and marketing has brought her onto the same stage.  Mer Sal fortuitously was discovered by the Yellow Jackets bassist Jimmy Haslip, who introduced her to other producers in LA, where she has been working now for a year.  Mer Sal has been singing on recordings with Bob Reynolds, Jeff Lorber, Melbreeze, Peter Erskine, Gary Novak, Mitch Foreman, Laura Clery/Stephen Hilton, and so on.  

We need to raise 5-7k to cover the costs of a strong and reputable publicist and for CD pressings. 
With proper funding, we can hire the best publicists in the business, to help us get the album into as many ears as possible.  

A donation can equate a merchandise purchase, an experience with us, or a simple money donation.  You will receive a CD with all perks over $22, and if we forgot to include it in the listing, mention it to us and we'll send you one! 
The perks are all listed for you to check out. 

Scott has a successful, yet under the radar career  - with many great albums released on several labels, and many tours. 
Mer has run one successful crowd-funding campaign once before - and is thankful for everyone who helped her travel to Memphis, where she scored into the semi-finals of the IBC’s.  

The album Adjustments is so unique, it just might change music for you!


If we can’t hire a publicist, we simply won’t get radio play, press coverage, and other help that could result in bookings and therefore employment for us.  
The players on the record are some rare and deserving talents from across the globe who are changing music already in their own projects.  

Some of the cutting edge players featured on Adjustments include such players as drummers Gary Novak, Gergo Borlai, and Danny Carey from Tool...guitarists Pedro Martins, Alex Machacek, Oz Noy, and Nir Felder, Pixar sax and EWI player Steve Tavaglione, bass players Hadrien Feraud, Jimmy Haslip, Tim Lefebvre, just to name a few! 

It would be a shame if their work for this album were to go to waste.  Not to mention, Scott Kinsey has put in two years of his life, mixing and mastering it. 

So, please help us get the word out, tell your people!
Just use the Indiegogo share tools.  

Thank you, it would mean SO much to us!
story_txt:
Mer Sal is the singer and plays some bass tracks on Adjustments.  Scott Kinsey plays the keyboards and he is also the producer and engineer. We think we’ve got a great jazz-synth-prog-pop album that explores our unique talents when put into one band. We’ve spent two years in the studio on what we think is a stellar creative endeavor!We don’t want incredible efforts of brilliant and hard creative work to go to waste - we would like Adjustments to see the light of day. Therefore it’s important that we raise the money to hire a publicist in today’s market.  
If you contribute to us, you will help Scott Kinsey, an artist who already stands out, to gain more recognition - perhaps even outside of the fusion world where he is always making a splash. Scott Kinsey is a pioneer at the forefront of the jazz synth - who has worked with Tribal Tech (with Scott Henderson and Gary Willis), David Holmes, Matthew Garrison, Robben Ford, Danny Carey, Joe Zawinul, Zach Danziger, and so many others.
Mer Sal is a newcomer to this scene, but her hard work and talent and marketing has brought her onto the same stage.  Mer Sal fortuitously was discovered by the Yellow Jackets bassist Jimmy Haslip, who introduced her to other producers in LA, where she has been working now for a year.  Mer Sal has been singing on recordings with Bob Reynolds, Jeff Lorber, Melbreeze, Peter Erskine, Gary Novak, Mitch Foreman, Laura Clery/Stephen Hilton, and so on.  
We need to raise 5-7k to cover the costs of a strong and reputable publicist and for CD pressings. With proper funding, we can hire the best publicists in the business, to help us get the album into as many ears as possible.  A donation can equate a merchandise purchase, an experience with us, or a simple money donation.  You will receive a CD with all perks over $22, and if we forgot to include it in the listing, mention it to us and we'll send you one! The perks are all listed for you to check out. Scott has a successful, yet under the radar career  - with many great albums released on several labels, and many tours. Mer has run one successful crowd-funding campaign once before - and is thankful for everyone who helped her travel to Memphis, where she scored into the semi-finals of the IBC’s.  The album Adjustments is so unique, it just might change music for you!If we can’t hire a publicist, we simply won’t get radio play, press coverage, and other help that could result in bookings and therefore employment for us.  The players on the record are some rare and deserving talents from across the globe who are changing music already in their own projects.  
Some of the cutting edge players featured on Adjustments include such players as drummers Gary Novak, Gergo Borlai, and Danny Carey from Tool...guitarists Pedro Martins, Alex Machacek, Oz Noy, and Nir Felder, Pixar sax and EWI player Steve Tavaglione, bass players Hadrien Feraud, Jimmy Haslip, Tim Lefebvre, just to name a few! 
It would be a shame if their work for this album were to go to waste.  Not to mention, Scott Kinsey has put in two years of his life, mixing and mastering it. So, please help us get the word out, tell your people!Just use the Indiegogo share tools.  Thank you, it would mean SO much to us!

story:
We are Jawad and Seraj. We are AK13, a hip-hop group from Kabul, Afghanistan. We also rap with Hadi and Soaban as LBR. We are political freestyle rappers who desire peace and societal change for our country.

We use music and rap to speak up about the challenges and dangers we face every day – war, poverty, mental health and the trauma of growing up in a conflict zone. We love mixing with classical Afghan instruments – that’s our distinct tone.

Beyond this, we are students just trying to take care of our families. We have put on some shows in Kabul, wherever it’s safe. We only dream of being able to perform internationally. But for now, our stage is digital. We are in a battle for the hearts and minds of young Afghans, and our lyrics are our weapons. We want to bring people away from intolerance and religious extremism and show them a different way forward in Afghanistan. 

We love connecting with our fans from all over the world. Our first two music videos – Kabul az Maast and I AM (featuring rapper Saher Melody) collectively have more than two million views on YouTube. Our music has even caught the attention of rap artists like Atlanta-based King Darius, a ghostwriter for Lil Wayne. We are currently working on a collaboration with him.

And so, we want to produce more, but our equipment is broken and outdated, and we have to work multiple jobs just to afford our studio rent.

To help us create our next album and new songs, we need your help. Our goal for this campaign is $10,000, which will go towards recording, mixing, mastering, new equipment, and creating new music videos so more people in Afghanistan and around the world can hear our work and feel the power of freedom and justice. 

Our story was recently featured in a VICE article. We have also been featured in the LA Times.
