story:
Short Summary

  • I am Fraya Thomsen, a composer from the Highlands of Scotland who grew up in the world of Gaelic music. Over the last four and a half years I have enjoyed applying this musical background to composing for film, which I studied an MA in at the National Film and TV School. I play the harp and sing and have performed and taught at festivals all over the world, most notably in a duo called The Duplets.
  • I have won awards for my film composing and my compositions for harp are included in both the Trinity and Scottish grade exam syllabus'. 
  • Here is a link to my film music showreel: https://vimeo.com/151828528
  • I have a burning desire to record the music that I composed for Celtic Connections' at the highest quality I can afford because I believe it is beautiful and honest music which communicates an important sentiment, one that is relevant and empowering amidst todays atomised western societies. ​A recent review of our live concert asserted: 

"a musical and rhetorical triumph, a coherent argument beautifully structured" David Francis-  TRACS

  • Exploring themes of interconnectivity, youthful idealism/clarity, empowerment and communication has been incredibly rewarding for me, and I would love to think that perhaps Community and Stardust can be empowering to those who hear it. Here is a solo version of For The Water Protectors, and theme I composed for Community and Stardust: 

  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xryQMSauy34

  • I was delighted to appear live on BBC Radio 2 The Arts Show with Jonathan Ross, who I am grateful to for encouraging me to create a crowd fundraising campaign for this project. 

  • Here is a snippet of the interview and music we played on BBC Radio 2: https://soundcloud.com/fraya-thomsen/bbc-radio-2-arts-show-jonathan-ross-fraya-thomsen-and-heloise-werner

  • Musical recording quality is dependant on a number of factors, which money CAN buy. 

​It is really important to me to spend significant time in pre production with a producer and engineer as well as rehearsing with the musicians thoroughly.

Room shape, sound isolation and the quality of equipment such as pre amps and microphones also play a large part in determining the quality of a recording. 

These days it is really hard to find financial support with which to make studio albums due to a number of factors including the impact of digital downloading, so your contribution is likely to facilitate something which would be unachievable without you. Completing an album of this music will enable me to share it in such a widespread way that is just not possible otherwise. I will send it to numerous radio stations and podcasters as well as using it to approach concert bookers with. CD sales will also be a great financial contribution towards the costs of performing with the whole line up which is of great importance if we are to perform at the niche music venues and festivals that we the band all know and love. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break down:

  • To record and produce this music I will work with a number of highly skilled collaborators who will all need to be paid professional rates for their time and expertise. These will include:
  • Musicians
  • Producer
  • Engineer
  • Studio Hire
  • Publicist
  • Artwork
  • CD Duplication
  • Indegogo / Banking Fees = 10%
  • Postage and overheads of award packages for sponsors.

 

  • REWARDS! 
  • We appreciate everyones contributions greatly and have created a number of different award packages that we hope will be appealing. 
  • ​Everyone who sponsors this project will have their name included in the CD artwork becoming a part of the Stardust community as we gather momentum. 
  • Please see more options in the PERKS section. 
  • FLEXIBILITY
  • If we reach or even exceed our stated financial goal we will be able to make a high quality product which we can all be proud of. If there are any funds left over we will use these to facilitate an album launch tour. 
  • If we do not reach our stated goal, I will continue my work towards producing, manufacturing and distributing the album none the less. I may have to make compromises in terms of which recording facility I use, and how many rehearsals/pre production meetings I have in advance of the recording process. It will take longer to make the album and there may be longer gaps in between the various stages of the process whilst I raise capital in every way I can, but it will be made!

Inspiration Behind the Music

  • Connectivity:

'We are connected' - a lyric from Community and Stardust, is one of the most crucial things that I have grown to understand in the last year or more. In a sense Community and Stardust aims to be a musical equivalent of the Metta Bhavana practice where, in meditation, Buddhists wish health, happiness and progression for themselves and others on both a personal and universal level. I have aimed for my piece to balance beauty and optimism with the confrontation of some unapologetically socio political lyrics. 

  • Youthful clarity and Idealism:

I love the fact that when you ask a child what they would like to change about the world they will usually come up with something huge like 'stop all hunger' and another I worked with recently when asked what thing she thinks everyone deserves to have in their lives said 'peace". 

I decided to rebel against the idea a friend proposed to me during development that it is immature to be upset about all injustice. Frankly I think most injustice is connected and usually a consequence of greed. So why should I focus on just one area? In the UK we are starting to try to change the fact that many voices are under represented in the media and the arts, and I believe that this message is one of value, hence the lyric 'All I want to do is save the world' meant as a celebration of simple, holistic values. 

  • Empowerment:

There have been times in history where there was a cultural move towards optimism and equality, and there have been times in history when revolutions have been largely identified by the music that accompanied them. Billy Bragg, a song writer who I hold in very high esteem, said at a festival in the north of Scotland that cynicism is the greatest threat to justice and equality. This wonderful observation has guided my approach to my own life as well as my approach to composing Community and Stardust. I aim to empower the audience by blowing away the residual cobwebs of negativity gathered through the experience of financial struggle, politicians speeches, constant advertising and consumerism, and survival of the fittest attitudes which disable us from enjoying each other's success. It is too easy to feel defeated, and so I have explored this feeling, given it a melody and I hope that in my honesty I can allow others to recognise and shed cynicism or defeatism if that is useful for them.    

​Here is a solo version of one of the songs in Community and Stardust:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bbLWxKZJRV0

  • Communication and Improvising:

Communal music making is a wordless from of communication, and I feel this channel of communication is vastly heightened when improvisation is introduced. It was really important to me to create structures within which the Community and Stardust musicians could improvise facilitating each musician to share an expression of themselves through their instrument. The energy that this style of communal music making generates is exciting and palpable and is a valuable gift to share both for the makers and the beholders. There is a marked difference in the journey of a pre composed structured melody and musical improvisation which appears much more as a stream of consciousness. I hope that in celebrating the individuals and their consciousness, we can encourage individuality and a joy in communication. 

 

The Impact

  • One of the great values of this project is that the group of musicians who have engaged in it are all world renowned musicians and represent a number of different genres. Their energy, enthusiasm and understanding of the piece is tangible in the way they play, rehearse and discuss it. Our rehearsal process thus far has been very special as I have deliberately worked with musicians that I hadn't worked with before. The journey of learning each others varied strengths has produced a warm and exciting energy in the group. This, alongside a number of structures devised for improvising brings a communication and spontaneity which really allows us to share and communicate the theme of interconnection which the piece is based on. 
  • I have been involved in the making and distribution of a number of independent albums over the years most notably The Duplets' Tree of Strings and Leverage which both received airplay on a number of BBC radio programmes as well as being highlighted as album of the week and month in Radio Nan Gaidheal, Celtic Music Radio and Heartland FM. They both received numerous reviews such as: 
  • “The two harps entrance with their poise and beauty.” - Delyth Jenkins - (Tapas) 

​

  • And the accompanying music video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cZCk5Tx54tQ
  • "It has that fiery passion that only tangled emotions seems to evoke... one of the most interesting compositions on the album is 'Surtsey', a song about the spectacular and violent birth of that volcanic island." Neil King, (FEATA)

 

  • An excerpt from a review of my publication of compositions for harp teaching; "it is a great collection of neo-Celtic tunes deeply rooted in the Scottish tradition." Alex Monaghan - Folkworld
  • Introducing the musicians: 

Sarah Alen

 

Specialising in traditional routed tunes, Sarah can most often be found touring the folk festival circuit with the internationally acclaimed band Flook. "A sensational live act.... in the front rank of the innovators" - The Rough Guide to Irish Music

Sarah Dacey 

Sarah is a member of Juice  a critically acclaimed vocal trio specialising in contemporary music. She was the soprano soloist in the London premiere of Claude Vivier’s 'Glaubst du an die Unsterblichkeit der Seele' with the London Contemporary Orchestra and gave the Qatari premiere of Gavin Bryars’ 'The Adnan Songbook' with members of the Qatar Philharmonic Orchestra in Doha. Her debut album, a CD of contemporary songs with pianist Belinda Jones, was released on The Foundry label. Sarah also composes and arranges vocal music and is published by UYMP. 

Eddy Hackett

Eddy plays as Guest Principal Percussionist with the London Philharmonic Orchestra, Britten Sinfonia, City of Birmingham Symphony Orchestra, Ulster Orchestra, RTE Concert Orchestra, Scottish Chamber Orchestra. He has played Principal Timpani with the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra and Symphony Orchestra of India. He has also depped with groups such as the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House, Royal Ballet Sinfonia, Glyndebourne Festival Opera, Royal Scottish National Orchestra, Royal Liverpool Philharmonic Orchestra, Qatar Philharmonic Orchestra, Malaysia Philharmonic Orchestra, Scottish Ballet, Nordwestdeutsche Philharmonie and Royal Rotterdam Philharmonic Orchestra.

Shanty Jayasingha

Shanti's music is incredibly far reaching though he is probably best known for his work in world music and jazz. As well as playing in bands such as Salsa Celtica and Karen Tweed and Friends, he is also the musical director at the Grand Union Summer School.“In this band he lets rip, soaring into his upper register with short, choppy phrases in the best Afro-Cuban tradition, or creating moody atmospheres with his harmon mute” Alyn Shipton, The Times 18.4.02

Louise McMonagle

Centered around classical and new music, Louise can be heard in a range of settings from solo works at festivals such as Ittingen Pfingstkonzert (Switzerland) to chamber groups The Riot Ensemble and Ensemble Amorpha. She works regularly with the Royal Opera House orchestral and the Royal Philharmonia. “Cellist Louise McMonagle’s playing was especially vivid, with its powerful combination of precision and intensity.” Jonathan Russell – Bachtrack.

Colette O'Leary

Born in the highly musical area of Sliabh Luachra in Co. Kerry, Colette's musical passions encompass  Celtic, Irish, Scottish, French, Italian, Eastern European, Russian and South American music. She is a two time All Ireland Champion and a founder member of The Bumblebees.  Celtic, Irish, Scottish, French, Italian, Eastern European, Russian and South American. “Nothing short of sublime, the dance sets implausibly quick, yet immaculately detailed, brilliantly intense yet utterly supple, silkily dovetailed in a thrilling panapoly of colour, texture and taut-sprung rhythms” (The Scotsman *****)

Heloise Werner

Recently described by The Stage as “a rising figure on the contemporary music scene” and by The CUSP Magazine as “one of the most exciting young sopranos emerging in the industry”.She is shortlisted for a Royal Philharmonic Society Music Award 2017 in the Young Artist category. The annual RPS Music Awards, presented in association with BBC Radio 3, are the highest recognition for live classical music in the UK. As a soloist, she has performed at London’s leading music venues including Royal Festival Hall, Wigmore Hall, Kings Place, St John’s Smith Square, Wilton’s Music Hall, The Forge, Blackheath Halls and Union Chapel, and been broadcast on BBC Radio 2, BBC Radio 3, Classic FM, Resonance FM and London Live. 

Lucy Cash

Lucy is an artist and moving-image maker. She is drawn to beginning with the extraordinary appearance of ordinary things – things that invite small interventions between the poetic and scientific, philosophical and humorous, intimate and political. Her moving image work has been shown on television, (Ch4, Filmfour, BBC4 and BBC2) and internationally in both galleries and at film festivals.

Risks & Challenges

It is of utmost importance that I choose an engineer and producer wisely as they will have a huge influence on the sound quality and content of the final album. I have already started conversations with a number of talented people and have undertaken extensive listening research. I am presently keeping an open mind regarding who to bring on board. 

Similarly I have started researching various options regarding distribution and marketing, and will make sure that I fully understand any agreements that I engage in. 

I intend to make a realistic time frame for the recording and duplication of the album, so that they are definitely ready in time for any album launch concerts.

As I have made a number of independent releases before, I feel I will be equipped with the skills to make this project a success. I will work closely with the people I employ in order to make the very best of every opportunity. I very much enjoy recording and producing music in a studio setting and have much and varied experience of doing so both as a performer and as a composer. I am confident that I can apply this experience to this new project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about my project. I understand that not everyone can contribute financially so I would like to mention that if you would be happy to share this project page with your network that would be a fantastic support! 
  • If you are interested in booking the full line up once the album is complete please do get in touch!
  • If you would be interested in booking me to play a solo performance, I will be putting 50% of my gig earnings towards this project. 
  • Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Shanty Jayasingha

Shanti's music is incredibly far reaching though he is probably best known for his work in world music and jazz. As well as playing in bands such as Salsa Celtica and Karen Tweed and Friends, he is also the musical director at the Grand Union Summer School.“In this band he lets rip, soaring into his upper register with short, choppy phrases in the best Afro-Cuban tradition, or creating moody atmospheres with his harmon mute” Alyn Shipton, The Times 18.4.02
Louise McMonagle

Centered around classical and new music, Louise can be heard in a range of settings from solo works at festivals such as Ittingen Pfingstkonzert (Switzerland) to chamber groups The Riot Ensemble and Ensemble Amorpha. She works regularly with the Royal Opera House orchestral and the Royal Philharmonia. “Cellist Louise McMonagle’s playing was especially vivid, with its powerful combination of precision and intensity.” Jonathan Russell – Bachtrack.
Colette O'Leary

Born in the highly musical area of Sliabh Luachra in Co. Kerry, Colette's musical passions encompass  Celtic, Irish, Scottish, French, Italian, Eastern European, Russian and South American music. She is a two time All Ireland Champion and a founder member of The Bumblebees.  Celtic, Irish, Scottish, French, Italian, Eastern European, Russian and South American. “Nothing short of sublime, the dance sets implausibly quick, yet immaculately detailed, brilliantly intense yet utterly supple, silkily dovetailed in a thrilling panapoly of colour, texture and taut-sprung rhythms” (The Scotsman *****)
Heloise Werner

Recently described by The Stage as “a rising figure on the contemporary music scene” and by The CUSP Magazine as “one of the most exciting young sopranos emerging in the industry”.She is shortlisted for a Royal Philharmonic Society Music Award 2017 in the Young Artist category. The annual RPS Music Awards, presented in association with BBC Radio 3, are the highest recognition for live classical music in the UK. As a soloist, she has performed at London’s leading music venues including Royal Festival Hall, Wigmore Hall, Kings Place, St John’s Smith Square, Wilton’s Music Hall, The Forge, Blackheath Halls and Union Chapel, and been broadcast on BBC Radio 2, BBC Radio 3, Classic FM, Resonance FM and London Live. 
Lucy Cash

Lucy is an artist and moving-image maker. She is drawn to beginning with the extraordinary appearance of ordinary things – things that invite small interventions between the poetic and scientific, philosophical and humorous, intimate and political. Her moving image work has been shown on television, (Ch4, Filmfour, BBC4 and BBC2) and internationally in both galleries and at film festivals.
Risks & Challenges

It is of utmost importance that I choose an engineer and producer wisely as they will have a huge influence on the sound quality and content of the final album. I have already started conversations with a number of talented people and have undertaken extensive listening research. I am presently keeping an open mind regarding who to bring on board. 
Similarly I have started researching various options regarding distribution and marketing, and will make sure that I fully understand any agreements that I engage in. 
I intend to make a realistic time frame for the recording and duplication of the album, so that they are definitely ready in time for any album launch concerts.
As I have made a number of independent releases before, I feel I will be equipped with the skills to make this project a success. I will work closely with the people I employ in order to make the very best of every opportunity. I very much enjoy recording and producing music in a studio setting and have much and varied experience of doing so both as a performer and as a composer. I am confident that I can apply this experience to this new project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about my project. I understand that not everyone can contribute financially so I would like to mention that if you would be happy to share this project page with your network that would be a fantastic support! 
If you are interested in booking the full line up once the album is complete please do get in touch!
If you would be interested in booking me to play a solo performance, I will be putting 50% of my gig earnings towards this project. 
Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Why This Campaign Matters

Renaissance Human is a new movement to activate the creative spark that lies within each human being.

In our techno-frantic lives filled with daunting problems and civilization-threatening crises, it can be hard to hear, let alone activate, that creative voice inside us. The voice that wants to be heard in a world that needs our heart, our care, our compassion, and our ideas.

 

So I want to change that and will be using every ounce of creativity I can muster for that mission.

And I need your help.

I'm Bruce Cryer, founder of the RenaissanceHuman Project, and leader of an exceptional team of people helping me create an album of original songs, a documentary film, and a series of launch events around the US. My career has spanned diverse fields from the arts and business, starting with being an singer/dancer/actor on Broadway, publisher, health care executive, author, leadership consultant, CEO of several companies, mentor, and photographer.

Here's why I'm building a movement, with your help:

  • I had a series of life-threatening conditions between 2009 and 2011 that awakened me to the need to express myself creatively once again. When I started sharing my story I realized that many, many other people had the same need I had.
  • I feel a deep desire to help children and adults activate the creative spark inside themselves. I believe the world needs new creativity at a time of tremendous peril and animosity.
  • As individuals we need to express the fullness of who we are in order to lead the most satisfying lives possible.
  • With my social media networks alone we will reach hundreds of thousands of people all over the world with this campaign. People of all generations, nationalities, religions, economic and educational backgrounds. We can inspire hope and possibility to millions. 
     

How We Can Benefit Together

Our goal is to raise $25,000 to help fund the completion of an album of original songs (written and performed by me and my collaborators, Isaac Koren, Thorald Koren and Gary Malkin) -- to be released October 2017; a documentary film created by the talented duo, Maya Pisciotto and Fabian Aguirre of The Understory; Creativity Programs for Underprivileged Youth and Adults; and a series of launch events currently planned for LA, San Francisco, and New York City in Fall / Winter 2017, and a variety of perks, products and programs that are being created. 

  • Funding needs are split roughly 50-30-10-10 between album completion and mastering, documentary creation, creativity programs creation, launch events, and merchandise creation such as CDs, art prints, t-shirts, etc. 
  • Our perks cover the gamut -- including signed copies of the CD, limited edition art print, Renaissance Human logo t-shirts, set of 10 of my Nature photographs with special quotes, a private Creativity Mentoring session with me, Creativity Immersion Experiences @Home, and Creativity Experiences @Work, and Patron status which will be identified on the album, documentary and launch events. And many more! Including our $1 perk for the single of the new song "Bless the Children". You can dedicate that purchase to your favorite school!
  • The satisfaction you'll have from contributing to the creation of a movement to help so many others activate their creative sparks will be tremendous.

 

The Impact

I want to make it easier for people to develop that creative capacities that will serve them in all aspects of their lives. 

  • Perhaps you have a hidden creative passion you're not expressing. Perhaps you were told not to be artistic, to never sing, or to please not dance in public. Perhaps it was a teacher, a parent, a friend, a sibling who threw cold water on your dream. So life has never felt as full and exciting as you wanted. This project is for you... to live the life now that you have always been meant to live.
  • I know there are millions of people whose own creative juice has not yet come out. They need to hear our message and be inspired that they can reinvent themselves out of the limited version of themselves they have become. We will help so many people with this movement and the products that can inspire them.
  • Renaissance Human is creating a scholarship fund to make it possible for children and teens -- who have not had the privilege to be exposed to creative expression -- gain new skills and develop hidden talents. The first beneficiary will be Soul Shoppe of Oakland, CA, an innovative educational group teaching social and emotional learning skills to elementary age children throughout the Bay Area. 
  • I have helped several innovative businesses grow into multi-million dollar enterprises that changed the world. I have developed courses in Creativity that are part of Stanford University's wellness program. I would like to see those courses reach nonprofits, NGOs, startups, and social enterprises of all kinds. 
  • We're going to make this happen. I've lived my whole life to see it all come together... a legacy I am building for what humanity needs today and what future generations can benefit from in the future. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We've created a wide range of perks from $1 to $3,500. Most of the perks are $125 or less. 
  • Many people may want other ways to contribute besides getting a perk. Please share with your friends and family on social media or person to person.
  • Show the campaign film. Most people who've seen it are touched and moved and want to learn how they can be involved.  
  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools liberally! (We're really happy we chose Indiegogo to launch this movement. These guys really know what they're doing. I love that!)

We've created a wide range of perks from $1 to $3,500. Most of the perks are $125 or less.

Show the campaign film. Most people who've seen it are touched and moved and want to learn how they can be involved.  
Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools liberally! (We're really happy we chose Indiegogo to launch this movement. These guys really know what they're doing. I love that!)

story:
About TheStage.com

American Idol, The Voice, America's Got Talent and their sister shows all over the world, have attracted millions of undiscovered Music Artists.  Unfortunately, only a small percentage of these amazing artists are ever seen or heard.

YouTube, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram are also filled with great new Music Artists. However, they are drowned out by gamers, marketers, cats, dogs, kids, politics, jokes and well, you get it.   

TheStage.com gives all these artists a dedicated worldwide platform to promote their musical talents for FREE! Celebrating our one year anniversary, we have helped hundreds of artists and are now ready to help hundreds of thousands!

Until now, we have been totally self funded, digging deep into our own pockets to develop our website and organically grow our social media sites. We now need your help to spread the word about TheStage.com and touch all those amazing undiscovered Music Artists!

Every dollar raised will be used for targeted advertising on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter & YouTube, drawing more Music Artists to our site.

Visit Our Website & See Us At Work!

Just Click Here: TheStage.com

  • Watch Hundreds of Original & Cover Music Videos
  • Discover New Music Artists & Read Their Extensive Profiles
  • Enjoy Today's Featured Artist Of The Day
  • Checkout Upcoming Music Events
  • Shop The Music Marketplace
  • Read Great Articles & Press Releases
  • Write A Review of Your Favorite Artist
  • Browse Our Artists' Photo Albums
  • Send A Direct Message To Your Favorite Artist

What We Need Now!

We have done our homework and experimented with all the major social media sites. We know what advertising works and what doesn't, when trying to grab the attention of aspiring Music Artists. 

Our prior advertising has brought tens of thousands of visitors to our site, all helping to promote and grow our Artists' careers.  What we need now are the funds to increase our social media marketing to attract even more Music Artists!

Your Impact & Perks!

Your Impact

We have all cheered and voted for our favorite Music Artists. Some of their voices have brought us to tears.  Many songs have brought back memories both good and bad while some have even changed peoples lives. This is your opportunity to give back to Music Artists and have a direct impact on their lives.

The Perks

Sure we could have made stickers that would have been lost in your desk. Maybe a cool hat or tee shirt, that would sit on your shelf for years. These perks would be nice, but they all cost money, cutting directly into the funds raised by our backers.

So we got creative and developed some great fun perks that allow you to directly affect Music Artists, while giving you some well deserved recognition! Check them out and remember, any size donation will be so greatly appreciated by us and the Artists! 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Don't worry, if you can't contribute, you can still make your mark on our campaign by helping us get the word out. Please share this campaign with your family, friends, Music Artists or anyone that you think might be interested in participating! Please share to Twitter, Instagram, Facebook and beyond...

story:
Short Summary

Our band consists of Scott Lubin (18) : the cliche lead singer with looks, Michael O'Hazo (16) : the show off guitarist with humor, and Ansh Jetly (18) : mainly everything else. We all met each other at Kent school and somehow got by school with our love, passion, and dedication to music as a band. Some of our favorite artists include Red Hot Chili Peppers, Pink Floyd, Maroon 5, Radiohead, Coldplay, ELO, Green Day, Muse, and Jan Terri (Ansh isn't a big fan of hers though.) The reason for our band name is because when our free block's lined up day to day at school, we'd devote that time to jamming out. We would never miss an opportunity to do just that. Now that we're out of school and have some time off, why not put everything on the line to make it big? That's what our summer 2017 is about.

What We Need & What You Get

So here's the low down. For this album to happen, we need your help big time. In September, Scott and Ansh are going off to their freshman year of college across the country so we'll all be split up. Long story short, this summer may be our only chance together to show the world what we can do as a band. What we need is to be able to pay for studio sessions, copyright our songs, promote our music, make more sick music videos like Stayed the Same, and get CD's. Every dollar would mean so much to us. Also keep in mind for those big contributors, perks will involve getting to hear new songs we're working on, having songs written specifically about you, and even getting to appear in our next music video! Not to mention if you live close enough, you could spend a day in the studio with us. If we don't reach our goal, no matter what, all the money that is made will be going to these causes (especially time in the studio!)

The Impact

Yes, we're dreamers just like everyone else but we truly believe we can succeed as a band with a little helping hand. Any fans mean the world to us so we'd truly appreciate and thank every single supporter we get. If you've heard our first released single Stayed the Same, know that we have sooo much more that we're dying to get recorded and released.

Risks & Challenges

The sad reality is that there are an endless amount of bands that never made it and faded away. That's a hard  pill swallow. But we have a great determination and motivation that has been building in us for years. We are going to give this all we got and do whatever we possibly can to make this work.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please make sure to check out our music video for Stayed the Same and show some love if you're a fan!

Also feel free to follow our instagram, @freeblockofficial and our Facebook, https://www.facebook.com/freeblockofficial/

Much love,

Free Block

story:
Who We Are

The THEATRE BIZARRE ORCHESTRA is the house band for Detroit's annual Theatre Bizarre event. Rooted in Detroit's burlesque, rock & roll, jazz, and vaudeville culture, the TBO are a band of musicians invoking the spirit of dark carnivals, demented circuses, and ribald debauchery, which can only be defined as neo-vaudeville. Their music is captivating and mesmerizing, and their show blends the etheral with the burlesque in one fell swoop. 

The Backstory

Their first album project, Carpe Noctem, garnered national attention for being a collaborative project with Bauhaus rocker David J. Emboldened by that success, the TBO sought to investigate the realms of burlesque and jazz through their newest project, Dance with the Devil--set to be released on Friday the 13th in October, 2017.

One magical April evening the band assembled within the walls of Detroit's historic Scarab Club. Amidst an intimate gathering of faithful followers the TBO sought to record an album of music dedicated to the burlesque arts in its entirety. What transpired was truly magical: a full-length album of original music, inspired by and for burlesque performers, known as "Dance with the Devil." Pressed on limited edition vinyl, the music of that evening is sure to quicken the pulse, inspire locomotion, are conjure the devil himself!

The Endeavor

In support of this new album we’re taking our music to the very axis of burlesque and jazz music, New York and New Orleans! (With a stop at our favorite brewery, Founders Brewing Co. in Grand Rapids.) Our journey includes the following performances:

 

  • 10/13/2017 - THEATRE BIZARRE Gala, Masonic Temple, Detroit, MI
  • 10/20/2017 - THEATRE BIZARRE Gala, Masonic Temple, Detroit, MI
  • 11/03/2017 - Siberia on St. Claude, New Orleans, LA
  • 11/04/2017 - The Louisiana Steampunk Festival, Cite' de Arts Theater, Lafayette, LA
  • 11/10/2017 - Green Room 42, Manhattan, New York, NY
  • 11/18/2017 - Founders Brewing Taproom, Grand Rapids, MI
  • 11/19/2017 - Founders Brewing Taproom, Grand Rapids, MI

The Theatre Bizarre Orchestra is a large band utilizing all sorts of wild and crazy instruments. It's a Herculean task moving 12 people with pianos, saxophones, trombones, and tubas anywhere! This is why we need you--the faithful, the spirited, the daring--to help us make this journey.

The Campaign Breakdown

  • $2500 will help us travel to New Orleans, New York City, and Grand Rapids : this will help defray the costs of travel, lodging, and instrumental rental. (You try transporting a Sousaphone across the country!)
  • This trip gives us an opportunity to strengthen bonds between different music communities: in addition to performing in these various venues, we'll be including a handful of local musicians and local burlesque performers on every gig. (They want to see and hear how Detroit makes it happen!)
  • Sharing our music promotes the artistry and talent of Detroit: these performances give us the opportunity to showcase not only ourselves, but Theatre Bizarre, the Detroit jazz scene, and the Detroit burlesque community. (This places us on a national level.)
 

Share What You Care About

Dearest Acolytes,

Without your support over the past years we wouldn't be here to sing our songs and tell our tales. We see the looks of wonder and glee upon your many faces at our shows, and we revel in your magic. It is because of you that others in far-away lands want us to bring that same magic. It is because of you that our music has traveled to the four corners of the earth. It is because of you, the faithful, that our sounds ring out. If you have read this far, know that we are thankful. Please consider sharing our story, infecting others with our devilish music. A small act goes a long way in supporting live music. Hail, Zombo!!

With love and mischief,

The Theatre Bizarre Orchestra

The Campaign Breakdown


$2500 will help us travel to New Orleans, New York City, and Grand Rapids : this will help defray the costs of travel, lodging, and instrumental rental. (You try transporting a Sousaphone across the country!)

This trip gives us an opportunity to strengthen bonds between different music communities: in addition to performing in these various venues, we'll be including a handful of local musicians and local burlesque performers on every gig. (They want to see and hear how Detroit makes it happen!)

Sharing our music promotes the artistry and talent of Detroit: these performances give us the opportunity to showcase not only ourselves, but Theatre Bizarre, the Detroit jazz scene, and the Detroit burlesque community. (This places us on a national level.)
 Share What You Care About
Dearest Acolytes,
Without your support over the past years we wouldn't be here to sing our songs and tell our tales. We see the looks of wonder and glee upon your many faces at our shows, and we revel in your magic. It is because of you that others in far-away lands want us to bring that same magic. It is because of you that our music has traveled to the four corners of the earth. It is because of you, the faithful, that our sounds ring out. If you have read this far, know that we are thankful. Please consider sharing our story, infecting others with our devilish music. A small act goes a long way in supporting live music. Hail, Zombo!!
With love and mischief,
The Theatre Bizarre Orchestra

story:
Take part in a unique guitar adventure

Whether you’re a guitar aficionado or a music enthusiast in the broader sense, you will love my  new album. I feel these compositions are the crowning achievement of my musical life, and I can’t wait for you to hear them. Let’s get there together. Come and be part of this unique guitar adventure.

Une grande aventure guitaristique

Que vous soyez fan de guitare ou simplement un amoureux de la musique, vous allez adorer mon nouvel album. Techniquement et artisitiquement, ce sont là les pièces les plus achevées que j’aie composées. Joignez-vous à moi dans cette belle aventure.

A work in progress

Yes, some of the recording is done, and it’s spectacular. But there’s still lots to do. Your contribution will allow me to finish studio work, then do mastering, artwork, and videos. Help me get over the finish line!

Une œuvre en cours

L’enregistrement est en partie terminé, mais il reste encore beaucoup à faire! Je dois retourner en studio pour finaliser plusieurs pièces, et ensuite il y a le matriçage, la pochette et plusieurs vidéos à faire. Un petit coup de pouce de votre part, et j’aurai entre les mains un vrai petit bijou!

Spread the word

This album will be very special. Much of it was composed not with fingers on fretboard, but conceptualized and charted, which makes it truly a work from the heart and the imagination. Spread the word among friends and family, and help me take my vision to fruition!

Répandez la nouvelle

Cet album sera très spécial. J’ai composé la plupart des pièces non pas avec mes doigts sur l’instrument, mais en écrivant sur papier la musique que j’entendais dans ma tête et mon cœur. Répandez la bonne nouvelle en parlant de ma campagne à vos parents et amis, et aidez-moi à mener à bien ce projet qui, j’en suis sûr, aura l’heur de vous enchanter.

story:
Dear Friends and Fans

I am Adam Elara, singer-songwriter from Houston, TX. I started playing music in a few different bands over the last few years. Every single project I have been a part of has been a valuable learning experience. I have always been able to make things happen on my own, so this is new for me. I appreciate all the support I have received throughout all the years from you. For the first time you can be a direct part of the new journey.

Over the past few months I've been able to secure good relationships with people in the industry that are willing to do quality work for me, but I have to honor their investment as well. Unfortunately I don't come from a rich family and work odd jobs to fit around my music schedule. That's why this campaign is so important, the accomplishment of my dreams is just around the corner and my only obstacle is money.

What I Need & What You Get

The funding will pay for the following:

  • 6.5k Music Video
  • 2k Production
  • 2k Marketing

The remainder helps out with artwork, photo shoots, overhead costs, perk fulfillment, etc

I have created some amazing perks as incentives for your investment, I thought very carefully would entice myself to contribute and I'm confident you will appreciate them!

The Impact

By donating to this project you will be supporting the creation and dissemination of new, creative, original music. This is music that, as a whole, heals. It is cathartic. It is needed now, maybe as much as ever.

I am humbled to add my voice to this deeply important art form. I am even more humbled that you would consider supporting it. I believe this new record represents a progression and development of my artistic pursuits. Those of who have you seen me perform live know that I give my everything into the performance and it's never a dull moment on stage. I apply the same approach to my work ethic and will not waste a single penny of your contribution.

Risks & Challenges

I'm well aware that this is one of the most difficult industries to break into and create a career out of. Growing up with traditional immigrant parents I have heard that the "practical" route is the only way to go. I've seen friends and family settle into their lives and have missed out on so many social life cues due to working tirelessly on musical projects. Through all the adversity, rejection, and negativity I've stayed on the path and kept going!

I have managed to seek out the best people to work with on this endeavor that have a track record of success to minimize the risk of failure this time.

Other Ways You Can Help

It would be very helpful if you would get the word out about this campaign and share it with friends/family on social media, word of mouth, etc.  You can utilize the Indiegogo "share" tools. Please make some noise about my efforts that I'm making on this new journey.

Thanks so much for your time, help and consideration.

Deeply appreciated,

Adam Elara

story:
Element Brass Band to release an all original album "Cali Got A Brass Band"


 

Greetings! We are the Element Brass Band, founded in 2011, from Sacramento, CA. Our style is New Orleans Second Line. The music is fun, accessible, and simply makes people feel good. We appreciate all of our fans who have purchased our first album, "Ya Heard", where we recorded some of our favorite New Orleans classics.

We are thrilled to announce that we are releasing a brand new album called "Cali Got A Brass Band", featuring seven original compositions by members of the band! We are in the final stages of completion and we're getting really excited to share our new music with you. Recording and mixing have been finished with Clubhouse Studios, but we still need to raise the funds for mastering, album artwork, and production costs. Our biggest goal with this campaign is to launch a tour in the summer of 2018 throughout California to let this beautiful state know that Cali Got A Brass Band! We need YOUR help to make this album and tour a reality. We have set a goal of $10,000 for our crowd funding campaign.  

 

Where does my donation go?

 

There are many ways that your donations will be used. Mastering is one of the vital steps at getting the right sound throughout the album, and this will be completed in Los Angeles.  

A portion of your donations will go directly back to the arts in Sacramento. We will be commissioning a local Sacramento artist to design exclusive artwork for the cover of our new album.

We also need your help with the production costs of putting our music out to the public. "Cali Got A Brass Band" will be available on CD, digital download, and for the first time ever we'll be offering our music on Vinyl LP for all the analog lovers out there.

Ultimately, the majority of the funding raised in this campaign will go towards our travel, food, and housing costs while we are on tour. This tour will provide us the opportunity to play at a variety of venues for audiences who have never heard the Element Brass Band before.

We are forever grateful for any contribution no matter how big or small. We will be showing love with a variety of PERKS for those who are able to donate. Check those out to your right.


Other ways you can help
 

If you can't donate monetarily, it's cool! You can still help us out tremendously by sharing this link on social media and directly with your friends and family. We ask all our fans to please help us out with spreading the word.

 

Thank you for taking the time to read this and thank you for supporting the Element Brass Band!

story:
Our Story

Hello everyone and welcome to the "Songs From The Mount" campaign; a project that seeks to bring affirming worship songs to life; affirming, meaning it affirms and celebrates the worth, value, perspective, and righteousness of every walk of life, including all people from every race, sexual orientation, and gender identity. The inspiration behind this project stems from Jesus' sermon on the mount where he encourages his followers to walk with mercy, meekness, long-suffering, and a hunger to see all things transformed by love. Unfortunately, we live in a day where many of our faith spaces have lost sight of this precious calling, causing the deepest wounds and driving people away from community.  But I am a firm believer that holy spirit infused music heals, intentionally crafted music comforts, and affirming music convicts us of the truth of God's acceptance towards us.

I hope that you all have had the chance to check out my new single "Defender's Hymn".  It is the first in the series of songs that will be a part of this project.  Our team poured blood, sweat, time, tears, and lots of money into the creation of that song so I pray it blessed you beyond your wildest expectations.

 

A Call To Partner

With that being said, I really felt led to open up the project and let you all be a part of bringing the rest of the songs to life.   So many of you have reached out and told me how much affirming worship by queer people, for all people,  truly makes a difference in your spiritual journey.  I really want to press into this moment and pull on our beautiful community to fund this project and make this dream a reality.  

For the completion of the next visual song we are asking for $2500 to cover equipment, venue, recording, mixing, mastering, promoting, and release. That's $2500 to release the next sound of healing and hope from "Songs From The Mount". 

 

The Impact

Here are a few reasons why I believe this project is so massive in its impact.

  • As it stands now, finding affirming worship music is very challenging as there are only a handful of artists creating this kind of music, and understandably so. We have for so long been told that we must choose to lie about our orientation or give up being a worshiper altogether.
  • Not only will this project affirm people from all backgrounds but it will also stand as a beacon to other worshippers, encouraging them not to give up on their passion and to continue expressing themselves in worship no matter what.
  • This project stands as a response to the conviction that we must be what our younger selves needed. We must show up and let this next generation know that they are not alone and that God is for them. 

Challenges

Now, I am generally an optimist but I realize that this project comes with its challenges.  Unfortunately, I am well aware of the erroneous theology of hate that continues to spur people to push back on our cause, but that just gives me more energy to see this project come to pass. Regardless of the challenges, I am confident in two things:

  • God's divine support and leading.
  • Your encouragement, prayers, and giving.

Other Ways You Can Help

I am so excited to go on this journey with you and I believe that this project will yield so much light and life. For those that can't give, you can support by helping to spread the word about this campaign. Let the world know about this beautiful gift that is "Songs From The Mount". 

The Lord is Rich in Love

The Lord is Rich in Love

story:
כבר יותר מ20 שנה שאני יוצר מוזיקה, מפיק ומנגן בהרכבים שונים ועושה הרבה שיתופי פעולה. לאורך התקופה הזו יצא לי לעבוד עם מוזיקאים מהמון סגנונות מגוונים ובתקופה האחרונה הרגשתי שאני רוצה להקים משפחה גלובלית של אומנים ויוצרים מכל העולם. 
חברת תקליטים שתשחרר מוזיקה אתנית ואלקטרונית ותעזור לי להפיץ את המוזיקה הזו בעולם ולתמוך באומנים שאני מרגיש שאני יכול לתרום להם מהניסיון והידע שלי. מבחינתי הדרך הכי טובה לעשות את זה היא להתחיל עם תקליט שלי שיעזור להפיץ את הלייבל בעולם וכאן אתם נכנסים לתמונה. 
לצורך הקמת הלייבל והדפסת התקליט העלתי קמפיין גיוס המונים שירוץ החל מהיום ויעזור לי לגייס את הסכום הדרוש להנעה הראשונית אז ממש אודה לכם מאוד אם תוכלו לתת בזה יד . 
התקליט יכלול כמה להיטים מהשנים האחרונות לצד מספר טראקים שעוד לא השתחררו ויושק במסיבה בתל אביב עוד חודשיים אז אשמח אם תקנו כרטיס למסיבה וכך תתרמו לתקליט הראשון של "לרוז קאמל ריידר".
המוןן תודה מראש!

Hi I'm Laroz Camel rider and I need your support. 
Hey My name is Haim Laroz and I live in Tel Aviv. Over the last 20 years I've been creating and playing different types of music and have been a part of many albums and bands. 
Few years ago I've started my electronic project journey by producing ambient and dark techno, and later on I became one of the leading acts of the oriental underground music scene.
I've released my music through labels such as Sol Selectas, Souq Records, Buddha Bar, Café del Mar and many others.
ow I wish to establish my own record label with my first vinyl - including tracks like Jelamsoul and many others and this is why I need you people to help me. 
So please support this unique vinyl release, donate, share and enjoy it !!


Wanna help but don't have money to donate?? you can share this on your social networks and that we'll be huge help..

Big Thanks!
Laroz Camel Rider.

story:
Vibey Desert is an underground desert rave. A place where music and art flourish and people come together as one, spreading love and positivity.

Such qualities are a rarity in the LA club scene which is why we need you're help to make the Vibey dream a reality. 

The goal is to create a music venue near the Los Angeles area. With this venue we plan to throw events on a more regular basis than a typical annual music festival. Our intent is to create a place where one can call home and experience music from up and coming as well as established artists without breaking the bank or waiting an entire year for the next festival. Human connection is key! Ultimately, we would like to build a COMMUNITY where ideas and self expression may be shared and be built upon so that we may progress together :) We plan on having single day/night events as well as multiple day/night events. 

With this vision in mind, we are asking for any contributions to help push forward. We plan on being completely honest to our friends and followers throughout the growth and expansion of Vibey Desert. Since our first event, the speakers/subs, generators, lights, and design have come out of pocket. Any and all donations will be put towards the equipment and materials needed and we will always announce the latest news and updates to our followers.

The amount of love and support we have already received is mind blowing and absolutely incredible. We cannot thank everyone enough for the constant encouragement and support throughout this entire process. We are so excited to make this dream become reality and share this journey with you!

Please contact us if you have any questions, comments, suggestions or if you would like be a part of our team!

Instagram: Vibey_Desert
Facebook: Vibey Desert
Email: Vibeycrewfam@gmail.com

Next event:

January 5-6 2019 - Holiday Recovery Party
Secret Location (Lancaster, CA Area)
Minimum $20 donation to attend

Our intent is to create a place where one can call home and experience music from up and coming as well as established artists without breaking the bank or waiting an entire year for the next festival. Human connection is key! Ultimately, we would like to build a COMMUNITY where ideas and self expression may be shared and be built upon so that we may progress together :) We plan on having single day/night events as well as multiple day/night events. With this vision in mind, we are asking for any contributions to help push forward. We plan on being completely honest to our friends and followers throughout the growth and expansion of Vibey Desert. Since our first event, the speakers/subs, generators, lights, and design have come out of pocket. Any and all donations will be put towards the equipment and materials needed and we will always announce the latest news and updates to our followers.The amount of love and support we have already received is mind blowing and absolutely incredible. We cannot thank everyone enough for the constant encouragement and support throughout this entire process. We are so excited to make this dream become reality and share this journey with you!Please contact us if you have any questions, comments, suggestions or if you would like be a part of our team!Instagram: Vibey_DesertFacebook: Vibey DesertEmail: Vibeycrewfam@gmail.comNext event:January 5-6 2019 - Holiday Recovery PartySecret Location (Lancaster, CA Area)Minimum $20 donation to attend

story:
“Indie Artist Em Hoggett is earning rave reviews from some of the most prestigious critics in the music business.” – The C Magazine  

My name is Em Hoggett, and I am a critically-acclaimed artist and classically trained pianist. My training as a classical pianist began at the age of 4 and continued through my childhood and teenage years, achieving my first degree (ATCL) at age 11, and my second (LTCL) at 15. I was fortunate to perform with world-renowned pianist Lang Lang at the Royal Festival Hall in London and at the Fazioli Concert Hall in Italy, among many other notable venues. At the age of 13 I discovered a new passion: songwriting. And songwriting has become the key to healing me through my darkest times.

At 16, I was stripped of my power, my strength, my sexuality, my ability to trust, my ability to love, my ability to live. I was raped. 

But now, I am here to share my story of being REBORN. 

I am fortunate enough to be working with an incredible team of musicians including Melvin Brannon Jr (Booker T, Dan Reed Network), Tyler Hammond (Fred Durst, Limp Bizkit), Fire Mist (Sea At Last) and GRAMMY-nominated Bruce Witkin (Aerosmith, Marilyn Manson, Alice Cooper).

In 2016, after years of suppressing the truth, I found the courage to tell the world what had happened to me, in the hope of processing my own experience as well as helping others through theirs. I released a song on social media about my experience and over the next two years wrote 3 more, all explicitly about different emotions that I felt after accepting that I had been raped. I had a whole EP worth of songs about my experience and I knew that they needed to be shared with the world. This July, What I Want To Say To You (WIWTSTY) was released, candidly and unapologetically expressing to the world the horrors of rape, and my own personal grief and struggle.

What I Want To Say To You, produced by Grammy-nominated producer Bruce Witkin, has been chosen as one of five picks of the month by Hard Rock Café: “Hoggett joins artists such as Lady Gaga and Tori Amos in giving a voice to those who need it most”, and has been acclaimed by BuzzFeed, Sirius XM, Good Morning La La Land, Louder Than War and Thrive Global among many others. 100% of net proceeds of this record are being donated to sexual assault charities.

The world has heard me at my worst, my weakest, in my deepest pain.

Now, I am REBORN.

Over the past 3 years, I have regained my strength, my sexuality, my power, and my love of life. I want to show the world that no matter what you’ve been through, things can ALWAYS get better. I have felt the deepest depths of darkness, and I now find myself in moments of happiness, of power, and living a life that is led by love and strength. I want to share this with the world. 

I went through hell and made it out the other side. I’m still fighting every day but I want to share with everyone my belief that we all hold within us the power to turn any situation around. I want listeners to come away from the album thinking, “I am strong. I do have power. I can live. I can LOVE.” For me, REBORN is the beginning of my path to freedom.

Inspired by artists such as Shirley Bassey and Jamie Cullum, the musical style of this album combines the sound of a James Bond soundtrack with the storytelling of a Pink Floyd album. Like a James Bond theme song, REBORN will be incredibly epic, dense, soulful, sensual... full of power. But, at the same time it will have it’s own artistic style, featuring elements of many genres including jazz and classical. 

A Pink Floyd-inspired concept album, REBORN will tell a story from beginning to end and will take you on a musical journey which comes in with a flourish and doesn’t end until the last note of the whole album. Musically, if you were to strip away the lyrics, every song is a true portrayal of the message I am trying to send, with every section and rhythm thought out in terms of how best to tell the story. I’ve always believed Pink Floyd are the filmmakers of the music industry, effortlessly telling a story through their work. I strive to do the same. Expect drama, energy, contrast, passion and a story that needs to be heard.

Rehearsal

Rehearsal (Melvin Brannon Jr)

Rehearsal (Tyler Hammond)

Over the next month, the band will be in intensive rehearsals, my composer will be creating all of the orchestral parts and in December we will go into the studio and begin recording. I am so excited to be working with Bruce Witkin again on this record that promises to be a compelling and inspirational portrayal of strength.

Your pledges will be used for the following:

- paying the awesome musicians for rehearsals and studio time

- covering musicians' expenses (travel etc.)

- paying our amazing producer 

- paying our incredible composer/arranger

ANYTHING at all that you can offer will help us spread this message. Please help me to continue on my journey of sharing my experiences with the world; I do this in the hope of helping others through their times of darkness, which I have so deeply felt, and finally feel I am on my way out of. 

Thank you.

www.emhoggett.com

What I Want To Say To You on Spotify

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, no worries! There are other ways that you can help.

  • Please share this campaign on social media - the more eyes the better! 
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to help me to spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

Songbird Ministries is a Music Ministry that records Christian music and have a strong passion for worship. With this Pandemic, we want to help strengthen our churches online worship experiences since it may be hard to gather people and even record quality video and audio. The money raised will help church, the studio setup, workers, and volunteers to accomplish the following:

  • Create an online Worship Experience through downloadable videos with lyrics or without lyrics (your choice)
  • Create an online Worship Experience through providing downloadable audio tracks consisting of either just the instrumental or instrumental and vocal (your choice) 
  • Creating simple piano tracks of famous hymns and any Christian songs for solemn parts of the church service (prayer time, appeal, postlude, prelude)

Raising this fund will help the projects start up cost. Especially since we don’t know when the Pandemic will end, this will help church have a quality service that God and His people deserve. 

What We Need & What You Get

The breakdown for you:

  • We will need $2000 to help start us off. After we get everything rolling, there will be a monthly fee of $25 for churches and a different monthly fee for supporters to access all content and continual updates to everything and even gifts using Patreon.  
  • You can back us up anywhere from $25 to $1 million dollars, honestly everything helps!
  • Even if we don’t reach the goal, we'll be able to use what money was raised and start on this project! We are passionate in helping our churches.

The Impact

As mentioned before, this will help churches with their online worship services. 

  • This project is valuable because it will enable churches or ministries to use christian music geared for worship services anytime and anywhere after downloading the files. 
  • We are experienced in recording simple but quality and clean videos for churches and ministries.
  • After we reach our goal (or passed it!), not only will there be 16 songs available for download through video and audio tracks on launch date, we plan to continue this project by updating new video and audio on a monthly basis and expand to more musicians who want to use their gifts for God.
  • God deserves quality worship. And we aim to do that with this project.

Challenges

The main challenge is honestly finances, which is why we started this project. Giving will help with the following:

  • Good equipment that will last a long time and enables us to create quality content over and over again.
  • We have volunteer musicians willing and ready, it will be nice for them to know they are supported by you (gas reimbursements, food, and gifts)
  • Putting all this together is no easy task. Paying the media team who handles all of the setup and editing will help them create new content.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute during this time and that's okay, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign! You can do so by using the Indiegogo share tools.
  • We have a youtube channel and would love it if you could subscribe to the channel!

story:
Together Apart: A new album

 

Hi, I'm Brent Stewart. I'm a St. Louis-area musician. You can find out more about me at my website: www.brentstewartmusic.com.

I had a lot of plans to play live music and record a couple new albums this year, but as we all very well know, around March the world completely changed. Businesses were shuttered in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic. People were asked to stay home and avoid large groups. The world kind of stopped, including many of the activities we love to do.

At the beginning of the year, I had written four songs and as February and March rolled around, I wrote five more. I had a collection of songs that I really felt reflected what is happening all over the world: A sense of isolation, even if we were all connected electronically. Even if we were sheltering in place with the people we care about the most. A greater sense of appreciation for the things that matter when everything seems like it's abruptly taken away.

Quarantined in my house with a lot of time on my hands, I began recording a new album. I enlisted a few folks to help who were also able to record in their homes: longtime friends Charlie Tabing on lead guitars and Jake DeLeonardis on bass (Jackhead, May Day Orchestra, Stace England,) along with Dakota Holden (The People vs. Hugh DeNeal, Miss Jenny and the Howdy Boys, The Magnatones) on pedal steel and guitar, Tony Barbata (John Henry, The Sleepy Rubies, Steve Ewing and many more) on drums and Dave Grelle (Funky Butt Brass Band, The Mighty Pines, Playadors and many, many more) on organ and piano. My friend Mike Lescelius of Misunderstudio in my hometown of Murphysboro, Ill, the engineer with whom I've worked with on every album I've done, was enlisted to put all of this together. My friend Mike Bass (www.zip-dang.com) did the amazing artwork.

I put down rough tracks and sent them to the musicians, they worked out their parts and recorded at their houses. We collaborated via text, e-mail and phone. Six musicians working separately, but actually on the same page in complete collaboration the entire time: Together Apart. 

Here's one of the songs from the album:

 

The STL Arts and Music Fund

 

I'm a musician, but first and foremost, I'm a fan. I have a ridiculous collection of albums. I love live music. Growing up in Southern Illinois, thought Carbondale always had a vibrant local scene, St. Louis was the closest city where I could see a lot of bands that didn't come our way -- at places like Off Broadway, Mississippi Nights, The Pageant, The Duck Room, Cicero's and so on. Legendary venues. But it was more than just seeing touring bands, there were so many local musicians playing night in and night out, giving audiences the gift of great memories every time they stepped on the stage. 

When all the local venues were closed in March, Ben Majchrzak of Native Sound Recording created the STL Arts and Music Fund. To date, they have raised $23,000 and have been able to give grants to countless musicians, but as of now, the fund is tapped out. With six months of lost revenue, and the ability to get out and play still hampered by the pandemic, St. Louis musicians are still hurting. 

I'm a musician, but it's my second job. My wife and I are blessed with stable careers. But, I love live music and I can't wait to get out to play and and see shows like before. I donated to the fund, but I wanted to do more.

That is why I'm releasing my new album, Together Apart, in this IndieGoGo campaign. All proceeds -- except for the cost of the rewards, which should be minimal -- will go to benefit the STL Arts and Music Fund. To show appreciation for the musicians who get up on stage night after night and play their heart out. For us.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

There are really no risks to this campaign. The new album is recorded and mastered. It's ready to go to the manufacturer and digital files will go out to everyone who pledges to the campaign as soon as it's over.

We have a goal, but if that is not met, the money raised will still go to the STL Arts and Music Fund. I hope to raise much more, though!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can't contribute. It's tough out there right now. But please keep sharing this campaign on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. Let your friends know!

If you're not interested in my music, but you're interested in the STL Arts and Music Fund, that's cool too. They're trying to evolve it from a Go Fund Me campaign to a full-fledged 501c3. They can use monetary help, but advice and other help as well. You can find out more here.

story:
My campaign is that I need to raise money to finish the programming on this Radiohead patch, and then also it can be converted to VST, standalone app, or Ableton pack. and for Mac

It is important to me because, A:) . Radiohead have been my favourite band since 1995 (since I was 13),  and B:) . Their music still innovates and amazes the world. So why not bring their music theory to your fingertips. 

Please have a look at the demo I´ve made: Demo: https://www.facebook.com/TheFitterHappiercomposer/videos/280181942601511/

Referral Contest:

If you feel your friends might also like The Fitter Happier Composer, please tell them about us. We will track all referrals and reward you with a discount on your perks: $1 for every other backer that you brought or 30% of your friends` total contributions (whichever is higher). Please make sure you are logged in and use the Indiegogo share tools when you forward the link (this gives you an individual link so that the referral can be tracked). See https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles... for more information. 

Sign up and help out and you will receive this software when it is finished!!

 

best, 

Andrew

 

 

Maybe I need to add this: No official endorsement by the band. I have just studied how they compose music very thoroughly.

story:
Friends and Family,

 

It has taken me ten years of dreaming, two years of living in Music City, and one year withdrawn from college to write this letter to you. When I first left my hometown in Iowa for Nashville, I knew there was one thing I wanted to do- create something that matters. Countless songwriting sessions, life changes, and (many) learning experiences later, I am so excited to finally share a piece of my heart I have been working on for so long: my debut EP.

 

However, the truth is, I need your help. Though I have been able to fund some of this project with money from gigs, session work, and coffee shop side-jobs, in order to finish this project for release in Summer 2019, I need additional funding to cover hefty recording costs, session musicians, and mixing/mastering. Just as any support in this project would mean the world to me, I’m hoping your involvement in the creation of these songs will mean something to YOU! My team and I have set up a funding program that allows you to be as involved as you want to be… (ever wanted your name in the liner notes of an album?) ... and allows us to send something right back as a small “thank you” for your much appreciated donation. 

I am so grateful to have such a strong support system of family, friends, co-writers, and creators that treat and teach me with kindness. You all truly push me to dream bigger and love harder every day. This set of five songs holds moments and stories that matter to me. I hope they matter to you, too. Thank you for believing in me.

 

All My Love,

Nicole Miller

Though I have been able to fund some of this project with money from gigs, session work, and coffee shop side-jobs, in order to finish this project for release in Summer 2019, I need additional funding to cover hefty recording costs, session musicians, and mixing/mastering. Just as any support in this project would mean the world to me, I’m hoping your involvement in the creation of these songs will mean something to YOU! My team and I have set up a funding program that allows you to be as involved as you want to be… (ever wanted your name in the liner notes of an album?) ... and allows us to send something right back as a small “thank you” for your much appreciated donation. 
I am so grateful to have such a strong support system of family, friends, co-writers, and creators that treat and teach me with kindness. You all truly push me to dream bigger and love harder every day. This set of five songs holds moments and stories that matter to me. I hope they matter to you, too. Thank you for believing in me. All My Love,
Nicole Miller

story:
I would love for you to join me on this big musical adventure moving forward into the fulfillment of promises. For that, I will share a little slice of my backstory.

I’ve always been a singer/songwriter! They couldn't stop me from singing down the hall in school and in class, most of the time I didn't even realise I was doing it!

I've been so blessed to spend the most amazing moments with my Dad, writing songs from a very young age, performing with him all across the UK on England’s festival circuit also hitting noteworthy venues in America. A daughter's dream and a very special gift to spend so much quality time with my Dad.  We had a Norah Jones vibe, which people loved at the time! 

In early 2011, my wild spirit drew me to the USA where I spent time touring overseas, crafting a documentary about 'making it' in the music biz - we called it Gracie in America. Eye-opening and very raw, I captured what people would do to see their dreams fulfilled. It gave me the most real experience of what the process looked like and wow, did it hit me hard - in a beautiful way! I managed to survive and went on to record the EP Seasons and continued gigging until I felt the Lord ask me to give it up.

...which is when I launched a publishing company and wrote a series of children’s books. The Silly Eric series inspires children to dream BIG, never give up and to know they are loved just the way they are. I am still very active in this role and absolutely love talking to kids at their schools and teaching on these topics. I became a Young Ambassador with the Prince’s Trust and won two awards for my books and overcoming brain injury, which was the result of being hit by a car at age 11 and losing all of my memories.  On the plus side, it took me on the golden path of working with children for 16 years - what a privilege it has been to influence the children of the future! 

I believe we all have such a purpose and are created to join together and lift each other up in our great adventure.  My passionate faith in the Lord has given me some of the most wonderful life stories of the impossible becoming possible and part of my story invites others to join in with me.  We are all made to dream big! And so here I am again, dreaming big, taking a risk and pursuing the sounds of heaven with this new musical project with Dan Stirling and Rivers & Robots! Check out their music so you can see how wonderful they are! This song is a beautiful example of their hearts. 

We are in the studio recording and the songs are sounding amazing but we need your help to complete this project!!! I am so excited about the sound that's being created, around the guitar and piano. Soulful, jazzy with some grove! There is some beautiful music being developed as you read this.

I pray for you to know the loving heart of the Father through my sound and encounter the tangible presence of God as you journey with me.  

My heart burns to show love and encourage people that it's never too late to live your dreams!

Wherever you find yourself,  may this inspire you to dream BIG and believe anything is possible!

Thank you for your support!

Love & blessings,

Gracie xxx

story:
I am Daniela Soledade, a musician from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. I was born and raised in a musical family, growing up with Samba, Bossa Nova, and other Brazilian rhythms and influences.

My grandfather, Paulo Soledade, helped create Brazilian music foundations, composing with Tom Jobim, Vinícius de Moraes, Toquinho, Baden Powell and others in the pioneering phase of bossa nova. My father Paulinho is an artist-producer whose resume includes work with Ivan Lins and Gilberto Gil.  The Bossa Nova runs deep in my veins!

I grew up in Rio in a family of musicians, basically, on both sides--artists, actresses, ballerinas, musicians. And I grew up in recording studios. My father would ask me to sing on whatever he was working on, such as TV shows for the main network in Brazil, called Rede Globo.

The intimate, romantic aesthetic of true Bossa Nova is what I'm focusing on.  When I think of bossa nova, I think of Joao Gilberto and this really quiet aesthetic.  When I sing these songs I am trying to inhabit a unique, perfect moment that the musicians and the listeners share. 

Making this album has always been a dream of mine! After opening a small business with my husband and having my two beautiful daughters, now is the perfect time to follow my dreams! It’s my number one project and I am putting everything into it.

Your support means THE WORLD to me! 

I can't wait to share my music with you, and hopefully make you feel the same way I feel about it:) 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need the financial support to make the album and promote it. It takes money to make an album because we need to pay for the musicians, the recording studio, the production, mixing, mastering, artwork, and publicity and promotion. 

I am hoping to have enough pre-orders of CD's, LP's and other perks to raise $25,000.  It sounds like a lot but it's really only 1000 CD's and a few LP's:)

 

Here is a breakdown of expenses:

Musician fees/travel costs/production/recording/mixing  $4000

Mastering for CD/digital and audiophile Vinyl LP master cutting $2000

CD and Audiophile Vinyl LP manufacturing $4000

Photos/videos/artwork $3000

Publicity/Radio Promotion/Marketing $12,000

 

We are doing the actual recording of "A Moment Of You" in mid April and have assembled a team of industry veterans to help launch the project.  

I'll be posting updates as pre-production continues and recording begins so you can stay up to date on the process and hear some of what we are doing.

Guitarist Nate Najar is arranging and producing the album and I can't imagine working with anybody else! Nate really understands the feeling and aesthetic of Bossa Nova.

We have GREAT perks for this project, including a digital download of the album, autographed CD's and autographed audiophile vinyl LP's of "A Moment Of You" AND we also have some unique and fun perks to share with you! For instance, Nate and I will come to your home and cook a dinner party for you and your guests and then give a private concert! You can also get handwritten copies of sheet music and lyrics or guitar lessons!

"A Moment Of You" will be released on CD and digital on September 6, but when you support the project, you get the album in July!  The Audiophile Vinyl LP will be ready in November.

I am so excited about sharing my music with the world and I need YOUR support to get it out there!

 

The Impact

"A Moment Of You" is about sharing that one unique and perfect moment. It's about feeling love, rejection, longing- feelings that make us alive. I wish to share this feeling through music and touch your life just like my own has been touched.  And there is no better way to inhabit that moment than with Bossa Nova!

By supporting the album before it is made, you can help us make "A Moment Of You" and also help us get it out there for new people to hear!

 

Risks & Challenges

There are so many deserving artists hoping interested listeners will give them a chance.  Many very fine albums don't ever get heard! One of our main challenges is getting the album heard after it has been made, and that's where publicity expenses come in - one of the reasons why we made this crowdfunding campaign:) 

As pre-production continues and then the actual recording happens, I'll be posting updates and I really hope you like what you hear and want to lend your support. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you contribute, you can still help by sharing "A Moment Of You" on your social media and help others to discover the beauty of Bossa Nova! 

P.S. You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
