story:
Me. 

I have been singing to a live audience for 14 years yet my love for performing began as a young 2 year old in love with Disney and The Sound of Music. My best friend is the microphone and my home is the stage. When watching live performances and seeing how the audience takes home the music with them to incorporate the music with their everyday lives, that's the dream. 

Majorly influenced by jazz, soul, RnB and definitely some rock and roll, my music can only be described as just that; music. You can judge for yourself what genre it falls under. 

 

Funds to be raised for: 

  • production
  • musicians
  • studio
  • mixing and mastering
  • artwork and packaging 
  • distribution
  • music video

 

The Impact

Music that touches the heart.

My main goal for this album and albums to come is to give people the music soundtrack for the moments in their lives. With live performance and studio recording experience, it is time to put practice into action with my very own album. 

Ever leave a concert or live music performance feeling elated because they performed that song you danced to at your wedding? Or that karaoke hit you and your friends sang to on your 30th birthday? Or that track you had to put in the mix tape you made for your highschool sweet heart because there was no other words to say how sorry you were you couldn't make it to the movies? 

That's the kind of music I want to give you. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Original music is always a risk, but if I manage to make a few people out there smile, then I am willing to risk it. Here is what I intend to do to stay positive with my writing;

  • have constant feedback from industry experts. There is always room for improvement and always a time to say "yep this is it" 
     

Time Line

​Phase 1 (complete)

  • identify key working materials
  • selecting creative partners and team
  • creative content (collection of songs to be pre-selected)

Phase 2

  • finalise song selection
  • skeletal creative production + recording

Phase 3

  • feedback from industry leaders 
  • final recording 
  • mixing and mastering
  • art work and packaging 

Phase 4

  • distribution 
  • album launch 


What's in it for you 

  • Receive updates periodically (through secret perks!) and be part of the album making journey!
  • insight to other album promotions 
     

     

     

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • contribute as much or as little as you like. that RM/$2 could help just as much. 
  • share this link to whoever you think may like to contribute 
  • come watch a live show! Find out the next one via Facebook and Instagram (username: @dashalogan) or just come say hi. 
  • if you would like to contribute in some other way, drop me a message or ask a question and we can discuss it more!

story:
Who is Mackenzie Morgan?

. . .hi, there. I'm Mackenzie - or Mac, whichever you prefer. And, I know what you must be thinking: oh look, another girl doing pop music! Or, "Yay! Here's someone else asking for money."

LISTEN - I get it. I really do. I know life is pulling you in a thousand and one different directions at this very moment, and there are a ton of different things you could be giving your hard earned money to. (Rent, bills, kids, ya?)

BUT, I have a dream. I know you have a dream too. My dream is to release my EP 'MAC' out into the world this year. So, let me tell you a little about my dream for 30 seconds and share my heart with you. Sound good?

I'm 23 years old, newly married to the love of my life, and making music that I believe could change lives. But, everyone believes in their music that way. What is it that makes mine so different? I'm glad you asked.  

I started this whole musical journey when I was 7 years old. You can check out my YouTube channel for all the juicy, vintage videos of my singing from way back then. I grew up singing and performing country music, but when I turned 16, something changed. I realized I had been living in a box musically. I didn't really know who Britney Spears was until I was 13, so I obviously had some catching up to do.

My Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvTUowR9pDsIyY...

I started discovering all different kinds of music. Hence, my emo phase still lives on in some dark corner of my soul. I naturally gravitated towards pop and rock, so therefore, a new sound emerged. You might like to think of it as Madonna mixed with Paramore and out pops me. 

Music was the only thing there for me during the darkest period of my life, and since it saved my life, I want to help others in the same way. I don't want this to be about me - I want this to be about the effects. If one person could benefit in any way from listening to my music, my dream would be fulfilled. 

My dream is this:  

The pop music playing on the radio right now is the same message in every song - just with a different beat behind it. There is so much to say about the world and the thoughts in our brains than the typical topics of sex, partying, and breakup anthems. My dream is that through my music people will feel they’re not alone, they can hear words to really make them think about life, and they'll be encouraged to make a change. 

We need a positive influence in our music. Someone who addresses the elephants in the room and talks about real life issues.

Talking Money 

I have it all broken down of what we need to get this EP recorded and released. And I want to show it all to you, so you know exactly where your money is going and how it is helping. 

As you can imagine,  the recording, promoting, and pre and post production costs are at the least to say, expensive. It will take $7,000 to get the EP recorded professionally, produce and film a music video for my first single "Woman", and promote both the single and the record.

PERKS!  

There are some pretty amazing perks for your donating. Everything from t-shirts, stickers, pop sockets, exclusive downloads, behind the scenes footage, voice memos, handwritten lyric sheets from when I wrote the actual songs, and even paintings from me and my pet bunny, Oslo. There's a lot. And the biggest of them all will be me flying you and your special guest HERE for the EP release show!  Does it get any better than that!? 

There are also some amazing contributions from different friends of mine ranging from different genres of music artists to some seriously cool brands that I personally love and know you will too! 

Here is a list of the contributors: Moriah Naomi (music artist), Megan Brown (music artist), Talk Nice Vintage Clothing, and Maggie Schneider (music artist.)

Beyond the Album. . .

I fully understand that this 30 day process will not be easy. Like I said above, it will take $7,000 to make the EP come alive. But, I'm more than excited to see what will unfold and be on this journey together! There are some obstacles which I am sure will rear their ugly heads such as:

Doubt.

Fear.

Insecurity.

But, who cares? Who REALLY cares? I believe in taking this one step at a time, and I'm giving this process over to God.VI don't want this to be about me; I want this to be about the music, the words, and the message. And most importantly, I want to point to God in everything I do and give Him all the glory. He's the whole reason I'm here. Whatever the outcome, I know He is in control. I would love for you to accompany me on 'Team Mac' and us do this together! Are you in?

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute, I totally understand. There are a few other important ways you can help me along this process as well! Below are all the different ways you support me: 

Pre-order the EP! I would love to offer the most amazing perks from myself and my contributors! (See the perks section for more info!) 

PRAYERS! This is one of the most vulnerable things I've ever done publicly, and your prayers would mean absolutely everything. 

SPREAD THE WORD! Share this link on your Facebook, your Instagram story or in a post, email it or text it to your friends, anything and everything! Every bit helps, and I would be so appreciative of your support. 

Use Indiegogo's share tools to easily get the word out there to your followers! They make it so incredibly easy to navigate. (See the links at the top of the page to share.)

CONNECT with me on Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube! I will be sharing all the updates and posting some videos as well about the whole process and behind-the-scenes content. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read a bit of my story. I'm more than ready to start this journey. Are you?

- Mac

I would love for you to accompany me on 'Team Mac' and us do this together! Are you in?Other Ways You Can HelpIf you are not able to contribute, I totally understand. There are a few other important ways you can help me along this process as well! Below are all the different ways you support me: Pre-order the EP! I would love to offer the most amazing perks from myself and my contributors! (See the perks section for more info!) PRAYERS! This is one of the most vulnerable things I've ever done publicly, and your prayers would mean absolutely everything. SPREAD THE WORD! Share this link on your Facebook, your Instagram story or in a post, email it or text it to your friends, anything and everything! Every bit helps, and I would be so appreciative of your support. Use Indiegogo's share tools to easily get the word out there to your followers! They make it so incredibly easy to navigate. (See the links at the top of the page to share.)CONNECT with me on Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube! I will be sharing all the updates and posting some videos as well about the whole process and behind-the-scenes content. Thank you so much for taking the time to read a bit of my story. I'm more than ready to start this journey. Are you?- Mac

story:
BASSEL & THE SUPERNATURALS
Website | Spotify | Soundcloud
Facebook | Instagram | Twitter | YouTube

 

Syrian Heart. Chicago Soul.

Our third album, Smoke & Mirrors, is due out on Syrian Independence Day (April 17, 2020). As always, 20% of our proceeds support the sustainability of immigrants & refugees through the Karam Foundation. Hitting our $15,000 goal = $3,000 in charity donations!

 

Smoke & Mirrors is inspired by the false glamour that surrounds touring artists. We’ve played over 300 shows across North America since 2016 — from packed theaters to clubs where the soundcheck had more fans than the 4-hour set that followed. We’ve made friends with countless pets, couches, and floors. We’ve also lost close friends and family along the way. Music brought us together, and creates infinite meaning in our lives — but it doesn’t always cover rent. 

The singles are now available on Spotify, Apple Music, Pandora, and all other online retailers courtesy of Six Degrees Records in San Francisco, CA.

  • "Stepping Back in Time" was featured on Spotify's "All Funked Up" playlist and surpassed 200,000 streams!
     
  • "Aleppo" is a disco & funk inspired track celebrating the city featuring Arabian vocalist Ashkur (and Bassel’s debut singing in Arabic).
     
  • "Calculated Love" opens on a radiant intro of smooth horns and a riffing guitar, then flows into a funk-flavored soul tune... calculated to first charm, and then captivate you with its sophisticated upmarket feel and posh velvety energy." - Medium
     
  • "Smoke" dismantles the myth of glamour often surrounding touring artists. The music video was released on March 6, 2020.

 

Our album photographer (Samer Almadani)  and the film team behind our "Smoke" video (Raw Bacon Productions) endured 20+ hours in auditoriums, green rooms, and frozen alleyways to bring our vision to life. Our design team (Andy Hendricks, Terran Washington) put the final touches together, and now it's finally ready to come out of the oven!

We're offering *Special Edition* 12" vinyls (in "smoke" - see below), traditional vinyls (in black), CDs, t-shirts, and more in addition to our 20% donation for humanitarian relief.

 

 

It takes a community.

We are deeply grateful for the team that made this all possible. We are sincerely proud of this album, and the opportunity to share it with our families, friends, and fans.

Our goal is to raise $15,000 of the $40,000 in expenses we've incurred (independently) to put this album together. We covered the majority through relentless touring, and now we need your support to cross the finish line. Here is how it all broke down:

Total Expenses

Recording: $8,500
Tracking, Mixing, Mastering

Merchandise: $6,000
T-Shirts, CDs, 12" Vinyl (Black + Special Edition Smoke)

Marketing: $17,000 
PR, Radio, Photo & Film, Album Art, Design

Personnel: $8,500
Production, Musicians, Session Players, Design

= $40,000

 

About the Album.

"The nine tracks on the album engineered by GRAMMY-nominated Jeff Breakey and produced by Brandon Hunt strike a fine balance between up-tempo, energized funk and downtempo, melodically rich soul, while keeping it all cohesive. The 12” vinyl record reflects this contrast between side A to side B."

[Full Press Release]

 

Production Credits.

Smoke & Mirrors was recorded in Chicago in September & October of 2018. The album was engineered and mixed by Jeff Breakey (Good Wolf Music), and mastered by James Auwarter (Coda Room Audio) in Chicago, IL.

**Jeff & James have collectively worked on over 50 GRAMMY-nominated albums!

13 talented artists were featured on the album, with production support from lead guitarist (and resident chess-extraordinaire), Brandon Hunt.

Bassel Almadani: Lead Vocals and Background Vocals
Brandon Hunt: Electric and Acoustic Guitars
Jackson Kidder: Electric and Upright Bass
Carl Kennedy: Keyboards
Stevenson Valentor: Drums
Ben Philips: Trumpet and Flugelhorn
Alex Blomarz: Saxophones and Flute
Reed Flygt: Auxiliary Percussion 
Sydney Jay: Background Vocals
Matt Hannau: Violin
Sara Morrow: Viola
Calvin Armstrong: Cello
Ashkur: Guest Vocals

Additional thanks to Mike Gore, Manuel Reyes, Ryan Barayuga, Chet Zenor, Patrick Childers, and everyone else who helped to make this all possible.

story:
We are Now the Changes, an East Bay-based activist rock band. Our members are: Eyal Gurion (drums and vocals), Daniel Larlham (vocals), Biko Nagara (bass and vocals), and Aaron Schiller (lead guitar).  We hail from the United States, Indonesia, Israel, and South Africa. www.nowthechanges.com

We need your help to cover the costs of recording and production for our second EP, "Activation" (release date: 31 January 2020).

The songs on the album tackle difficult themes like the politics of division, the resurgence of fascism, and the crisis of climate change, while summoning hopeful energies and fresh perspectives.  We offer them as resources to the activist community and to our listeners at large.

We are aiming to raise $7,500 in total, to pay for studio time, engineering fees, production, arranging, mixing, and mastering.  Any contribution you feel comfortable making is welcome.  All contributors to our fundraising campaign will receive a Bandcamp download code for a free digital copy of the album.

And if you're based in the Bay Area, we'd love to have you join us at our EP RELEASE PARTY at the Starline Social Club's downstairs venue, the Crystal Cavern, on 31 January 2020.  Doors open at 8:00 PM; music starts at 8:30.  Tickets are $10-20, sliding scale, at the door.

We are honored to be performing alongside The Seastars and Tell Me Tell Me on January 31st.  The Seastars combine killer vocal harmonies with a mission of empowerment and a vision of symbiotic co-existence.   https://soundcloud.com/theseastars  Tell Me Tell Me delivers energetic guitar and drum music with strong melodies and off-kilter songwriting, inspired by the driving power of punk and indie rock and the riffs of classic rock.  https://tellmetellme.bandcamp.com/

We leave you with some lyrics from the "Activation" album:

no more messiahs sent to us from above / ours is the work, ours the hands of love                        hear our defiance echo across the void of a nation's pride                                                                          here on the earth / who but you and I, brother mine, sister mine?

story:
The Project

Hi all!!!This is Join The Din and we welcome you to our crowdfunding campaign.  
Join The Din is an original band based in London, UK.

Since the release of our first EP in March 2018, we have been tirelessly gigging and writing new material. We now feel ready to produce our first full length Album; and to do so, we need your help!

Being a member of a fully DIY original band is exciting but also a definite challenge when it comes to covering recording and press expenses.  Everything we earn from live performances gets reinvested to improve the quality of our music: now though we need an extra boost to allow us to deliver a truly unique album...and here is where YOU get involved! 

For this special occasion, we will also be collaborating with some of our favourite artists, musicians and creative dear friends.

Supporting our project will get you an inside look at the creative process as well as a variety of customised rewards to choose from. 

The new album will feature elements of Jazz, Rock and World Music combined with eletctronics and some exuberant improvisations.   

Thank you very much for watching,  listening and reading. Please share this project and spread the word. 

We truly appreciate your help.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is 2500 pounds to record and produce the album…. then, if you feel generous, with 3500 pounds we will press vinyls, with 4500 pounds we will have the chance to bring our music directly to your own town in UK and in Europe, with 6000 pounds or more we will create an original and immersive visual experience of one of our live concerts...

...Am sure you get the idea now :)The more We raise, the more We can do, the more We can offer YOU!

If you cannot back the project financially but would like to support us in some other ways, you can still help us with getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign.

All help is welcomed!

 

Risks & Challenges

It is not easy to ask for help but the only way that this record will come to fruition is with your generosity and kind support.  If this campaign is not fully funded, we will not be able to record the album. 

As a band comprising of busy freelancers and professionals, our opportunities to invest money to record new works are limited. 

Your support would allow us to give our time and energy to collaborate with new partners on a unique project, for an intense period, without distraction.

It would provide an invaluable opportunity to spend dedicated time as a band; to help us hone our creative processes and develop our new compositions. 

The New Album will be the most ambitious project we have undertaken so far: 12 musicians, 2 sound engenieers, 2 recording studios and 1 graphic designer. Planning the work and coordinating so many incredible artists is a huge task and it demands constant effort.

Everyone involved is investing so much time, energy, talent and resources into this record, and we want to do it really well.  We are planning the recording process to start in March 2020 and we are confident that, once funded, the album will be ready for the Summer. 

We are on track to deliver something unique:  All we need is Your SUPPORT!!!

story:
We are The Stapletons. We are a husband and wife, harp and guitar duo. We are making a Wild West album and a mini documentary of a musical tour along the Lewis and Clark and Oregon Trail, and we want you to join us on this journey.

Our first album, Ballads and Battles, featured songs inspired by the Civil War history of our home in Pittsburgh, PA.  In the past two years, we've toured extensively throughout the East Coast and Midwest to play our music and share our stories, and we’ve met so many incredible and inspiring people along the way. Now, we’re headed West.

Our new album, Thieves and Dreamers, is a collection of songs of the American Wild West. We've gathered classic, lost, and original songs including Shenendoah, Idaho, and the Ballad of Jesse James . We've been recording these songs in our Arsenal Farm Attic Studio, and we think you will love the way they sound. We have also been researching the stories behind these songs, and we are so inspired by the courage that compelled people to travel over 2,000 miles across the wilderness. These are the songs and stories of the Thieves and Dreamers of the Wild West. We can't wait to share them with you.

With your help, we plan to release the album this summer and then head West, playing our music along the route of the Oregon and Lewis and Clark trail from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania to Portland, Oregon. As we travel, with our instruments and four homeschooling children in tow, we will create a mini documentary of the experience. We will be sharing our photos and writing blog posts about the experience along the way, and we will also be shooting video footage to edit into a documentary which we will release after we return. 

When you contribute to this campaign, you make it possible for us to record, mix, master, and release this album, perform our music along the length of the Oregon Trail, document the tour, and create, edit, and produce a mini-documentary to share with you. 

We look forward to the adventure ahead of us. Thank you for joining us on this journey! 

The Stapletons (Kate, Casey, Olympia, Francisco, Cordelia, and Guinevere)

story:
Summary:

I am over 3 years sober now. It is not something I talk about a lot, but it’s a huge part of my life and my writing. I used to not see much meaning in anything besides feeling anything but sober and music. Since then, I’ve come to understanding; a deeper meaning of what community and music truly are. Years of my life have been spent playing hundreds of shows and bringing home less than $10,000 for the entire year. So, when it comes to this Indiegogo, I truly understand the value of your contribution. I’m grateful to live a life without vices (except coffee... I drink a lot of coffee) and every dollar I make goes towards basic necessities and back into the music. In this ever evolving music industry the only way this works is creating a grass-roots community of a people on this earth that like what you do and want to keep seeing you do it. The reality is that group of people ends up being very few, genuine, lifetime comrades. I hope you will consider being one of those people for me.

This campaign is the ONLY way I can take this next step and now that I have management and a team, I have to deliver. I am eager though. All the songs are written and I'm ready, but if you're not in this industry it is hard to understand just how much it takes to go back to the studio. Your contribution will sponsor the next step in my career. It is a pivotal step. After this EP I will be able to pitch to serious industry networks and actually have a chance in the market.

 

What We Need & What You Get:

This is the budget and what I am required to cover out of pocket (A.K.A what it takes to make a record):

  • Studio (roughly 6 days, includes musician fees): $6,550
  • EP Printing (1000, digipack with multifold): $1200
  • Mixing (5 songs): $2500
  • Mastering (5 songs): $1000
  • PR/Marketing: $2000

 

Our Production Timeline:

  • May 11: launch Indiegogo campaign
  • June 10: Indiegogo campaign complete
  • June 10-15, 24-26: Ian to Milan hill Studio for EP recording
  • July 12: EP mixed
  • July 15: EP mastered (finalized revisions done by July 19)
  • July 22: Submit to TuneCore (this is the latest)
  • July 22-31: Gain exposure
  • August 1: Launch EP

 

This is a tight timeline. I already have booked time in the studio, so I'm hoping we can really knock this out of the park together. This is a big number, but I hope the content I've put out over the past couple of years has illustrated how serious I am about this. I am dedicated and my music keeps getting stronger. I am really excited about this EP.

If you are unable to sponsor this project monetarily, but you feel eager to support, here is a list of things you can do instead (these things are extremely valuable to a musician, even if you are planning on underwriting this project, please consider the following):

  • Connect me with a press contact you may have that would be interested in covering my story
  • Share, Comment, Like, and Follow my social media accounts/posts
  • Spread the word about this campaign
  • Stream my music for free as much as you can/would like to! Spotify especially, Soundcloud, Youtube...
  • Join my street team (I always need help hanging posters, spreading the word about shows, capturing shows and getting hyped on social media)
  • Recycle and pant a tree... seriously, I feel like supporting the environment will honestly help to allow me to keep my job/keep on living on this planet

We have some really exciting perks. The house concert is especially cool, because you can underwrite the initial perk, then re-coup your costs at the event by asking your guests for a door donation. Kamea made some awesome art for you, Ayla too. Everything is great.

Note: I can accept checks to 104 Elm St., Saugerties NY, 12477.

The Impact:

The last Indiegogo I did was a pre-order. I basically used this platform to sell my merchandise and CD. That was awesome, I was really impressed with the $3,000 in revenue. That money helped to re-coup my printing costs, and thankfully I sold another 1,000 CDs since then, but this time around I am sourcing sponsors! The benefits to this sponsorship are outline in the perks, but the most important underlying benefit is your investment in an individual that will forever be grateful to that growth offered only through your contribution. As we grow this music and present the business model we’ve worked hard on to the world, there will be more opportunities to get your name/logo/business out there to a dedicated community. I am excited to be taking these steps, becoming a network thread connecting communities, lasting relationships, and opportunities for success.

 

Risks & Challenges:

If I don't make my goal... I know we will, but anything I do make will be put to use to cover whatever part of the budget I can cover. Nothing will go unused.

The one risk for me, is this financial budget that is required to do this EP right. If one of the pieces of this budget aren’t underwritten, part of the project doesn't see the attention it deserves, and my chances of success decrease significantly.

I work multiple jobs and I’m a full-time musician. I don't drink, I gave up energy drinks, I don't eat out, and I quit smoking, all so I can be the best version of myself and dedicate every dollar to this mission. Your investment is all about the music.

Again, I am extremely grateful to whatever you are able to lend to underwrite this project. Thank you for the support!

 

Love,

-Ian

Mastering (5 songs): $1000
PR/Marketing: $2000
 Our Production Timeline:
May 11: launch Indiegogo campaign
June 10: Indiegogo campaign complete
June 10-15, 24-26: Ian to Milan hill Studio for EP recording
July 12: EP mixed
July 15: EP mastered (finalized revisions done by July 19)
July 22: Submit to TuneCore (this is the latest)
July 22-31: Gain exposure
August 1: Launch EP
 This is a tight timeline. I already have booked time in the studio, so I'm hoping we can really knock this out of the park together. This is a big number, but I hope the content I've put out over the past couple of years has illustrated how serious I am about this. I am dedicated and my music keeps getting stronger. I am really excited about this EP.If you are unable to sponsor this project monetarily, but you feel eager to support, here is a list of things you can do instead (these things are extremely valuable to a musician, even if you are planning on underwriting this project, please consider the following):
Connect me with a press contact you may have that would be interested in covering my story
Share, Comment, Like, and Follow my social media accounts/posts
Spread the word about this campaign
Stream my music for free as much as you can/would like to! Spotify especially, Soundcloud, Youtube...
Join my street team (I always need help hanging posters, spreading the word about shows, capturing shows and getting hyped on social media)
Recycle and pant a tree... seriously, I feel like supporting the environment will honestly help to allow me to keep my job/keep on living on this planet
We have some really exciting perks. The house concert is especially cool, because you can underwrite the initial perk, then re-coup your costs at the event by asking your guests for a door donation. Kamea made some awesome art for you, Ayla too. Everything is great.Note: I can accept checks to 104 Elm St., Saugerties NY, 12477.The Impact:The last Indiegogo I did was a pre-order. I basically used this platform to sell my merchandise and CD. That was awesome, I was really impressed with the $3,000 in revenue. That money helped to re-coup my printing costs, and thankfully I sold another 1,000 CDs since then, but this time around I am sourcing sponsors! The benefits to this sponsorship are outline in the perks, but the most important underlying benefit is your investment in an individual that will forever be grateful to that growth offered only through your contribution. As we grow this music and present the business model we’ve worked hard on to the world, there will be more opportunities to get your name/logo/business out there to a dedicated community. I am excited to be taking these steps, becoming a network thread connecting communities, lasting relationships, and opportunities for success. Risks & Challenges:If I don't make my goal... I know we will, but anything I do make will be put to use to cover whatever part of the budget I can cover. Nothing will go unused.The one risk for me, is this financial budget that is required to do this EP right. If one of the pieces of this budget aren’t underwritten, part of the project doesn't see the attention it deserves, and my chances of success decrease significantly.I work multiple jobs and I’m a full-time musician. I don't drink, I gave up energy drinks, I don't eat out, and I quit smoking, all so I can be the best version of myself and dedicate every dollar to this mission. Your investment is all about the music.Again, I am extremely grateful to whatever you are able to lend to underwrite this project. Thank you for the support! Love,-Ian

story:
⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔

 

A BRIEF INTRODUCTION

MEMORIES OF OLD was born from the mind of Billy Jeffs, a life long fan of epic power metal, in order to lay a creative canvas to tell the story of THE ZERAMIN GAME, and unleash the many ideas for songs, melodies and lyrics that had been building up over the years.

Heavily influenced by many of the power metal greats, Billy decided to reach out to one of his biggest inspirations in Tommy Johansson (Majestica, Sabaton), to show what he had been working on, and this eventually led to Tommy contributing his great voice to bring the story to life.

Now, with two singles already released and the album ready to go into full production, we need YOUR help to achieve the level of funding we need and realise this dream, and with that in mind we are assembling FOWLEN'S ARMY, and inviting you to be a part of it!

You'll have the opportunity to get a lot of exclusive perks that will only be available here, and forever become a part of the bands history, as we start on an amazing journey that all starts right here, with the release of our debut album, THE ZERAMIN GAME

 

⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔

 

What We Need & What You Get

Throughout the course of producing our first two singles, it became clear that producing this album was going to be quite a costly process, and has already resulted in some personal debt, so we have decided that unless we want to be releasing in several years, we are going to need your help! 

So, we are looking for raise all the expenses we need to make this album a reality, which for the most part includes booking ourselves into the studio to finish recording, but there are other costs we need to consider, so we made a brief list of everything this campaign is helping to support:

  • Recording, mixing and mastering
  • Cover artwork and Booklet design
  • Music Video and Photo Shoot
  • Personal expenses during the process

To make this happen, we are looking to raise a total of £15,000, which will cover most if not all of the costs and will enable us to bring THE ZERAMIN GAME to you!

 

STRETCH GOALS

In the event we manage to reach our target and more, we have set ourselves a stretch goal to make it clear where that money will go. If the campaign reaches £17,500, we will put this towards a second music video for the album, something we would love to bring you if we can, but isn't as essential as everything above.

If we hit that goal as well, anything further will be used to cover upcoming expenses for touring.

 

PERKS

So, what's in it for you? We have put together several packages that we certainly hope you will all love, and definitely be a rewarding thank you for the support you will be giving us. Here are just some of the items we have to offer across the packages:

  • Digital Album - You'll receive a digital copy of the album, so if you can't quite stretch to a physical album or simply prefer having your music stored digitally, this is the perk for you.
  • Physical Album - A physical copy of The Zeramin Game, with the full colour booklet and also including a special bonus track, 'The Architect's Eyes'.
  • Exclusive Flag - A beautiful full colour flag, featuring exclusive Fowlen's Army artwork, which will only ever be available here.
  • Exclusive T-Shirt - Another crowdfund exclusive, this t-shirt will feature our very special Fowlen's Army, and will only ever be available here.
  • Limited Physical Singles - This is one for the collectors, a physical copy of our two singles, 'The Land of Xia' and 'Zeras Shadow', not released in stores and limited to 50 of each, once they're gone they're gone forever!
  • Signed Drumstick - A signed drumstick used on the recording of the album, each one marked with the initials of the song (or songs!) they were used to record.
  • Guestlist for Life* - This is exactly what it sounds like, you can be put on the guestlist for any future gigs we do, as many times as you want! *excluding festivals


FOWLEN'S ARMY FACEBOOK GROUP

ALL BACKERS will gain access to the closed Facebook group "Fowlen's Army" which will stay exclusive to campaign backers ONLY for the duration of the album production. In this group you will have access to extra content, behind the scenes action, merchandise pre-sales and more!!
 

RELEASE & DELIVERY

We are currently planning to have the album ready for release around February/March 2020, and this is also the time frame we are looking at for the perks as well, however where possible we will always try to deliver perks as early as possible!

 

⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔

 

The Impact

Long story short, without you this album may never see the light of day, and as such we just wanted to let all of you know just how much your continued support means to us.

By supporting us through this campaign and becoming a part of FOWLEN'S ARMY, you are becoming a part of the band's history, something we will never forget, as this debut album will be the very thing that we use to get our name out there and start spreading our music around the world, and it all starts right here.

So from the bottom of our hearts, THANK YOU!

 

⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand that sometimes life can be a struggle, it may not be possible for everyone to contribute in the way they would like to, but fear not, there are still other ways you can help us which in the long run are just as important as the funds we're raising.

As we are a new band, getting our name out there and spreading the word is crucial, not only for this campaign but for the future of the band, so we will be eternally grateful for any help you can provide.

We have plenty of platforms online to share, so be sure to spread them around as much as possible!

  • Official Website
  • Facebook
  • Instagram
  • Twitter
  • Bandcamp

 

⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔

is

Billy Jeffs

Tommy Johansson

Anthony Thompson

Erick Tekilla

James Chapman

 

⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔⚔

story:
Will you help us complete our debut album?


What is ACOUTASTiC BOMBASTiC?


I’m glad you asked...

 


This is the name of my large and unique ensemble made up of many marvelous multi- instrumental mates of mine.
My name is Jason Yarde and I’m a Composer, Arranger, Producer and Band Leader and this is literally my dream band!


We’d love it if you could join us and support our music making both live, and recorded, as we complete our debut album...


THE DREAM

When I was a child (not so long ago...) I had a dream where I imagined a vast room full of musical instruments of all shapes and sizes with a handful of folks around to explore them...
Through a commission from the 2005 Cheltenham Jazz Festival and the Jerwood Foundation (ok, a fairly long time ago now...) I was able to manifest the essence of this dream assembling some immensely talented multi-instrumentalists and fantastic musical friends to form a special ensemble - ACOUTASTiC BOMBASTiC (AcouBomb for short!). We have been dreaming and scheming of a way to make it more sustainable ever since.
Thanks to a grant from the PRSF and many, many favours we made some beautiful headway in recording the original commissioned suite ‘Random Wishes and Abstract Dreams’ in the summer of 2015.
Now armed with some new music and a renewed enthusiasm, we are about to finish what we started...

Will you help us?


With your donations we will be able to complete the album...

 

With your help we will be able to pay for:

 

 

DONOR LOVE

I am so excited to dole out loads of donor love to our supporters.

Besides access to updates and the exclusives of our Indiegogo campaign, naturally you’ll get the first opportunities to hear and own the music before the wider world across a number of formats from download, CD and double (maybe even triple...?) vinyl (signed or not) and at a handful of live events marking the album release at the earliest opportunity in 2020! There’s all sorts of merchandise and experiences available too, including quite possibly you personally expanding our in-house choir in time to make it on to the record!

                                                                                                                                                         

We are SO close but we really need your help. I’ve pushed the favours within the band as far as I can, so... We need a bigger band! Please JOIN US and JOIN IN!...

 

The AcouBomb Family

Support us and become part of our amazing family, made up of some of the most in demand musicians in the UK and probably on planet earth in general... But don’t just take my word for it, please check them out and all the good works they are involved in.

 

ESKA (Matthew Herbert/Nitin Sawney/Zero7)

MARCINA ARNOLD (Quite Sane/Bheki Mseleku/Steve Williamson)

EMMA SMITH (Elysian Quartet/Hot Chip/James Yorkston)

ELLEN BLAIR (Echo Strings/Paloma Faith/Reggae Philharmonic)

SEB ROCHFORD (Polar Bear/Sons Of Kemet/Andy Sheppard)

IVO NEAME (Phronesis/Marius Neset/Hermeto Pascoal)

ORPHY ROBINSON (Black Top/Jazz Warriors/Nigel Kennedy)

SHANTI JAYASINHA (Grand Union Orchestra/Alex Wilson/Janette Mason)

NEIL CHARLES (Terence Blanchard/Cerys Matthews/Alex Hawkins)

JULIAN SIEGEL (Partisans/John Taylor/Diane Schuur)

HARRY BROWN (Jazz Jamaica/Adele/Rudimental)

JASON YARDE (Andrew Hill/Louis Moholo Moholo/Keziah Jones)


With special guest members including...

COREY MWAMBA (New Dark Art/Evan Parker/Orphy Robinson)

DANIEL LOUIS (Panorama/Gary Trotman)

CONOR CHAPLIN (Laura Jurd/Phil Meadows/Engines Orchestra)

BENET MCLEAN (Sir Simon Rattle/Carleen Anderson/Dennis Rollins)

JASON LINDNER (Now vs Now/David Bowie/Don Mclaskin)

 

WOOOOOO!!! (...Sorry!...)
Within the ranks of the ensemble lurks a Saxophone Quintet, a String Ensemble and a small Choir, that can collectively groove, float, swing and potentially travel the globe from one measure to the next. And, there are still so many combinations yet to explore...
If you haven’t already, please do have a look at our video and see what’s available in the store/perks list and feel free to share with those who may help us...


A massive THANK YOU!

Thank you to all those who have supported me and our musical endeavours thus far and I really look forward to catching up with you along what I hope will be a long(er) and most fruitful journey with ACOUTASTiC BOMBASTiC.

All the Best Jason

(...Sorry!...)Within the ranks of the ensemble lurks a Saxophone Quintet, a String Ensemble and a small Choir, that can collectively groove, float, swing and potentially travel the globe from one measure to the next. And, there are still so many combinations yet to explore...If you haven’t already, please do have a look at our video and see what’s available in the store/perks list and feel free to share with those who may help us...
A massive THANK YOU!
Thank you to all those who have supported me and our musical endeavours thus far and I really look forward to catching up with you along what I hope will be a long(er) and most fruitful journey with ACOUTASTiC BOMBASTiC.All the Best Jason
campaign_city: London / St Leonards On Sea, United Kingdom

story:
Summary

My name is Cory Alexander. You can check me out on instagram @thecoryalexander

 I'm a singer/songwriter, actor and model from New York City. I come from a theatrical background, and have been immersing myself in music over the past year. I've always had a dream of producing my own music, and am finally at a point where I'm ready to get my music out there! 

I've chosen 6 of my songs to put together an EP, starting with my first single, "Dreamland", which will be released to all streaming platforms on May 1st. 

I am aiming for the entire EP to be released at the end of the summer, at some point. 

My influences include artist such as: Christine and the Queens, The 1975,, Bleachers, Hayley Williams, The Strike, Walk The Moon, Panic! at the Disco and Queen and David Bowie.

Countless hours and hard work go into the production of an EP. Studio time, engineering, mixing, and mastering are just a few of the elements involved in getting a highly polished finished product. I  want to put out the best product possible, to make a great first impression with my music. 

Please consider donating, to help with the cost of putting together my debut EP. Your support is incredibly important, and valued.

Thank you to everyone who donates, and please stay tuned for some kick-ass tunes this year!

story:
Who even are we? 

We are Nicole Olney and Xander Hitzig, and we make folky tunes that soothe the soul! I, Nicole, have been living in Los Angeles for about 7 years now as an actress/writer/filmmaker, and met the brilliant traveling musician Xander when he flew into SoCal from West Virginia about 4 years ago. We met in a creative setting, a country musical to be exact (but that's a story for another time), and have since then formed a relationship largely based on mutual creation and support. 

St. John's Dance started off as a twinkle in our eyes as Xander taught me how to really play the guitar and encouraged me to use my poetry to create songs. He helped me find my voice, while fine-tuning his own, and here we are, four years later with a hot new record to show for it!

This music video is so important to us because, in this content-driven society, we see it as a perfect opportunity to introduce ourselves and inform the world what we are all about: making incredible art, and making it accessible to everybody. We have invested so much time and love into the creation of our first record, Thirsty, that when it comes to releasing this baby to the public, we wanna get it right! And you can help us do that! 

What We Need & What You Get!

 When you make your contribution, you are supplying us with:

The funds to rent a proper camera package/ insurance coverage for the shoot.

Food, lodging, and gas to nourish the lovely creative crew. 

Money to hire incredibly talented friends who will make this video look like magic. 

Not only are you helping us make a music video when you donate, but you become permanently engrained in this band's history! And we want to thank you for that. Some perks/ gifts that we are offering in exchange are:

$50 or more, you are the first one to see this video. You will receive an email from us personally thanking you, and attach the music video that you helped make happen!

$100 or more, you are the first one to receive a hard copy of our NEW E.P.! We will personally mail you our new record, with a genuine Venice Beach postcard, once this video is live.  

$150 or more, wow, who are you, are we friends? We must be. Here, have a new album but also have a St. John's Dance T-shirt deigned by the brilliant artist Matt J. Adams. 

$200 or more, OMG take an E.P., take a t-shirt, and take a PRODUCER credit for this epic music video that you helped create. Show it off to your friends and slap it on your resume when it becomes a viral hit. 

note: If you donate enough to receive a t-shirt/album/postcard, we will be sending you your gifts in the summer, when this E.P.  and video are completed! So please be patient as we, for lack of a finer term, get our shit together!

If we don't reach our goal, we are still making this video happen! We will just re-evaluate our budget accordingly and go from there. You will still be receiving the same perks if you donate! We will just have to get a little crafty is all! 

The Impact

It sounds so cliché, but we, as St. John's Dance, really would not be where we are today without community support. From our living situation, to the recording studio we have access to, and everything in between, we are extremely grateful for the opportunities granted to us by our friends and family members that enable us to make our art! This music video is simply the next step in our journey, and we know that, as always, we need our community to help make it happen. 

We feel confident that we will create something special with your help, a product that not only makes us proud, but you, too! Two years ago, I wrote, starred in, and co-created a short film that premiered at the Cannes film festival, with a micro-budget very similar to this one! Xander has, over the course of his rich musical history, created over eight albums with multiple bands with his original songs that have taken him all over the country/world. With our powers combined it is our intention to make a project that receives similar global attention! 

Risks & Challenges

Of course, we make all of the plans we want, and then life happens. We know from experience that unforeseen difficulties can place strain on any creative endeavor. 

That being said, we feel prepared to take on the responsibility of confronting these challenges, whatever they may be, and coming out the other side with a product that aligns with our vision.  

If it is a matter of money, we will either shave down expenses as necessary, or create another campaign to support ourselves appropriately. If we find that we need more time, we will recalibrate our schedules accordingly, and inform you about the updates! Our lives as artists over the years have been peppered with many a hurdle, and each one has made us ultimately better at what we do.

Other Ways You Can Help

So if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help!

We know times get tough, but money isn't everything! You can help us out by spreading the word about our campaign and help it get the attention and momentum it needs to get it fully funded! Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word through the instagram, the facebook, the twitter, the tinder, the anything-you-can-think-of!
story_txt:
Who even are we? 
We are Nicole Olney and Xander Hitzig, and we make folky tunes that soothe the soul! I, Nicole, have been living in Los Angeles for about 7 years now as an actress/writer/filmmaker, and met the brilliant traveling musician Xander when he flew into SoCal from West Virginia about 4 years ago. We met in a creative setting, a country musical to be exact (but that's a story for another time), and have since then formed a relationship largely based on mutual creation and support. 
St. John's Dance started off as a twinkle in our eyes as Xander taught me how to really play the guitar and encouraged me to use my poetry to create songs. He helped me find my voice, while fine-tuning his own, and here we are, four years later with a hot new record to show for it!
This music video is so important to us because, in this content-driven society, we see it as a perfect opportunity to introduce ourselves and inform the world what we are all about: making incredible art, and making it accessible to everybody. We have invested so much time and love into the creation of our first record, Thirsty, that when it comes to releasing this baby to the public, we wanna get it right! And you can help us do that! 
What We Need & What You Get!
 When you make your contribution, you are supplying us with:
The funds to rent a proper camera package/ insurance coverage for the shoot.
Food, lodging, and gas to nourish the lovely creative crew. 
Money to hire incredibly talented friends who will make this video look like magic. 
Not only are you helping us make a music video when you donate, but you become permanently engrained in this band's history! And we want to thank you for that. Some perks/ gifts that we are offering in exchange are:
$50 or more, you are the first one to see this video. You will receive an email from us personally thanking you, and attach the music video that you helped make happen!
$100 or more, you are the first one to receive a hard copy of our NEW E.P.! We will personally mail you our new record, with a genuine Venice Beach postcard, once this video is live.  
$150 or more, wow, who are you, are we friends? We must be. Here, have a new album but also have a St. John's Dance T-shirt deigned by the brilliant artist Matt J. Adams. 
$200 or more, OMG take an E.P., take a t-shirt, and take a PRODUCER credit for this epic music video that you helped create. Show it off to your friends and slap it on your resume when it becomes a viral hit. 
note: If you donate enough to receive a t-shirt/album/postcard, we will be sending you your gifts in the summer, when this E.P.  and video are completed! So please be patient as we, for lack of a finer term, get our shit together!
If we don't reach our goal, we are still making this video happen! We will just re-evaluate our budget accordingly and go from there. You will still be receiving the same perks if you donate! We will just have to get a little crafty is all! 
The Impact
It sounds so cliché, but we, as St. John's Dance, really would not be where we are today without community support. From our living situation, to the recording studio we have access to, and everything in between, we are extremely grateful for the opportunities granted to us by our friends and family members that enable us to make our art! This music video is simply the next step in our journey, and we know that, as always, we need our community to help make it happen. 
We feel confident that we will create something special with your help, a product that not only makes us proud, but you, too! Two years ago, I wrote, starred in, and co-created a short film that premiered at the Cannes film festival, with a micro-budget very similar to this one! Xander has, over the course of his rich musical history, created over eight albums with multiple bands with his original songs that have taken him all over the country/world. With our powers combined it is our intention to make a project that receives similar global attention! 
Risks & Challenges
Of course, we make all of the plans we want, and then life happens. We know from experience that unforeseen difficulties can place strain on any creative endeavor. 
That being said, we feel prepared to take on the responsibility of confronting these challenges, whatever they may be, and coming out the other side with a product that aligns with our vision.  
If it is a matter of money, we will either shave down expenses as necessary, or create another campaign to support ourselves appropriately. If we find that we need more time, we will recalibrate our schedules accordingly, and inform you about the updates! Our lives as artists over the years have been peppered with many a hurdle, and each one has made us ultimately better at what we do.
Other Ways You Can Help
So if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help!
We know times get tough, but money isn't everything! You can help us out by spreading the word about our campaign and help it get the attention and momentum it needs to get it fully funded! Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word through the instagram, the facebook, the twitter, the tinder, the anything-you-can-think-of!

story:
Hi there,

and welcome to my Indie GoGo campaign. The purpose of this campaign is to fund the recording, mixing, and mastering of 10 new songs for my next full-length LP, plus revamps of 4 songs to be released possibly as bonus tracks or singles.

The new songs are thematically a continuation of my past stuff: girlfriends, political comedy, my feelings on current events. I wrote one song to go with a friend's screenplay (I'm trying to sell out to Hollywood).

If you already know my work (thank you for that!) you may recognize the bonus songs to be recorded: "Old Hussies Never Die," "Angel Rant," "Idiot for Love," and "It's 12:01." All were previously released, but I have some new interpretations in mind. As a backer, you will receive copies, whatever the final format.

The album sessions have already begun at the historic Hyde Street Studios in San Francisco. I have the great fortune to be working with bassist Shawn Miller, drummer Andrew Laubacher, and engineer Will Chason. Your financial support will help see these sessions to completion, and also help cover the cost of the album art, manufacturing of a limited release CD, and, if enough of you request it, vinyl!

Thank you for being part of my record!

listen:

http://www.dawnoberg.com

The hilarious Trump video

It's 12:01

I'd love to be wrong

Information is your friend

praise:

"Arguably this era's most entertaining protest songsmith."  —New York Music Daily

"... A painfully honest, verbally dexterous, and fearless songwriter with a whopping gift for pop song construction" —Portland Monthly

"...Frequently hilarious, drawing on unique images and turns of phrase that recall John Darnielle of the Mountain Goats" —The Rumpus

"...West coast rock's own Gertrude Stein" —LA Record

story:
My Backround:

Hi, I'm Jasmine Cherí!  I am a multi-faceted artist on the verge of releasing my first album.  I grew up in a musical family where creative expression was greatly encouraged.  Both of my parents were musicians and had various creative talents.  From the time I was a small child, I found myself drawing, painting, singing, learning to play various instruments and dancing.  I have continued to cultivate my creative interests into adulthood, participating in art events, producing and performing my own music, taught partner dancing for ten years and now enjoy sharing my love for music as an on-air personality for Radio Margaritaville on SiriusXM.  

Musical Influence and Genre:

Growing up, my parents exposed me to music and instruments from all over the world.  This is where the world beat influence in my music comes from.  In high school I developed a love for dance and electronic music.  My music is an eclectic fusion of urban electronic sounds with the earthy notes of multi-cultural influence.  If I had to categorize it, I'd call it 'electro-acoustic worldbeat fusion'.  Others have described it as indie pop, EDM, chill step, electronic, world, ambient, etc.  In my 'sound' you will hear a variety of instruments including synth pads, hand drums, steel drum, sitar, Native American flute, cello, upright bass, marimba, ukulele, tremolo guitar, Spanish style guitar, saxophone and more.  My greatest musical influence concerning my vocal styling is Enya, so you will hear stacks of dreamy, atmospheric vocals in my music as well. 

The Journey, the Videos and the Art:

Seven years ago I was inspired to complete a collection of music that I had been producing for my own enjoyment.  During this time of my life I was embarking on an incredible journey of shedding the pain and disappointment of the past.  My creative flow was on fire!  One song after another kept flowing out of me.  My inspiration for visual art was also exploding at this time.  I could barely keep up with the flood of creativity.  Little by little I realized that the themes in the artwork were very closely related and tied into the themes in the music, and then I began to get creative visions for music videos for each song.  It dawned on me that if this music and art helped me rise up out of some dark times of my life and was such a huge part of my healing process, I should share it with the rest of the world.  The themes revolve around hope, love, restoration, rising above and overcoming fear and doubt, discovering my true beauty and finding greater joy than I had ever experienced before...and of course there's a few love songs in there as well!  So I've altered some of this artwork for women's shirt designs that tie in with the album.  I currently have one music video completed for my single, "Neon Fun", which will be released this August!  Last summer I ventured to Kauai and captured some starter footage for several other videos, but there is more footage needed to complete the story lines.  You can see some of this footage in the promo video above! I have had many people ask me, "Why music videos? They are so expensive!".  Here is my answer:  Because I am just as passionate about visual art and dance as I am about music...to me, in my wildly creative mind, they are all connected.  To me, the music itself is very moving on it's own, but combined with the visuals, it adds a whole new level of artistry and expression that takes listener/viewer deeper into the heart and the storyline of the music in a fun and creative way.  Also, music videos are a great away to get exposure.  It's a creative platform that can reach people all over the world!   My original plan was to release the album last summer.  Due to some unexpected circumstances, it was delayed.  After overcoming various obstacles over the last year, I decided to put together this crowdfunding campaign to raise the funds needed to make the final push for this release.  The mixing and mastering of the album is #1 priority...but to complete these next two videos would be epic and a dream come true and give my listeners a deeper experience of the songs.

The Breakdown:

Where is all this money going??

• Mixing and mastering

• Photography for album art, promotions and new website

• CD manufacturing

• Digital distribution, marketing, targeted ads, registration with BMI, etc

• Music video production for two more videos- this includes costumes, choreography, needed equipment and travel expenses

• 10% of final goal goes towards IndieGoGo as the campaign fee

• 30-50% of shirt sales goes towards the cost of the shirt and design printing

 

Perks & Incentives:

In addition to pre-sale music, I am offering a variety of my other art forms!  Shirt designs, handmade jewelry, art prints and photography.  Below you will find detailed photos, to the right you will find the perk buttons for each item!  You have the option of adding on the digital or CD version of the album to any purchase.  Please feel free to send me a private message with any questions or concerns!

 

Shirt Designs-  

I've rendered some fun, colorful, and playful designs of my art into tank top designs just in time for the heat of summer!  Each tank comes with a digital download of the album once it is released. I've got multiple colors and sizes available. The ink is transluscent, which creates diversity in colors, brightness and texture depending on the shirt...so for those of you that prefer darker colors, I've got darker shirt options that tone down the brightness of the designs. You can select the color and size at point of purchase.  Look for the perk buttons to the right! (Please note that the design colors are going to appear more vivid on the screen than in real life)

'Made to Fly' Parrot Design:

'Made to Play' Whale Design:

 

'Soul Surfing Shell' Design:

NEW Men's Variations:

'Creative Flow' Design:

'Made for Adventure' Sailboat Design:

NEW Men's Variations:

 

Handmade jewelry- I've been crafting and selling jewelry since I was 11 years old!  I took a break from it to focus more on music, but have made a special jewelry series just for this campaign using copper, abalone, dentalium tusk shells, vintage beads and gemstones.  Each piece is one of a kind and comes with a download of my first single once it's released!  You have the option of adding the full digital album at the point of purchase.  Each piece has a perk button of it's own.  You can view the detailed photos here and find the buttons to the right!  (Please note that the colors on the screen may differ slightly from real life)

Art Prints- 

Here is a collection of prints of my original drawings and paintings. They are matte finished, hand signed and come with a download of my first single once it's released!  You have the option of adding the full digital album at the point of purchase.  They are printed within an 11"x17" space, but not all of them are those exact dimensions. The name for each work of art is above the photo in bold lettering.  Each one has a perk button of it's own.  You can view the detailed photos here and find the buttons to the right! (Please note that the colors on the screen may differ slightly from the real life print)

Nose Kiss:

Hope Tree:

Freedom:

Journey:

Creative Flow:

Made for Adventure:

Everlasting Love & New Life:

Made to Fly:

Flamingo Fancy:

Soul Surfing Shell: in aqua, rainbow or henna


Photography Prints- 

Each print comes with a download of my first single once it's released!  You have the option of adding the full digital album as an add on at the point of purchase. I have always loved photography, and I tend to put a very artistic, dreamy spin on my photos that represent how the scenery makes me feel.  My photography shows the viewer how I experience nature through the eyes of my heart!  Some are sold as singles and others are sold as sets with 2-4 photos.  If you would like a custom set or just a single from a set, please feel free to send me a private message and we can make that happen! They are matte finished, signed, and printed within an 11"x17" space, but not all of them are those exact dimensions as I love the vintage square look.  Each one/set has a perk button of it's own.  You can view the detailed photos here and find the buttons to the right! Locations of the photos are stated right above. (Please note that the colors on the screen may differ slightly from the real life print)

Joshua Tree- Primary Color Set:

Joshua Tree Boulder Set:

Joshua Tree Park- Tree Trio Set:

Florida Gulf Coast Set:

Florida Gulf Coast- Sea Oats:

Pacific Beach, San Diego- Flying Set:

Torrey Pines, San Diego:

San Diego Skies Set:

Pacific Beach, San Diego- Flying High:

Northern California Coast in Humboldt County- Beach Life Set:

Kauai Mountain and Palm Tree Set:

Waimea Canyon, Kauai- Waterfall Single:

Florida Gulf Coast & Kauai Double Set:

Sedona, Arizona- Single:

Sedona, Arizona- Double Set:

Sedona, Arizona- Magenta Trio Set:

Sedona, Arizona- Burnt Sepia Trio Set:

 

Photos of Jasmine by:  Amanda René Photography

https://www.amandarene.com

story:
The Same and Far Away EP

For years I have been searching for my signature sound. I've tried many styles and pushed myself to write in new ways, but in the last few years I've returned to my roots, picked up my acoustic guitar and given in to the music that came most naturally. I'm proud of these songs and feel that they truly reflect who I am as an artist.

In February 2019, I assembled a killer band and debuted these new songs. In the audience was my friend, Will Kennedy, an incredible sound engineer and producer. Will loved the songs so much that he agreed to partner with me to record them as beautifully as we can. I am so grateful for his confidence in this project and can't wait for you all to hear the work we make together!

As an independent artist it is crucial to have the support of your community to sustain you. I have so many incredible people in my life that have supported me and believed in me and my creative endeavors. I hope that you will consider being a part of this project and a part of my career as an artist. Your contributions mean everything to me and are a source of encouragement I can't even begin to describe. 

 

What We Need

I've been blessed with an amazing team that is helping me make this project as affordably as possible. I'm hoping to raise $4,000 that will go towards the cost of:

  • 2 days of studio time
  • Paying the incredible musicians that will be featured on the EP
  • Mixing and mastering
  • Distribution fees (getting music on online selling/streaming platforms)
  • Making physical copies
  • Creating a small line of merchandise (t-shirts, stickers, etc) for perks and sale at shows
  • Promotion and marketing

Why crowdfunding?

Well, the short answer to this question is that it keeps artists out of debt. Independent artists are basically their own small businesses. Any new project requires capital to make it happen. Some are blessed to have thousands of dollars of their own money to invest into their projects, and some, like me, are freelancers who piece together their income tour by tour, gig by gig, side hustle by side hustle. 

  • For me, crowdfunding is an opportunity to get my record made without emptying out my own personal bank account.
  • For you, crowdfunding is an opportunity for you to be my record label.
  • By contributing to my project you are saying that you are invested in me as an artist, that you want to be a part of my work, and that you believe that final project will be worth your investment.

  • My campaign for my last album was a success and has inspired me to work even harder to make something that you will love. I'm always striving to improve and your support encourages me in that.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Share, share, share, share! The internet is an amazing tool that helps ideas get spread all the time. Please consider sharing on your socials to help me reach fans I don't know yet.
  • Word of mouth is worth more than gold! If you have a friend, family member, or co-worker that you think might like what I'm doing, talk to them about the campaign, show them one of my videos, direct them to my music on Spotify...etc. I know I am way more likely to check something out if it is directly referred to me by someone that knows me well.

I've been blessed with an amazing team that is helping me make this project as affordably as possible. I'm hoping to raise $4,000 that will go towards the cost of:

2 days of studio time
Paying the incredible musicians that will be featured on the EP
Mixing and mastering
Distribution fees (getting music on online selling/streaming platforms)
Making physical copies
Creating a small line of merchandise (t-shirts, stickers, etc) for perks and sale at shows
Promotion and marketing


Why crowdfunding?
Well, the short answer to this question is that it keeps artists out of debt. Independent artists are basically their own small businesses. Any new project requires capital to make it happen. Some are blessed to have thousands of dollars of their own money to invest into their projects, and some, like me, are freelancers who piece together their income tour by tour, gig by gig, side hustle by side hustle. 

For me, crowdfunding is an opportunity to get my record made without emptying out my own personal bank account.
For you, crowdfunding is an opportunity for you to be my record label.

By contributing to my project you are saying that you are invested in me as an artist, that you want to be a part of my work, and that you believe that final project will be worth your investment.
My campaign for my last album was a success and has inspired me to work even harder to make something that you will love. I'm always striving to improve and your support encourages me in that.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some of you may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Share, share, share, share! The internet is an amazing tool that helps ideas get spread all the time. Please consider sharing on your socials to help me reach fans I don't know yet.
Word of mouth is worth more than gold! If you have a friend, family member, or co-worker that you think might like what I'm doing, talk to them about the campaign, show them one of my videos, direct them to my music on Spotify...etc. I know I am way more likely to check something out if it is directly referred to me by someone that knows me well.

story:
My name is Aelita Yoon, and I'm a singer/songwriter. Or well, that was what the plan was.

But for the last 8 years, I've had to put my own lyrics aside to translate other people's and sing with those. I was never financially supported in music, and I didn't have the right networks to release anything more than a songwriting contest entry that made it to Finals in middle school.

Lacking any foundation for a solid audience following, I started out in YouTube's amateur Japanese song cover community, colloquially referred to as the "Youtaite community" (a portmanteau of "YouTube" and the Japanese slang, "utaite", which is a pun on the characters for "singer (kashyu)").

Now that I'm an adult in the age of the Internet and social connection, I'm growing weary of the translation process, and I've had a strong desire to return to my roots as a songwriter.

I met the producer of the project indirectly through the Dextra community when we found that no one was responding to our requests for a collaboration. Seeing as we literally lived about an hour away from each other, we got to work with the first track.

The first track just finished recording vocals on June 19th, 2019. Within 2-3 weeks time, the track will be ready for public release with its own music video that I'll be animating!

But, an EP is supposed to be 4-5 tracks. And there are still many songs I'd like to work on to add to this EP by the time the first single's promotion releases! That's where YOU come in!

 

 

 

 

 

The plans for this EP release are via Spotify and iTunes streams, as well as pay-what-you-can on Bandcamp, with an option for physical goods (more info in STRETCH GOALS). Because the expected financial turnout of this is quite low, we need a strong financial foundation going into the rest of the production. The first track has already been invoiced and paid for. What I'm asking for is support in funding the rest of the EP.

 

 

 

 

 

 

As a thank-you for your support, the following perks are available!

  1. a DL code for the full digital EP OR the title track, "Gemini" for free + a digital postcard + name credits in the Bandcamp release under "SUPPORT TEAM"
  2. + a physical print of the Tier 1 postcard mailed to you
  3. + a handmade zine containing production notes, lyrics and album cover iterations
  4. + a physical CD of the full EP, created the same way I made my first EP (super scrappy, but made with love!) + a handwritten thank-you note
  5. + an English dub of an anime song/Vocaloid/video game OST per your request, fully mixed and mastered with a matching illustration (the YouTube video without the video, and exclusively for you)

Regardless of whether the goal is achieved or not, the EP will still be released. The difference will be in the quality of the work, or the number of tracks that are actually worked on with the producer, and which ones I'll have to create on my own. The quality of the EP release will be entirely dependent on the success of this campaign! To ensure that the donations are maximized, I've made sure that all of the perks were financially achievable about of my own pocket, NOT from the donation pot.

 

 

STRETCH GOALS: For every $600 we exceed on the goal, a new track will be added to the album, with a maximum of $2400 (4 extra tracks). From $2450+ onwards, it will go towards printing the corresponding number of limited edition physical CDs, professionally printed. The continued ability to receive donations will be done via Indiegogo's InDemand program.

 

 

 

 

 

This EP is a part of a bigger umbrella project I've been working on for the past year called the chantabille project. It's a self-love multimedia introspective journey I set out on as the grey-haired, gold-rimmed spectacled lover of life that I named "Chantabille" over a year ago to work through my mental health difficulties. I had a trail of failures and embarrassments spanning over 10 years, and zero hope going into the project, but it not only inspired me to keep making music, it also helped me heal.

This EP is a way to give back to the Youtaite and anime-song communities that have helped me grow so much during my time in university and during life after graduation. The lyrics are both honest and painful, but always end with bravery and inspiration. The reason why this EP is planned for streaming and "pay-what-you-can" is because I want to make it as accessible as possible, but that needs a lot of support from those who can afford to help!

Music is a powerful language, and I've been lucky to team up with a producer who's been working in the music industry for over 10 years. I'd love to continue this collaboration so that the EP reaches as many people as possible.

 

 

 

 

 

The biggest risk that this project faces is that we can't even fund the second track on the EP ($565 CAD) and there would still be high-tier donors. These perks will still be honoured, but I would have to compensate for the difference out of my own pocket. 

The money raised will still go towards funding at least one track, but the release date would be delayed, and I would have to save up for the funds for the difference on my own. It's not a terrible risk, but I would like to get this EP released as soon as possible!

There is also a chance that I might have to find another producer who might charge more if the one I'm currently working with decides to pull out. Again, the release date would be delayed, and I would have to save up for the funds for the difference on my own.

 

 

 

 

Even if you can't pledge a certain amount, that's not to say that you still can't help!

Please share this campaign on social media with friends, family and colleagues! Getting the word around to those who might be interested in what we do will speak JUST as voluminously as making a donation. There are handy share buttons for each major social media network at the top of this campaign!

Even if you don't know who I am, I hope that the campaign has inspired you to invest in the project. Because the purpose of "chantabille project" goes beyond just those who enjoy listening to my music: it's meant to inspire others to be brave in their everyday lives, too.

story:
"So, what's with the name?"

After having a lot of inspiration for new music, I think the songs took up most of it - leaving little imagination left for the name! I've been "Sam Brett" before, and the music I released back then was very different to the music I want to release now. Just wanted a fresh start. So naturally, I went to a random name generator!

It churned out a mass of two word phrases, a couple including:

  • Split Chance 
  • Tension Dealer

Didn't like either one, however, Split the Dealer felt right.

"What's the plan?"

The plan is to release a cover of a famous song you'll all know, but won't expect, on Spotify. I also want to film a session video for it, in a really cool location.

(That's all you get to know about it so far!)

Then, after promoting the session using Facebook and Instagram adverts, alongside reaching out to blogs, pages, and playlists - I'm going to release my debut single in late September!

I'll be recording the audio for the session the same day as the single, to save costs. Depending on the budget, we'll also try and make a music video for the new year.

For the single, I'd like to get a PR company on board, as well as host a launch party gig where I'll invite industry people, with Indigogo backers getting a free ticket!

"How will my contribution help?"

I'm working 30 to 40 hours a week, making ends meet as well as building a budget. Most of my free time is spent creating, planning, and building Split The Dealer. Your contribution will take a big strain off building the budget, and will allow me to improve the quality of the music I'm putting out.

"I don't have a lot of money to spare, how else can I help?"

That's completely cool, the fact that you want to support is more than enough! There are many ways to help, even just sharing the new content, telling your friends, and listening to the music is huge. Following my Split The Dealer socials is also a massive contribution:

  • https://www.instagram.com/splitthedealer
  • https://www.facebook.com/splitthedealer
  • https://twitter.com/splitthedealer

Thank you! 

- Split
