story:
Hello dear one,

Thank you so much for taking the time to digitally engage with me & learn about my debut experiential album. I'm a singer-songwriter, electronic music producer, sound healer, & embodied movement guide in the SF Bay area.  

 

This is my crowdfund campaign in which I am raising $12,000+ to cover the costs of production, hired musicians, and mixing & mastering for my upcoming album that will be an experience of music w/ poetry, earth prayers, & meditations interwoven.

 

This is a campaign for my album but truly it is a CAMPAIGN FOR ALL WOMEN CREATIVES.

It’s a bit unbelievable that current statistics show that women make-up only 30% of musicians and only 6% of women are producers in the industry.*  Let's change this together!

This album is intended to inspire all of us to celebrate the feminine energy that is waking us up to see our planetary destruction but also our innate ability to heal, it is a call to get more in touch with our expression, our sensuality, and in turn the earth.  Together we support the rise of the feminine.

 

My name, “Arula” means offering/alms/gift. 

I chose this name to continually remind myself that I am merely a channel for music to move through me, that I bare a responsibility to make art that is from the heart, honest, relatable, enchanting. I think music is a sacred expression of a universal language that empowers & unites people, an alluring & potent elixir; I feel it running through my veins, calling upon me to continually create & express- to integrate my shadows, share my truth & perspective, to be vulnerable, courageous, and to hold space for the expression of others.

 

Truly we each carry a gift, medicine that is unique to us & crucial for our collective healing, and we each have a responsibility to share it.  

 

THAT is why we are here.

 

My hope is that this album inspires and activates you to share your gifts, embrace your worth, honor our planet, and remember you are a unique & necessary thread in this cosmic fabric.

 

Contributions & Gifts

The life of an artist is not always financially rewarding (at least at first anyway,) however over the past few years I have been following my heart & learning to trust in myself and my art, and that has truly been a beautifully rewarding experience. In doing so, I have seen a significant shift in my music career. It has required that I work harder than ever before to expense musical gear and studio time out of pocket which isn't sustainable at this point in my career. Which is why I am asking for your support. 

Your contributions & gifts will go toward the cost of production, mixing & mastering, and   paying talented instrumentalists. Essentially, the 12,000 dollars I am asking my amazing community for will give me the opportunity to make a QUANTUM leap in my career... so thank you in advance for your generosity and your heart-felt contribution!! I'm beyond excited to be able to hire some of the producers & instrumentalists I've been dreaming of working with! 

 

Essence & Concept

The songs that have been coming through and I am working on for this album are deeply tied to the times we’re living in; they are speaking and in conversation with sacred sensuality, our stewardship of the earth, the evolution of our creative consciousness, and the new paradigm we are shifting into.

This album is a journey, a prayer, an activation, a story...about all of US - the unique inhabitants of planet earth who are remembering their true power lies in their co-creativity, their ability to remain open & compassionate, in their unity.  A story of a civilization who returns to the richness of their essence through song, and movement, and connection.  

 

History

Since I was a wee child I've been writing songs, (even forcing my siblings to help me make music videos, lol but seriously though) ...even then I wanted to be a musician. This has always been my dream. Society does not always support our visions and our dreams, and because of this we sometimes find ourselves on a path that is carved more out of fear than out of passion, or love. 

For a long time I strayed from music because I had been conditioned to believe that music was a hobby and not a career. The past few years I have been working to release this programming and following my true bliss; to truly listen to my inner guidance & knowing that this is what I am meant to do. And from this place, I hope to inspire others to live more fearlessly and to share their art with the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Support 

There are so many ways to support my art besides donating!  If you’re unable to donate but feel aligned with my music and mission please share this campaign with others, listen to & share my music, or follow me on social media... every bit counts; thank you!

 

Deep Bows

Many thanks for taking the time to listen, thank you for your support, and thank you for all you do in the world. Together, I know we can make amazing waves on this planet and activate more of our innate magic!

 

 

 

 

 

 

f*womeninmusic.org

story:
About Us

Points of Roguery is an American Irish folk band based in Washington D.C. All 5 members are active duty Air Force, and have been playing together for 12 years. Our arrangements of Irish and American songs are full of tight vocal harmonies and an array of instrumental textures. In live shows, Joe tells a lot of bad jokes.

When the Night Falls is our second studio album, recorded and produced in Alexandria, VA by Michael Ducassoux, co-owner of Red Room Productions. These 10 tracks are very diverse and promises something for everyone.   

Donation levels and what you get

$5 - 2 Stickers! Circular, 4x4, and 2 different designs by Jason Wellington and Minda Merinsky

$10 - CD digital download of "When the Night Falls"

$10 - CD of our first release from 2009, self titled "Points of Roguery"

$20 - CD of "When the Night Falls"

$30 - Super comfy purple T-Shirt designed by Minda Merinsky, Stickers included

$50 - CD signed by the band, T-Shirt, Stickers

$100 - Album Credit Package - CD signed by the band, T-Shirt, & your name on the album credits

$250 - Associate Producer Package - 3 CDs signed by the band, 2 T-Shirts, & your name listed as associate producer on the album

$500 - Custom Song Arrangement - Everything from the $250 level and we will arrange a song of your choosing and upload it to our YouTube channel

$1000 - Mega Donor! Everything from the $250 level and a private concert at your home (DC Metro area)(since 2 of us are deploying October-January, this might end up being next spring)

Shipping, combo orders, shirt sizes

Shipping will be $5.  If you're doing a larger combo order, we'll ship it all together and let you know if it's a lot over $5.  If we can hand deliver your goodies, we will.

If you purchase a shirt, please select S, M, L, XL, XXL, XXXL - if you need a child size or something larger just let us know and we'll work it out.

story:
Hello friend! I'm Kennedy Frohawk and I'm a singer-songwriter in Nashville, Tennessee.

Even before I became a musician eleven years ago, I knew there was something so magical about music. Any time that I was feeling any particularly strong emotions, I could always relate them back to a song. I found that through this connection with music, I was slowly becoming an emotionally healthier person; I was expressing my emotions in more appropriate ways. As someone who is highly emotional, I feel all my highs and lows at an extreme, and I always let it show. (That whole "heart on your sleeve" thing? Yeah, totally me.) Only I never really found the balance between letting them show and letting them affect my social life. At least, not until I found another outlet to express them through music.

The great thing about music is that there is literally a song for every emotional situation under the sun. Being able to sing in the shower, or dance in the car, or even just quietly dive deep into the lyrics with your headphones on -- it's all so important to letting ourselves feel. So with this album, I want to contribute to that repertoire of emotionally impactful songs. Every song on this album stems from my own experiences where my emotions seemed to peak. My hope is that by sharing them with you, you are able to relate on some level and express your own feelings in a healthy way.

Through this campaign, I am raising the funds necessary for creating and distributing my first full-length studio album. It'll be engineered and produced by Brian Connelly with help from Luke Sanders. I have worked with both of them on previous studio projects and I have always been happy with the work that went into bringing my music to life. "Cinderella Complex" is a song from my first EP, which both of them had a hand in engineering. Check it out below!

 
Though I am going in a different direction stylistically with this next project than I have in the past, I am positive that this album will be high-quality with their help. However, such quality comes at a price, so here is the break down of what your donation will help me cover:
 
  1. Pre-production: Where it all begins. During this stage of development, Brian, Luke, and I will arrange each of the songs and discuss the overall sound. Each song will be broken down to its main elements and fine-tuned to achieve the appropriate feel before starting the recording process.
  2. Recording: At this point, we begin tracking the music and programming the digital instruments.
  3. Mixing and Mastering: This is where the real magic happens. The raw tracks that were captured in the recording phase will be balanced and edited so that the songs have the right texture and color. They will then be mastered to make the project a cohesive listening experience.
  4. Duplication: Since this album is to be available as a physical disc, each individual CD will need to have music burned onto it, and the discs and the disc jackets will need to be printed.
  5. Distribution: The music will also be available on most digital platforms, so your contribution will also help to pay for an aggregator to get my album available to you on websites such as Spotify and Apple Music.

Such kindness and support deserves something in return. So I've provided you with several different options!

Seriously though, I super appreciate any support that you can give me to give life to this album. So, I've made some special packages available to anyone who contributes to this campaign. Here are a few examples:

All available perks can be viewed on the menu on the right!

There are real, raw emotions in the music that will be available on this album.
 
The songs written for this project were inspired by my own emotional experiences, some of which are still very fresh. Building up the courage to release these pieces of my heart with you is part of my own growth in emotional health. My hope is that you can also begin (or maybe continue) your own emotional health journey with my music as a companion.
 
Through this campaign, I want to really connect with you and my audience. I want to build trust and I want to inspire. If you'll let me, I promise to not be just another artist on your playlist. I promise to be a friend.
 

So if at this point you are ready to contribute, all you need to do is hit the "Back It" button at the top of the page and you'll be on your way. I'm extremely grateful for every ounce of support.

If you have friends or family or co-workers that may also be interested in this project, please help me spread the word about my campaign by sharing it to your social media and even word of mouth. There are social media buttons on the page to make sharing easy.

Thank you so much for checking out my campaign page! I look forward to sharing my new music with you! Much love!

I'm extremely grateful for every ounce of support.If you have friends or family or co-workers that may also be interested in this project, please help me spread the word about my campaign by sharing it to your social media and even word of mouth. There are social media buttons on the page to make sharing easy.Thank you so much for checking out my campaign page! I look forward to sharing my new music with you! Much love!

story:
Help Make Exótico Americano Happen !

I, Frederico7, am a Brazilian-born musician based out of Austin-TX and together with my outstanding band, we create soulful, creative and uplifting music that honors our cultural roots while embracing innovation.  We make music in three languages (English, Portuguese, Spanish) in styles fusing Samba, Funk, Reggae, Soul, Rock & more.

By purchasing our music and merchandise here you will be supporting a musical vision of Pan-American unity and love. More of this is exactly what we need in these times of political discord, theatrics about massive border walls, and cages separating families in a broken system.

When we hold space to hear our collective stories, to step into curiosity and put ourselves into another's shoe; we start to see complexities previously unimagined, and often, we realize how much our stories intersect, That idea is a big inspiration for 'Exotico Americano'. 

In 2018 I accomplished a huge step in the American Dream that so many of us immigrants hold dear - I became a naturalized United States citizen after 20 years of service as an artist and educator. While the USA is in a current state of chaos, I believe together we can make a difference and re-learn how to appreciate the melting pot that is the United States. Because THAT is what makes America great! And that is what this album is all about, celebrating the diversity that are the Americas (north, central, and south!). With that being said, will you help me accomplish my Exotico Americano dream by supporting this album?

COSTS TO PRODUCE EXOTICO AMERICANO: $9,750.00

That includes: Recording Expenses; Album Mastering; CD manufacturing; Artwork; Photo/Video production; Distribution; PR Campaign.

WHY AM I ASKING $4000?

-Being able to raise $4000 through pre-sales of CDs, Digital Downloads, Merchandise and other cool stuff would enable me to afford the record's PR and Radio Campaign and to afford to have merchandise and CDs to sell at future shows (to recover from the almost 10k in project debt). This would make a difference in being able to release more music in the future.

The record is done and is ready to be released. We have the product in hands so there is no worries as to this project not being accomplished. Being able to meet our goal, in addition to much needed financial help, would provide warmth and validation from our community that our musical work is relevant in these confusing times.

Let's do this!

If you can't contribute, that's okay! We're still glad you're here, and you can still help in a big way! Help us out by:

1. Sharing this campaign on social media to get the word out using IndieGoGo's share tools!

2. Making some noise about our campaign to your community!

3. Come celebrate with us in person at our album release party on 2/23 @ Empire Control Room!

story:
What: Red Ex Vol. III

When: September 14, 2019 from 3 pm to 11 pm

Where: The Red Museum, 212 15th Street, Sacramento CA 95814

What: Two stages of music from Sacramento to LA to Olympia plus art installations, food, wine, creative cocktails, and local vegan food.

Lineup: L.A. Witch // Drug Apts // Warm Drag // FM (mem. of Black Dice) // So Much Light // Oh, Rose // Glass Bat // Camilla Covington // Julian Never // Mallard // Tentacult // Spitting Roses // Minihahas

Food by Bambi Vegan Tacos. Cocktails sponsored by Burly Beverages. Wine sponsored by Bogle Vineyards. Stage sponsored by the City of Sacramento.

This event is ALL AGES.

What is The Red Museum?

The Red Museum is an old fruit-packing warehouse on the outskirts of Mansion Flats that has transformed into an epicenter of experimentation and raw arts culture in Sacramento. We provide affordable practice/studio space to local creatives and occasionally host highly-curated events that bring people of different ages, ethnicities, genders, economic backgrounds, and tastes together to experience new music, performance, food, and visual art for a reasonable entry price. We believe in the cultural value of providing exposure for emerging artists and we never want money to be a barrier between a good artist and a successful artist. We also want the public, no matter their demographic, to have access to this culture through our events.

This is the third year we have produced the Red Ex event, which raises funds that help us continue to operate throughout the year. Simply put, this event is how we survive. We’re looking to the community for support, but we are also giving back an event that represents the diversity of the current up-and-coming talent in our city. Sacramento has a warm community of artists and art supporters who are open to experiencing new things, making our city a really unique incubator for creativity.

The success of this project will demonstrate that there is a path to helping art spaces survive in a changing and gentrifying city. By galvanizing support from they city, local businesses, and the community, we can ensure that the future of the arts is secure here in Sacramento. The Red Ex event tickets are the foundation of this campaign and we have added other special perks from there. We appreciate any support and hope we will see you soon at The Red Museum!

story:
The Quick Pitch

It’s true, this project is already finished! In that way, this is a non-traditional crowdfunding campaign, and more of a pre-order campaign. It’s my hope that you will take this as a show of how committed I am to this project, to my music. It is also my hope, that you’ll take to heart the idea that crowdfunding is “the new record deal,” and that your support here will make it possible for me to keep creating amazing new music (and funding incredible visual art) in the future! 

The Backstory...

Five years ago, I started to feel some big ideas brewing in my mind and body. I was beginning to face the truth of my mom’s personality disorder, my misconceptions about what my potential could be as an individual (and particularly, as a woman), and the many-layered facades of the institutions of power that held up my world.

I felt that nothing was what it seemed.

So, I began writing on the theme of masks. Masks that conceal and manipulate. Masks that protect. Masks that reveal, filter, focus, or magnify a specific self. Provisional masks. Playful masks. Beautiful masks. Terrifying masks. I believe these are essentially and ubiquitously human concepts and experiences. And I’ve done my very best to represent as many facets of these themes as possible with this collection of songs, all original. I know you’ll see your life experience reflected in this music, and in these lyrics.

Read more on Masks >>> 

The Process

Once the collection of songs was completed, I searched around for the perfect producer, and found my now good friend (and brilliant artist) Jed Jones! Together, we spent a whole year sparing no expense to hire the best musicians, record at the best studio, and secure the best mixing and world-class mastering. I got the masters back in March 2019. And honestly, that felt like just the beginning!

I’ve spent the last year assembling a brilliant team of visual artists to help me create companion pieces for every single one of my songs.

I’ve spent countless hours building my website to the perfect specs that will allow it to properly and beautifully host this colossal project, taking digital marketing classes, researching the best ways to get all of this incredible audio+visual art to as many people as will love it. I’ve done my very best to leave no stone un-turned—to do my part and more to make sure this body of work has the life it deserves.

The Team, The Impact

This is the part where I need your help! I believe in the value of art. I believe in the power art has to move and change the world. And I’m BEYOND proud of the artists whose careers I’ve personally been able to support thus far with Masks. Can I introduce you to them?

  1. Jed Jones – Producer
  2. Scott Wiley – Owner of June Audio Recording Studios (where Masks was recorded), and world class Mixing Engineer
  3. Matt Young – Drummer, Percussionist, Recording Engineer
  4. Mike Luzecky – Bassist
  5. Kevin Judd – Pianist
  6. Nick Petty – Guitarist
  7. Becky Willard – Producer
  8. Reuben Cohen – Mastering Engineer at Lurssen Mastering
  9. Jen Palmer – Photographer and Editor
  10. Shawna Turner – Hair+Makeup Artist, Wardrobe Stylist
  11. Heggy Gonzalez – Hair+Makeup Artist
  12. Kylie Larkin – Nail Art Designer
  13. Rachel Clark – Hair+Makeup Artist
  14. Lance Lowry – Film Producer
  15. Hoku Curnan – Director of Photography
  16. Madi Bruce – Dancer and Choreographer
  17. Noah Bradford – Dancer
  18. Lily Bruce – Dancer
  19. Jean Pezely - Dancer
  20. Amirah Alhasoun – Dancer
  21. Tessa Blackham – Illustrator and Animator
  22. Abril Castro-Bernal – Illustrator and Graphic Designer
  23. Casey Fredrick – Filmmaker
  24. Aaron Anderson – Drummer
  25. Paul Williams – Illustrator
  26. Savannah Kynaston – Illustrator
  27. Camilla Aubrey – Graphic Designer
  28. Lindsey Deschamps – Animator
  29. Sarah Keele – Illustrator
  30. Jarom Hansen – Producer
  31. Brian Taylor – Screen Printer
  32. Jason Mangelson – Animator and Graphic Designer
  33. Kathie and Andrew Weihanne – Web Designers
  34. McKenna Rees – Soap and Wax Artisan, Owner of Stone River Soaps
  35. Sailaja Prathi – Heat Transfer Printer

Every artist listed above is important and beautiful. And I’m so over-the-moon proud to have paid them all well for the OUTSTANDING work they’ve done for Masks. I consider it one of my greatest accomplishments in my life to support my fellow artists. Please help me continue to support these artists and artists like them by supporting Masks. I promise to continue to create and produce projects that involve as many phenomenal artists as possible.

The Timeline

AND, while Indiegogo cannot guarantee timely delivery of your perks, I CAN! Because this project is finished and ready to go. And I can’t wait for these gorgeous perks to be in your gorgeous hands and inboxes. You’ll have your physical and digital perks by the May 8 release date!

What I Need & What You Get

It’s been difficult for me to come up with a dollar amount, because I’ve invested more of my own funds than I feel comfortable asking for here. And, I really DO feel awesome about supporting so many of my fellow artists with my own funds. But, $8,000 is the number I’ve landed on that would really make it possible for me to keep these mixed-media, collaborative projects coming. If I’m able to raise more than the $8,000 I need, I’ll just make even more content with even more beautiful artists!

To find out more about each perk bundle, click on the box to see all of the details! They’re stacked, so (with a few exceptions) each level includes all of the perks from the lower pledge amounts. These amazing digital and physical items represent thousands of dollars, and hundreds of hours of work from some incredible artists. I am so excited to be able to offer them to you!

Before I tell you more about these PHENOMENAL perks, I want to say: (1) Every donation of any amount means the absolute world to me (2) You don’t need to claim a perk to make a contribution (3) You are OF COURSE welcome to contribute a higher amount than the perk level you’d like to claim (4) If you are not in a position to contribute financially, you can help by sharing the campaign on social media (use the Indiegogo share tools on the top of the page), and in specific texts/emails to people you know would love to be involved. And, you can stream the previously-released singles! Thank you. You so important to me.

LIVE Listening Party Invitation: All backers of any amount are invited to the digital LIVE listening party on Sunday, April 26 – before anyone has heard the album!

Digital Music Download: Starting at pledge level $10, all backers will receive a digital download of the entire Masks album, along with some bonus tracks, and the cover artwork.

Lyric Look-Book Download: Each song from Masks has a visual companion piece made up of one of Jen Palmer’s incredible photos (with styling by Shawna Turner and Heggy Gonzalez) and Camilla Aubrey’s thoughtful graphic design. As you scroll through the digital look-book, you’ll see each of these gorgeous pieces adjacent to their corresponding lyrics. Starting at pledge level $15, all backers will receive a download of the digital look-book. Be sure to listen while you look.

Adult Coloring Book Download: Each and every song from Masks ALSO has a stunning “adult coloring book” page imaginatively and brilliantly crafted by Savannah Kynaston. The pages are intricate, evocative, and dramatically creative. Starting at pledge level $20, all backers will receive a download of all 11 of Savannah’s arresting coloring book pages. Print them out, color while you listen, and send me pictures of your beautiful creations! I can’t wait to see what these sounds and designs inspire in each of you.

Physical CD: Call me old-fashioned, but I love to buy CDs. They’re such a wonderful “souvenirs” of the aural journeys I love so much. Masks is printed on lovely digipak-style fold-outs with four thoughtfully-designed photo+text panels, and a limited edition insert with QR code to bonus content.  Starting at pledge level $25, all backers will receive a physical copy to have and to hold while you listen and enjoy!

Signed CD: Starting at pledge level $30, all backers will receive a copy of Masks, lovingly signed by Yours Truly! I’m notorious for terrible handwriting, but I’ve got my artsy-messy signature DOWN.

3 Signed CDs (Masks, Embark, and Maybe Love): For $40, backers will receive a signed copy of Masks, as well as signed copies of Embark (my debut album of all-original music), and “Maybe Love” (pianist+composer Dan Tate’s wonderful album featuring me on several heart-breaking songs). *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. All three albums come only in this perk bundle, along with all of the previously-described digital perks.

Charts Download: Starting at pledge level $45, all backers will receive a download of the full collection of leadsheets for Masks. Lyrics, melody, and chords for all 10 songs. And, of course, they’re extremely well-formatted. Clean, clean, clean!

Stream and Wear: For $50, backers will receive all four digital downloads, as well as a shirt featuring Paul Williams’s beguiling Masks Muse design. *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. This is for people who prefer not to own physical CDs, but want to listen+look digitally, and want to rock an especially stylish shirt.

Masks Muse Shirt: Starting at pledge level $75, all backers will receive a shirt featuring Paul Williams’s beguiling Masks Muse design, carefully and colorfully packaged by moi, and shipped to your doorstep!

Limited Edition Signed Poster: Starting at pledge level $100, all backers will receive a signed, limited edition poster featuring the un-cropped version of the exquisite Masks cover photo. It’s frame-worthy, honestly.

Gift a Few: This option is for backers who prefer to be shirtless ?, and are the most generous of friends. For $100, you’ll receive 5 signed copies of Masks to gift to your favorite friends. Go you! *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. 5 copies come with this pledge, only.

Limited Edition Pin-Back Buttons: Starting at pledge level $125, all backers will receive three streetwise pin-back buttons, featuring (1) The full-color Flower Crown design (2) The Masks Muse (3) Gil the Greyhound strutting through the big city. Put them on your favorite hats, bags, backpacks, and jackets!

Hardback Printed Lyric Look Book: Starting at pledge level $150, all backers will receive the per-song artwork+lyrics in an elegant, coffee-table-style 11x8” hardback book.

Private Lesson or Chat: For $200, we will schedule a one-on-one, 60-minute voice and/or songwriting lesson (or just a pick-my-brain chat sesh, if you’re not a musician) via google hangout video chat. And, you’ll receive all previously-mentioned physical and digital perks, as well. The lesson will need to be scheduled and completed before the end of 2020. *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. A private lesson is not automatically included in subsequent pledge levels.

Solo Voice+Piano Cover of Your Favorite Song: For $250, I will record a voice+piano version (with video) of a cover song of your choice. And, you’ll receive all previously-mentioned physical and digital perks, as well. Your cover will be in your inbox+ears before the end of 2020. *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. A song-of-your-choice is not automatically included in subsequent pledge levels.

Full Length Interview on Artifice Podcast: This offer is especially designed for art-appreciators whose life paths have lead away from professional pursuance of art. For $300, I will conduct a full interview with you for my podcast, Artifice. We will talk all about your life, your love of art, and your own creative mind. And, of course, you’ll receive all previously-mentioned physical and digital perks, as well. The interview will need to be scheduled and completed before the end of 2020. *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. An interview is not automatically included in subsequent pledge levels.

Lessons Package: For $500, we will schedule three one-on-one, 60-minute voice and/or songwriting lessons via google hangout video chat. And, you’ll receive all previously-mentioned physical and digital perks, as well. The lessons will need to be scheduled and completed before the end of 2020. *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. The lesson bundle is not automatically included in subsequent pledge levels.

Duo House Show: For $1000, Emily will come to your house with either a guitarist or pianist, and play an intimate acoustic duo show just for you and your friends! Travel expenses + backline not included if you live outside of the SLC area. The show will need to be scheduled (and necessary travel+backline booked) before the end of 2020.

Full Band House Show: For $3500, Emily and full band (keys, guitar, bass, and drums) will come to your house and play a dynamic show just for you and your friends! Travel expenses + backline not included if you live outside of the SLC area. The show will need to be scheduled (and necessary travel+backline booked) before the end of 2020.

Other Ways You Can Help

Regardless of whether you can contribute financially, you can help by sharing the campaign on social media (use the Indiegogo share tools on the top of the page), and in specific texts/emails to people you know would love to be involved. And, you can stream the previously-released singles!

Thank You!

From the bottom of my heart, THANK YOU! I can't wait for all of this art to reach your eyes and ears.

It’s true, this project is already finished! In that way, this is a non-traditional crowdfunding campaign, and more of a pre-order campaign. It’s my hope that you will take this as a show of how committed I am to this project, to my music. It is also my hope, that you’ll take to heart the idea that crowdfunding is “the new record deal,” and that your support here will make it possible for me to keep creating amazing new music (and funding incredible visual art) in the future! 

The Backstory...
Five years ago, I started to feel some big ideas brewing in my mind and body. I was beginning to face the truth of my mom’s personality disorder, my misconceptions about what my potential could be as an individual (and particularly, as a woman), and the many-layered facades of the institutions of power that held up my world.
I felt that nothing was what it seemed.
So, I began writing on the theme of masks. Masks that conceal and manipulate. Masks that protect. Masks that reveal, filter, focus, or magnify a specific self. Provisional masks. Playful masks. Beautiful masks. Terrifying masks. I believe these are essentially and ubiquitously human concepts and experiences. And I’ve done my very best to represent as many facets of these themes as possible with this collection of songs, all original. I know you’ll see your life experience reflected in this music, and in these lyrics.
Read more on Masks >>> 


The Process
Once the collection of songs was completed, I searched around for the perfect producer, and found my now good friend (and brilliant artist) Jed Jones! Together, we spent a whole year sparing no expense to hire the best musicians, record at the best studio, and secure the best mixing and world-class mastering. I got the masters back in March 2019. And honestly, that felt like just the beginning!
I’ve spent the last year assembling a brilliant team of visual artists to help me create companion pieces for every single one of my songs.
I’ve spent countless hours building my website to the perfect specs that will allow it to properly and beautifully host this colossal project, taking digital marketing classes, researching the best ways to get all of this incredible audio+visual art to as many people as will love it. I’ve done my very best to leave no stone un-turned—to do my part and more to make sure this body of work has the life it deserves.


The Team, The Impact
This is the part where I need your help! I believe in the value of art. I believe in the power art has to move and change the world. And I’m BEYOND proud of the artists whose careers I’ve personally been able to support thus far with Masks. Can I introduce you to them?

Jed Jones – Producer
Scott Wiley – Owner of June Audio Recording Studios (where Masks was recorded), and world class Mixing Engineer
Matt Young – Drummer, Percussionist, Recording Engineer
Mike Luzecky – Bassist
Kevin Judd – Pianist
Nick Petty – Guitarist
Becky Willard – Producer
Reuben Cohen – Mastering Engineer at Lurssen Mastering
Jen Palmer – Photographer and Editor
Shawna Turner – Hair+Makeup Artist, Wardrobe Stylist
Heggy Gonzalez – Hair+Makeup Artist
Kylie Larkin – Nail Art Designer
Rachel Clark – Hair+Makeup Artist
Lance Lowry – Film Producer
Hoku Curnan – Director of Photography
Madi Bruce – Dancer and Choreographer
Noah Bradford – Dancer
Lily Bruce – Dancer
Jean Pezely - Dancer
Amirah Alhasoun – Dancer
Tessa Blackham – Illustrator and Animator
Abril Castro-Bernal – Illustrator and Graphic Designer
Casey Fredrick – Filmmaker
Aaron Anderson – Drummer
Paul Williams – Illustrator
Savannah Kynaston – Illustrator
Camilla Aubrey – Graphic Designer
Lindsey Deschamps – Animator
Sarah Keele – Illustrator
Jarom Hansen – Producer
Brian Taylor – Screen Printer
Jason Mangelson – Animator and Graphic Designer
Kathie and Andrew Weihanne – Web Designers
McKenna Rees – Soap and Wax Artisan, Owner of Stone River Soaps
Sailaja Prathi – Heat Transfer Printer

Every artist listed above is important and beautiful. And I’m so over-the-moon proud to have paid them all well for the OUTSTANDING work they’ve done for Masks. I consider it one of my greatest accomplishments in my life to support my fellow artists. Please help me continue to support these artists and artists like them by supporting Masks. I promise to continue to create and produce projects that involve as many phenomenal artists as possible.
The Timeline
AND, while Indiegogo cannot guarantee timely delivery of your perks, I CAN! Because this project is finished and ready to go. And I can’t wait for these gorgeous perks to be in your gorgeous hands and inboxes. You’ll have your physical and digital perks by the May 8 release date!

What I Need & What You Get
It’s been difficult for me to come up with a dollar amount, because I’ve invested more of my own funds than I feel comfortable asking for here. And, I really DO feel awesome about supporting so many of my fellow artists with my own funds. But, $8,000 is the number I’ve landed on that would really make it possible for me to keep these mixed-media, collaborative projects coming. If I’m able to raise more than the $8,000 I need, I’ll just make even more content with even more beautiful artists!
To find out more about each perk bundle, click on the box to see all of the details! They’re stacked, so (with a few exceptions) each level includes all of the perks from the lower pledge amounts. These amazing digital and physical items represent thousands of dollars, and hundreds of hours of work from some incredible artists. I am so excited to be able to offer them to you!
Before I tell you more about these PHENOMENAL perks, I want to say: (1) Every donation of any amount means the absolute world to me (2) You don’t need to claim a perk to make a contribution (3) You are OF COURSE welcome to contribute a higher amount than the perk level you’d like to claim (4) If you are not in a position to contribute financially, you can help by sharing the campaign on social media (use the Indiegogo share tools on the top of the page), and in specific texts/emails to people you know would love to be involved. And, you can stream the previously-released singles! Thank you. You so important to me.
LIVE Listening Party Invitation: All backers of any amount are invited to the digital LIVE listening party on Sunday, April 26 – before anyone has heard the album!
Digital Music Download: Starting at pledge level $10, all backers will receive a digital download of the entire Masks album, along with some bonus tracks, and the cover artwork.
Lyric Look-Book Download: Each song from Masks has a visual companion piece made up of one of Jen Palmer’s incredible photos (with styling by Shawna Turner and Heggy Gonzalez) and Camilla Aubrey’s thoughtful graphic design. As you scroll through the digital look-book, you’ll see each of these gorgeous pieces adjacent to their corresponding lyrics. Starting at pledge level $15, all backers will receive a download of the digital look-book. Be sure to listen while you look.


Adult Coloring Book Download: Each and every song from Masks ALSO has a stunning “adult coloring book” page imaginatively and brilliantly crafted by Savannah Kynaston. The pages are intricate, evocative, and dramatically creative. Starting at pledge level $20, all backers will receive a download of all 11 of Savannah’s arresting coloring book pages. Print them out, color while you listen, and send me pictures of your beautiful creations! I can’t wait to see what these sounds and designs inspire in each of you.

Physical CD: Call me old-fashioned, but I love to buy CDs. They’re such a wonderful “souvenirs” of the aural journeys I love so much. Masks is printed on lovely digipak-style fold-outs with four thoughtfully-designed photo+text panels, and a limited edition insert with QR code to bonus content.  Starting at pledge level $25, all backers will receive a physical copy to have and to hold while you listen and enjoy!
Signed CD: Starting at pledge level $30, all backers will receive a copy of Masks, lovingly signed by Yours Truly! I’m notorious for terrible handwriting, but I’ve got my artsy-messy signature DOWN.
3 Signed CDs (Masks, Embark, and Maybe Love): For $40, backers will receive a signed copy of Masks, as well as signed copies of Embark (my debut album of all-original music), and “Maybe Love” (pianist+composer Dan Tate’s wonderful album featuring me on several heart-breaking songs). *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. All three albums come only in this perk bundle, along with all of the previously-described digital perks.
Charts Download: Starting at pledge level $45, all backers will receive a download of the full collection of leadsheets for Masks. Lyrics, melody, and chords for all 10 songs. And, of course, they’re extremely well-formatted. Clean, clean, clean!

Stream and Wear: For $50, backers will receive all four digital downloads, as well as a shirt featuring Paul Williams’s beguiling Masks Muse design. *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. This is for people who prefer not to own physical CDs, but want to listen+look digitally, and want to rock an especially stylish shirt.
Masks Muse Shirt: Starting at pledge level $75, all backers will receive a shirt featuring Paul Williams’s beguiling Masks Muse design, carefully and colorfully packaged by moi, and shipped to your doorstep!

Limited Edition Signed Poster: Starting at pledge level $100, all backers will receive a signed, limited edition poster featuring the un-cropped version of the exquisite Masks cover photo. It’s frame-worthy, honestly.

Gift a Few: This option is for backers who prefer to be shirtless ?, and are the most generous of friends. For $100, you’ll receive 5 signed copies of Masks to gift to your favorite friends. Go you! *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. 5 copies come with this pledge, only.
Limited Edition Pin-Back Buttons: Starting at pledge level $125, all backers will receive three streetwise pin-back buttons, featuring (1) The full-color Flower Crown design (2) The Masks Muse (3) Gil the Greyhound strutting through the big city. Put them on your favorite hats, bags, backpacks, and jackets!


Hardback Printed Lyric Look Book: Starting at pledge level $150, all backers will receive the per-song artwork+lyrics in an elegant, coffee-table-style 11x8” hardback book.


Private Lesson or Chat: For $200, we will schedule a one-on-one, 60-minute voice and/or songwriting lesson (or just a pick-my-brain chat sesh, if you’re not a musician) via google hangout video chat. And, you’ll receive all previously-mentioned physical and digital perks, as well. The lesson will need to be scheduled and completed before the end of 2020. *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. A private lesson is not automatically included in subsequent pledge levels.
Solo Voice+Piano Cover of Your Favorite Song: For $250, I will record a voice+piano version (with video) of a cover song of your choice. And, you’ll receive all previously-mentioned physical and digital perks, as well. Your cover will be in your inbox+ears before the end of 2020. *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. A song-of-your-choice is not automatically included in subsequent pledge levels.


Full Length Interview on Artifice Podcast: This offer is especially designed for art-appreciators whose life paths have lead away from professional pursuance of art. For $300, I will conduct a full interview with you for my podcast, Artifice. We will talk all about your life, your love of art, and your own creative mind. And, of course, you’ll receive all previously-mentioned physical and digital perks, as well. The interview will need to be scheduled and completed before the end of 2020. *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. An interview is not automatically included in subsequent pledge levels.
Lessons Package: For $500, we will schedule three one-on-one, 60-minute voice and/or songwriting lessons via google hangout video chat. And, you’ll receive all previously-mentioned physical and digital perks, as well. The lessons will need to be scheduled and completed before the end of 2020. *NOTE: This is not a “stacked” offer. The lesson bundle is not automatically included in subsequent pledge levels.
Duo House Show: For $1000, Emily will come to your house with either a guitarist or pianist, and play an intimate acoustic duo show just for you and your friends! Travel expenses + backline not included if you live outside of the SLC area. The show will need to be scheduled (and necessary travel+backline booked) before the end of 2020.

Full Band House Show: For $3500, Emily and full band (keys, guitar, bass, and drums) will come to your house and play a dynamic show just for you and your friends! Travel expenses + backline not included if you live outside of the SLC area. The show will need to be scheduled (and necessary travel+backline booked) before the end of 2020.

Other Ways You Can Help

Regardless of whether you can contribute financially, you can help by sharing the campaign on social media (use the Indiegogo share tools on the top of the page), and in specific texts/emails to people you know would love to be involved. And, you can stream the previously-released singles!
Thank You!
From the bottom of my heart, THANK YOU! I can't wait for all of this art to reach your eyes and ears.

story:
Short Summary

Brooklyn-based SUNDUB, an inventively collaborative mix of New York City musicians, has been offering its classic reggae repertoire peppered with soul and funk selections almost weekly since 2013. Anchored by a core quintet—Finnegan Singer (guitar), Josh T Carter (bass), Eric "The General" Toussaint (vocals-key) and the brother-sister team of Joanna (lead vocals) and Ben Teters (vocals-drums)—many of SUNDUB’s stellar and frequent collaborators have come together for its first production of original music, "Burden of Love." The album features reggae royalty Ruff Scott, The Chronic Horns (Easy Star All-Stars), Larry McDonald (Lee Scratch Perry, Gil Scott-Heron) and is mixed and co-produced by Sidney Mills (Steel Pulse). They lend their talents to Joanna Teters' commanding and soulfully smoky lead vocals and blend seamlessly with the super tight arrangements of the SUNDUB rhythm section. The result is a stand out expression of reggae’s classic undulating pulse and lush subterranean grooves, reinvented for listeners of all times and genres.

What We Need & What You Get

We are turning to you, our community, to ask for help in funding this record. This independent group has been playing gigs all over the city to raise money for the required studio time, musicians, engineers, and mixing and mastering services,  putting every cent that we earn into this project. But in order to finish this record and get it into the hands of the people, we need to raise extra funds to cover the costs of distribution, artwork and merchandise. This all-star team of musicians has put together a great list of perks below for you to choose from -- options ranging anywhere from digital downloads, to a private BBQ with the band, to bringing SUNDUB to perform at your event or party!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, there are still ways for you to get involved with the SUNDUB movement:

  • Share this link with your friends and family encouraging them to donate!
  • Stream our single "Burden of Love" on your preferred platform and add it to your playlists, play it for friends, even put it on while you sleep!
  • Come see us perform! Head over to our website www.sundubmusic.com for show dates.

We appreciate you, we love you and we can't wait to share this record with you! 

Joanna, Ben, Finn, Eric & Josh

story:
The New Album by All Waffle Trick: A Healthy Serving of Pop-Punk and Ska

All Waffle Trick is serving up their new album in 2019, and it’s set to be a nutritious pop-punk breakfast treat.

In a world… where brunch and punk are two of the only remaining freedoms left… A band called All Waffle Trick is working on overdrive to serve up humanity a healthy portion of both.

WHO ARE ALL WAFFLE TRICK?
Jeff Giles – Guitar and vocals.
Alex “Curly” Mark – Drums and vocals.
James Battraw – Bass and vocals.


“We’re just a few smartass nerds that are here to play music, have some drinks and have some fun. Anything above and beyond that is a bonus.”
All Waffle Trick are a brunch-themed punk band from Denver, Colorado that claims to have no political agenda other than to party.
Their infectious strain of music combines the best elements of the ska-punk and pop-punk genres, influenced equally as much by Rancid as they are by Blink 182.
They have performed alongside an impressive list of touring acts (both national and international) such as The Bouncing Souls, Authority Zero, Mustard Plug, and Be Like Max, dishing out their hardcore party tunes to a growing fan base who are hungry for more!
Their 2015 full-length album Part Of A Complete Breakfast and 2018’s single release What A Way To Spend A Night are being followed up by a new album due for release this year!

ABOUT THIS PROJECT
All Waffle Trick started recording of their new album in April of this year and have been hard at work ever since, funding their project out of their own pockets. A lot of exciting progress has been made towards the finished album, but the band fund has run dry before the recording has been completed, and they still need the album mixed and mastered after that.
Now they are reaching out to punks, nerds, party animals, true believers and music fans throughout the worldwide web to ask:
“Are you ready to make this thing explosive?”

The goal has been set for $2000, which will allow for recording, mixing and mastering to be achieved. Any funds raised beyond that amount will go towards unexpected production costs, pressing the album on vinyl, and future tours.
If you choose to jump on board with this project, there are some super cool backer rewards to choose from, and you will be a part of bringing some badass music into the world. Any contributions make an impact!

story:
Some of the finest singers of protest and folk music that I have ever heard...One of the Best Albums of 2017! " 

-SingOut! Magazine

UPDATE: Four bonus tracks have been added!! Song on the Times now has 11 songs

Song on the Times, is filled with the characteristic rich harmonies, powerful singing, and innovative arrangements that Windborne is known for.  We have worked with a visual artist to create beautifully illustrated wordsheets and sheet music for each song, making the movement we draw on come alive on the page.  The book serves as the package for a CD or a digital download, bringing together music, word craft, history, and visual images in a beautiful piece of art which we hope you will love as much as we do. We have some amazing activists, artists, scholars, and performers who are writing about our songs, including Eliza Carthy, Saro Lynch-Thomason, Brian O'Donovan, and Tony Barrand!

It takes a community!

What started as a songbook has become a nationwide community of singers! We have a bunch of costs involved in making Song on the Times, including studio time and editing with our awesome audio engineer Alan Stockwell; mixing and mastering the tracks; producing the CDs; commissioning original artwork from some incredible artists; promotion, printing, and of course shipping out rewards to you! Due to the incredible outpouring of support, we have upgraded the books to be professionally printed!

We need your help!

Music powers social movements, and we are excited to be singing these songs for new struggles.
Now we need your help to spread this music and message! Donate what you can and get some awesome rewards, share our project with your friends, family, and communities! There are many great perks for you to chose, so check them out. Shipping is free in the US!

Other ways you can help

Share the campaign! Tell your friends! Sing the songs! Leave us a comment!
We believe that singing can bring communities together, and singing songs of political resistance is as important in the years to come as it was when these songs were written. If your singing buddies, choir, community action group, or other organization is interested in bulk ordering SONG ON THE TIMES, becoming a distributor, or sponsoring the project, please let us know. 


Thank you so much for your support, keep fighting the good fights, and keep singing the good songs!


Love,
Windborne
Lauren Breunig, Jeremy Carter-Gordon, Lynn Rowan, Will Rowan

story:
Short Summary

Ever since Evan Moses' first performance on his streetcorner in Georgetown early on in the Pandemic, our band has been continually amazed by the great response from community members, music fans, and passersby. 

Our weekend shows quickly grew and relocated to Rose Park, in Georgetown, and we were humbled by the number of recurring fans and community members who continually came out on Saturday nights to enjoy live performances and work with us to raise awareness of the issues facing performers, sound technicians, venues and service industry workers who are hurting due to COVID-19 related closures.

Our ability to work with local artists and put on shows was dependent on the equipment and technical skills of Aaron Miller from Gold Pants Rentals, who provided us with a lot of the hardware required to put on shows.  Unfortunately, Aaron is moving on to greener pastures, and we are left without the tools we need to resume our weekly shows this Spring. Without Aaron, and without the shows, we can't pay our sound folks, pay our guest musicians, or donate to any local causes in need of support, as we've done in the past. 

This is how you can help -- 

What We Need & What You Get

Rock Creek Kings need funding to enable us to resume our Rose Park Concert Series this Spring.  Our primary goal is to ensure we can resume our shows and give the community the performances they came to expect last April through November, which includes paying our sound engineers and guest artists for their valuable time and efforts. We'd also like to purchase equipment sufficient to replace the gear Aaron Miller was renting to us, and build out our show capacity so that we can safely play to similar, if not larger, audiences, with better quality performances.

The graphic below shows what we will be able to afford depending on how much is raised: 

The Perks!

Our focus is on being able to perform, which is the 'perk' that everyone will be able to enjoy. Since our objective is to raise funds to permit the shows to resume, we're trying to keep most of the money available for that purpose (equipment is expensive and sound professionals can, and should, be well paid!)  

For those that are going above and beyond to help us, we designed special edition masks and t-shirts and we hope that you wear them to the shows.  For the higher end of donations, we also have song requests and private performances available! If you're eligible for a song request, your best bet is to choose a band you love rather than a song itself, because that way we can find a song from the artist that matches our style, and you can get the best performance from us. However, if you really love a song and want us to play it, we'll make it happen (subject to our ultimate approval - but we promise to be reasonable!). ​

The private performances will also be subject to reasonable COVID-related restrictions. Hopefully we will be able to deliver them in person over the summer for your private event, but its possible that they will have to be online if you can't wait until we're all vaccinated! If you're having an outdoor event this summer, we can perform in masks if there is reasonable space. 

Finally, if you have any ideas for other perks you think would be perfect for our campaign, don't be shy! Let us know and we can find a way to integrate your idea.  

The Impact

 

 

Putting on the shows in Rose Park (and earlier in the year on Dumbarton Corner) was easily the most rewarding part of our year. After every show, without fail, someone would come up to us and explain how they have been stuck inside and that the shows were a lifesaver! We were blown away week after week and it kept us motivated.  Putting on the shows definitely wasn't easy but it was a labor of love. We were loading up our cars with tons of heavy gear at 5, arriving around 6PM to set up and we were always right up against the clock to get everything ready to start at 7. We would have the time of our lives jamming from 7 to 9 and then take down all the gear, load it back up in our cars, and then finally load everything into Evan Moses' house. 

However, your feedback and support made it all worth it.  The community always found a way to let us know we were supported! We got cards in the mail and messages to our Instagram week after week.

We put on over fifteen shows in the park last year and two were direct fundraisers for local charitable causes.  This spring and summer, we pledge to run at least four shows directly fundraising for local causes. An early favorite for the beneficiaries would be the survival funds for the staff of the Pie Shop, Black Cat, and other venues, but we're open to ideas!

From A Health and Safety Perspective 

There are some risks that everyone should be aware of. From a health and safety perspective, the COVID-19 pandemic remains the number one risk. We are extremely proud of our record last year, where as far as we are aware, not a single COVID-19 spread occurred at our outdoor shows. We think that can be accredited to the combination of a pro-mask culture we all fostered together; the band by performing in masks and the community by vigilantly wearing them and distancing from other groups.  When you come to a show, we ask that you help to continue to set an example and wear a mask, even if it is outdoors and you're just with your quarantine circle.

From a show perspective, one risk that everyone should be aware of is that our ability to perform depends on our ability to maintain our National Parks First Amendment Assembly Permits. However, we established a strong working relationship with the Permits Office over the past year and from our communications with them, we have every reason to believe that the positive partnership between us will continue to grow!

Ways You Can Help

Here are ways you can help make our campaign and our shows a success: 

  • Spread the word (use the Indiegogo share tools!)
  • Recommend a sound engineer or act in need of a gig!
  • Connect us with a venue or equipment shop that would like to work with us!
  • Donate (=

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Ever since Evan Moses' first performance on his streetcorner in Georgetown early on in the Pandemic, our band has been continually amazed by the great response from community members, music fans, and passersby. 
Our weekend shows quickly grew and relocated to Rose Park, in Georgetown, and we were humbled by the number of recurring fans and community members who continually came out on Saturday nights to enjoy live performances and work with us to raise awareness of the issues facing performers, sound technicians, venues and service industry workers who are hurting due to COVID-19 related closures.
Our ability to work with local artists and put on shows was dependent on the equipment and technical skills of Aaron Miller from Gold Pants Rentals, who provided us with a lot of the hardware required to put on shows.  Unfortunately, Aaron is moving on to greener pastures, and we are left without the tools we need to resume our weekly shows this Spring. Without Aaron, and without the shows, we can't pay our sound folks, pay our guest musicians, or donate to any local causes in need of support, as we've done in the past. 
This is how you can help -- 

What We Need & What You Get
Rock Creek Kings need funding to enable us to resume our Rose Park Concert Series this Spring.  Our primary goal is to ensure we can resume our shows and give the community the performances they came to expect last April through November, which includes paying our sound engineers and guest artists for their valuable time and efforts. We'd also like to purchase equipment sufficient to replace the gear Aaron Miller was renting to us, and build out our show capacity so that we can safely play to similar, if not larger, audiences, with better quality performances.
The graphic below shows what we will be able to afford depending on how much is raised: 

The Perks!
Our focus is on being able to perform, which is the 'perk' that everyone will be able to enjoy. Since our objective is to raise funds to permit the shows to resume, we're trying to keep most of the money available for that purpose (equipment is expensive and sound professionals can, and should, be well paid!)  
For those that are going above and beyond to help us, we designed special edition masks and t-shirts and we hope that you wear them to the shows.  For the higher end of donations, we also have song requests and private performances available! If you're eligible for a song request, your best bet is to choose a band you love rather than a song itself, because that way we can find a song from the artist that matches our style, and you can get the best performance from us. However, if you really love a song and want us to play it, we'll make it happen (subject to our ultimate approval - but we promise to be reasonable!). ​
The private performances will also be subject to reasonable COVID-related restrictions. Hopefully we will be able to deliver them in person over the summer for your private event, but its possible that they will have to be online if you can't wait until we're all vaccinated! If you're having an outdoor event this summer, we can perform in masks if there is reasonable space. 
Finally, if you have any ideas for other perks you think would be perfect for our campaign, don't be shy! Let us know and we can find a way to integrate your idea.  

The Impact

 
 

Putting on the shows in Rose Park (and earlier in the year on Dumbarton Corner) was easily the most rewarding part of our year. After every show, without fail, someone would come up to us and explain how they have been stuck inside and that the shows were a lifesaver! We were blown away week after week and it kept us motivated.  Putting on the shows definitely wasn't easy but it was a labor of love. We were loading up our cars with tons of heavy gear at 5, arriving around 6PM to set up and we were always right up against the clock to get everything ready to start at 7. We would have the time of our lives jamming from 7 to 9 and then take down all the gear, load it back up in our cars, and then finally load everything into Evan Moses' house. 
However, your feedback and support made it all worth it.  The community always found a way to let us know we were supported! We got cards in the mail and messages to our Instagram week after week.
We put on over fifteen shows in the park last year and two were direct fundraisers for local charitable causes.  This spring and summer, we pledge to run at least four shows directly fundraising for local causes. An early favorite for the beneficiaries would be the survival funds for the staff of the Pie Shop, Black Cat, and other venues, but we're open to ideas!

From A Health and Safety Perspective 
There are some risks that everyone should be aware of. From a health and safety perspective, the COVID-19 pandemic remains the number one risk. We are extremely proud of our record last year, where as far as we are aware, not a single COVID-19 spread occurred at our outdoor shows. We think that can be accredited to the combination of a pro-mask culture we all fostered together; the band by performing in masks and the community by vigilantly wearing them and distancing from other groups.  When you come to a show, we ask that you help to continue to set an example and wear a mask, even if it is outdoors and you're just with your quarantine circle.
From a show perspective, one risk that everyone should be aware of is that our ability to perform depends on our ability to maintain our National Parks First Amendment Assembly Permits. However, we established a strong working relationship with the Permits Office over the past year and from our communications with them, we have every reason to believe that the positive partnership between us will continue to grow!

Ways You Can Help
Here are ways you can help make our campaign and our shows a success: 

Spread the word (use the Indiegogo share tools!)
Recommend a sound engineer or act in need of a gig!
Connect us with a venue or equipment shop that would like to work with us!
Donate (=

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hi! I am appealing to you for the funds to get to Africa! More specifically, I am trying to get to Ghana with a group that's going this summer for education and exposure to our roots. 

Who am "I" exactly?  My name is RAHKUA and I am a creative artist living in Los Angeles, who is passionate about music, health, education, social justice, and LIFE! 

Check out the recently ended campaign: www.igg.me/at/pala1 Reached 46% :)

What am I doing?  Well, I'm raising funds to go on this Africa trip with a group led by Professors James Smalls and Leonard Jefferies out of New York…. I have a tri-fold plan:

  1.  I want to organize a concert to offer my artistic talents and expand my global presence/brand.
  2. I want to experience the culture, livelihood, art, history, scenery etc. that is Ghana. I want to feel that connection to my ancestors that can only be achieved through immersion into the pulse of the motherland. 
  3. I want to lay the foundations for the expansion of this project to eventually offer a FREE educational/cultural voyage to African American Youth in pursuit of heightened consciousness. Think of it almost like the Birthrite Israel program…giving the opportunity to get back to our roots, to experience a cultural immersion and connect with our history...except that we don’t have a group of affluent, socially and culturally conscious millionaires to fund us like Birthrite Israel…So I am extending our appeal to the people! (And hopefully one of those affluent millionaires finds the page haha).

YOUR help is what will make this trip possible. 

Let's talk numbers….and PERKS!

  • I need to raise a little over $5,000. That may sound like a lot (especially if you don't have it!) BUT it is SO doable with YOUR help. $3,846 will cover the travel package in Ghana and around $1,500 will go towards expenses like passports, travel visa, air fare to the meet-up location (New York), travel insurance, per diem while in Africa, and the great perks! So that's a minimum of $5,000 as the base goal and of course it would be AMAZING to raise more to allow for a buffer.
  • I just finished a campaign raising 46% of that base goal amount, and have been doing offline fundraising to reach the goal, so I'm re-launching the campaign to fulfill the rest!
  • There are some pretty awesome PERKS! From speaking to you personally in a 30 min live chat about the trip (and anything else you might want to know) to a DVD of the epic concert, to Project Africa merchandise etc, I'm rolling out great THANK YOU perks to donors…LIKE YOU!
  • YOUR GIFTS CAN BE TAX DEDUCTIBLE!  Project Africa is being sponsored by the 501 c3 status non-profit organization, TIFHAP, in line with it's mission to support the arts and education. (Please consult your financial advisor to determine if your gift is deductible).
  • IF the goal isn't met…NO…let's speak positive energy into this campaign, it WILL happen! (But IF not THIS year, then on next year's voyage) 

The Impact

It's hard for some people to imagine leaving their neighborhood, city, or state….let alone their country and continent! We are embarking on a very ambitious journey that will impact the REST OF OUR LIVES.  It's crazy to think that just a $25 donation from you could impact someone's entire life, but it's SO true. And not only will we get the benefit of the amazing experience, and YOU get the benefit of great gifts and feelings of gratitude, but also the Ghanaian people will get an amazing concert and we'll hopefully be establishing some lifelong connections and changing lives through interpersonal interaction and CARE.

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE! RETWEET! LIKE! REPOST! REGRAM! EMAIL! CALL PEOPLE! ETC. ETC.

 

There are SO many ways that you can help. I understand not everyone will be able to give a monetary donation (and that some donors would love to extend their help beyond the funds) so can't stress enough how important non-monetary donations are as well. Because your TIME and FAITH in this cause is just as valuable. 

So please… SPREAD THE WORD! 

IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO BE A SPONSOR please email:

ProjectAfricaLA@gmail.com

story:
Friends, family and fans—the time has come for me to record my first album!! You probably already know that I sing 24/7—in the shower, in the car, in embarrassing public places, in your face (I’m sorry) and most recently on my church’s worship team. I’ve been relentlessly writing songs through the past few years, and now I’M MAKING MY DREAM A REALITY by recording my first album—Woohoo!!

How You Can Help

I will be recording my first EP (demo CD) in just 19 DAYS through Emissary Studios. I’m planning on releasing 5 original songs that I hope you will love! (Maybe a 6th one if we raise enough!)

The cost of this project is $5,000 which is a great price in this industry...but quite a lot for me. I have saved $2,500 of my own money, but I’d love your help funding the last $2,500. This will go towards paying for recording time, production, musicians, mixing and mastering--i.e. making it sound legit and amazing.

I am so excited this is happening, and I’ve been working hard on making these songs awesome, but I NEED YOUR HELP to make this a reality! I’ve started with a goal of just $1,000 by recording time (June 20th) to get the ball rolling. Will you help me reach this goal in 19 days!?

My Story

A few years ago I became ill with an autoimmune condition, and I could barely get out of bed. I became very depressed, but right in the midst of that God put songs into my heart and they starting pouring out on paper. I had always been a singer, but songwriting became my outlet and truly saved my life in those dark days. 

I continued to write like crazy and sing like always, and I got the opportunity to record a cover when I was in Zimbabwe last summer:  https://soundcloud.com/dannoj44/ed-sheeran-the-fault-in-our-stars-cover-daniel-jenkins-and-kymberly-murray

Currently, I get to sing with the Church Experience worship band which I am loving!

We all know what it is like to hear a song that connects with us in a deep way. My hope in creating music is to connect with you and that you will feel something--inspired, thoughtful, carefree, strong, not alone, more alive.

I can't wait to get in the studio and bring these songs to life!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, I still would love your help!

  • Help me get the word out by sharing it with your friends!! Via Facebook, text, email, Instagram, Twitter, carrier pigeon, whatever! You can use the share button right on my page.
  • Buy my CD when it comes out!

Thank you to everyone who has supported my singing and songwriting through the years! You have given me the confidence to pursue my dream. :)

story:
English will follow...

Je m'appelle Théa, je suis étudiante en éducation spécialisée au Cégep du Vieux Montréal et j'accompagne Marven qui est membre de l'AMDI (association de Montréal pour la déficience intellectuelle) pour faire un voyage humanitaire au Nicaragua de deux semaines en Janvier 2016. Nous sommes six étudiants et six membres de l'AMDI et les étudiants ont pour rôle de soutenir les membres de l'AMDI dans cette expérience magnifique lors de leur troisième stage en éducation spécialisée au Cégep du Vieux Montréal. Nous sommes également en partenariat avec l'organisme Mer et monde qui nous donnent de superbes formations complètes sur le Nicaragua et qui nous accompagnent sur place. Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour amasser les fonds qui nous permettront de faire cette expérience incroyable de dépassement personnel. Les fonds serviront à payer le billet d'avion, payer le montant versé pour la famille qui nous accueille, payer notre formation avec mer et monde et payer les accompagnateurs de l'AMDI. En donnant pour cette cause, vous contribuerez au dépassement de soi d'une personne ayant une déficience intellectuelle et à l'aide que l'on peut apporter à notre projet humanitaire venant en aide à une communauté pauvre au Nicaragua.

Nous avons tous choisi de nous jumeler avec la personne qui nous convenait le mieux. Moi et Marven sommes des artistes, alors le contact s'est fait assez rapidement. Il m'a demandé si je voulais être avec lui et j'ai dit OUI! Nous sommes deux personnes vraiment apaisantes et agréables à être avec. Nous adorons passer du temps ensemble, vous pouvez le voir dans nos photos. Nous faisons toutes sortes d'activités ensemble pour apprendre à se connaître avant de partir pour le Nicaragua comme apprendre l'Espagnol, visiter des musés, faire de l'art, se promener à Montréal, etc. Nous nous rencontrons également en groupe pour discuter de nos projets à venir et pour faire des levées de fond. Nous devons tisser un lien vraiment fort, car nous allons vivre une expérience très émouvante au Nicaragua où il y aura beaucoup d'insectes et où les coqs chanteront très tôt le matin chez une famille que nous ne connaissons pas encore, mais qui nous accueillera comme leur propre famille. Nous nous lèverons très tôt le matin pour aller travailler sur notre futur projet humanitaire dont nous ne connaissons pas encore les détails.

Nous vous tiendrons au courant!

Théa -

 Le stage au Nicaragua pour moi c'est une aventure hors du commun qui nous fait sortir de nos zones de confort, autant les étudiants que les membres de l'Amdi. C'est un stage qui me permet de me dépasser intrinsèquement et de partager cette expérience avec des gens tout aussi uniques et merveilleux les uns et les autres. En plus d'aider des gens ayant certaines difficultés, on s'aide soi-même, car on dépasse les limites que nous nous donnons chaque jour en prenant un envol vers l'inconnu. Je suis vraiment enthousiasmée par cette expérience qui permettra de faire découvrir aux gens des parties encore inconnus de la déficience intellectuelle qui ne demandent qu'à être dévoilées et de la pauvreté dans un pays qui a besoin de soutien.

Marven -

Le stage au Nicaragua pour moi c'est de se donner le défi de partir dans une nouvelle aventure, parce que c'est la première fois que je voyage et socialiser avec une nouvelle culture... ça va être une belle expérience !

Merci de nous aider à concrétiser ce projet merveilleux.

English

My name is Théa, I'm from Montreal Canada and I am a student in specialized education in Cégep du vieux Montreal and I accompany Marven who is a member of the AMDI (association of Montreal for the intellectual deficiency) to make a humanitarian journey in Nicaragua. We are six students and six members of the AMDI and the students have for role to support the members of the AMDI in this magnificent experience during their third training course in specialized education in Cégep du Vieux Montreal. We are also in partnership with the organism Mer et monde who give us magnificent complete training onto Nicaragua and which accompany us on the spot. We need your help to raise the funds which will allow us to make this incredible experience of personal overtaking. Funds will serve to pay the plane ticket, to pay the amount for the family which welcomes us, to pay our formation with Mer et monde and to pay the guides of the AMDI. By giving for this cause, you will contribute to change the life of of a person having an intellectual deficiency and you will contribute for the help which we can bring to our humanitarian project helping a poor community in Nicaragua.

We all chose to couple us with the person who suited us best. Me and Marven are artists, so the contact was rather quickly made. He asked me if I wanted to be with him and I said YES! We are two people really soothing and pleasant to be with. We adore spending time together, you can see it in our photos. We make any sorts of activities together to learn to know each other before leaving for Nicaragua as learning Spanish, visiting museum, making some art, walking in Montreal, etc. We also meet in a group to discuss our projects to come and to make thorough levyings. We have to weave a really strong link because we are going to live a very moving experience in Nicaragua where there will be many insects and where cocks will sing very early in the morning in a village with a family that we do not still know, but who will welcome us as their own family. We will get up very early in the morning to go to work on our future humanitarian project details of which we do not still know.

Théa :

The training course in Nicaragua for me it is an outstanding adventure which makes us go out of our zones of comfort, as much the students as the members of the Amdi. It is a training course which allows me to surpass myself intrinsically and to share this experience with people so unique and wonderful. Besides helping people having certain difficulties, we work on ourselves because we exceed the limits we give ourselves every day by taking off towards the unknown. I am really enthused by this experience which will allow me to make people discover the still unknown parts of the intellectual deficiency which only wait to be revealed and of the poverty in a country which needs support.

Marven :

The training course in Nicaragua for me it is to give me the challenge to go in a new adventure because it is the first time I'm travelling and to socialize with a new culture. That is going to be a beautiful experience!

Thank you for helping usto concretethis wonderful project

of personal overtaking. Funds will serve to pay the plane ticket, to pay
