formation with Mer et monde and to pay the guides of the AMDI. By giving for this cause, you will 
contribute to change the life of of a person having an intellectual 
deficiency and you will contribute for the help which we can bring to our humanitarian 
project helping a poor community in Nicaragua.We all chose to couple us with the person who suited us best. Me and Marven
 are artists, so the contact was rather quickly made. He asked me if I 
wanted to be with him and I said YES! We are two people really soothing 
and pleasant to be with. We adore spending time together, you can see it
 in our photos. We make any sorts of activities together to learn to 
know each other before leaving for Nicaragua as learning Spanish, visiting museum, making some art, walking in Montreal, etc. We also meet in a group to discuss our projects to come and to make thorough levyings. We have to weave a really strong link because we are going to live a very moving experience in Nicaragua where there will be many insects and where cocks will sing very early in the morning in a village with a family that we do not still know, but who will welcome us as their own family. We will get up very early in the morning to go to work on our future humanitarian project details of which we do not still know.Théa :The training course in Nicaragua for me it is an outstanding 
adventure which makes us go out of our zones of comfort, as much the 
students as the members of the Amdi. It is a training
 course which allows me to surpass myself intrinsically and to share 
this experience with people so unique and wonderful. Besides helping 
people having certain difficulties, we work on ourselves because we exceed the limits we give
 ourselves every day by taking off towards the unknown. I am really 
enthused by this experience which will allow me to make people discover the
 still unknown parts of the intellectual deficiency which only wait to be revealed and of the poverty in a country which needs support. Marven : The training course in Nicaragua for me it is to give me the challenge to go in a new adventure because it is the first time I'm travelling and to socialize with a new culture. That is going to be a beautiful experience! Thank you for helping usto concretethis wonderful project

story:
The Music Experience – Mentorship/Internship Program

A classroom experience, with the best trainers in their field, where program participants learn not only music industry related skills, but other skills necessary to produce an actual performance. Then they apply what they have learned in working real-life Mandate Project Impact Inc. music production experiences at jazz and gospel concerts, and plays.

VISION: A thriving internationally known music industry hub grown out of the gifts and talents of the urban inner city underrepresented youth; giving rise to an increase of new and young entrepreneurship within the greater San Diego area.

VALUES:

The Whole Person – We foster a mentorship/internship program that addresses mind, body and the essence of who they are.

Discipline and Order – Education is enhanced by a disciplined and orderly environment.  Those in our mentorship/internship program will reflect order in their appearance, as we expect kindness, politeness, respect, and self-discipline.

Excellence - Demonstrated academic achievement is a true basis for community leadership and gaining access to opportunity. Therefore any young person, regardless of their GPA, may participate in our mentorship/ internship program, but we expect high standards of academic achievement and that their grade level will improve. We recruit outstanding professionals to instruct, provide learning tools of the highest quality, and encourage those who are in this program to seek to further their education at the college level, especially those in high school.


What is needed…

With over 27 years mentoring youth and over 35 years in the music industry, the founder and Chairman of the Board of Mandate Project Impact Inc., Leonard J. Thompson III, has embarked on a journey to focus on the youth and young adults in the inner city who have a passion for making the music industry their future. 

Leonard J. Thompson III

“I’m asking everyone who has ever received anything from me…. as a mentor, collaborator, manager, producer, friend, booking agent, co-worker, counselor, minister, musician, family man…whatever the relationship, and all those whom I have not yet met but embrace this vision, to support this nonprofit effort, The Music Experience – Mentorship/Internship Program. I ask that in this, my 50th year on this earth, for you to donate in increments of 5…whether it be $5, $10, $15….$500, $1000, $5,000…  Let’s make the way for this program to flourish, to realize the dream.”


Where your dollars will go…

Training Stations - Equipment and Software

Program Staff

Administrative & Operational Expenses

Expert Trainers

Backpacks & T-Shirts

Transportation

Expanded Facilities Fund


The Impact….

Your contribution will directly impact the lives of inner city youth and the future of entrepreneurship in the music industry!  We focus on practical life skills to develop responsible, educated and caring youth as they learn values, vision, and skills for a fulfilling life; affecting improvement in academic and personal outcomes.

Mandate Project Impact Inc. is a 501(c)(3) organization, incorporated and registered in the state of California in 2014, and based in San Diego, California as a nonprofit collaboration with M.A.N.D.AT.E. Records Inc.

M.A.N.D.A.T.E. Records, Inc. has over 20 years of experience in developing music artists: providing artist management, music production, major event performance opportunities and bookings. M.A.N.D.A.T.E. has been a teaching label; teaching the music business to the young and old alike. The teaching and charitable arm has transitioned over to MPI.

Leonard J Thompson III, Chairman of the Board, a successful businessman, educator and preacher, has served the community of San Diego for over 35 years.

He has been highly recognized for his many contributions in service to the community and mentoring thousands of young people, as well as adults working in educational institutions and the corporate world. Most recently Mr. Thompson was honored with the California State Assembly, California Legislature Certificate of Recognition for “Outstanding African-American Educators Award” for his significant contribution to the academic and personal success of the students in the city of San Diego.


Others behind MPI:

Wendy J. Bauer, Board Treasurer/Secretary has a wealth of experience required to run a creative operation, specializing in business development. She is truly a leader in financial management, business contracts, program development, organizational structuring and grant writing. Throughout her career, she has been an adviser, partner and advocate of the arts, with music in the forefront. Her ability to multitask allows her to function in several areas, which fits well with her role of Chief Operations Officer (COO) for Mandate Project Impact as well as VP, Operations for M.A.N.D.A.T.E. Records.


Michelle R. Thompson, Board Director has been in the music industry for over 20 years. Her tenure in the industry began as a songwriter and recording artist, then later expanded to label owner and radio personality. As A&R Vice President at M.A.N.D.A.T.E. Records, her whole department’s team mission is to teach and challenge new artists to reach the next best level of their artistry potential. All artists are expected to make the single most important investment of all, their time and talent, as they learn about the unseen pressures of the music industry and the need to keep God first over all.


Teresa M. Reed, Board Director is a certified public accountant with broad experience in tax compliance and tax planning for multi-state entities and individuals.  She has over 20 years providing personalized comprehensive accounting and tax services to sole-proprietors, small to mid-sized corporations and partnerships. Teresa, a graduate of USC, currently resides in San Diego and has advised recording artists in Los Angeles and Minneapolis. When not advising clients, she chairs San Diego's Management of Accounting Practices group for the California Society of CPAs and serves on the Board of Directors of Rady Children's Hospital Auxiliary.
 

Ben E. Johnson, Board Director  In the legal field for over 36 years, attorney Ben Johnson brings a wealth of resources and knowledge. Mr. Johnson began working at the age of nine in the cotton fields. Encouraged by his grandmother that education was his exit plan from hard labor, attorney Johnson excelled in his academics, receiving the Rockefeller Foundation full scholarship to Occidental College where he graduated with honors and then Juris Doctorate from UOP McGeorge School of Law. As a music connoisseur, Ben will use his vast legal experience to help shape the future of MPI.



Other ways you can help...

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!


Coming soon...

The MPI website is under construction. Once this is launched, Facebook and Twitter will also be launched. In the meantime, you may find more information on Mandate Project Impact Inc. at GuideStar.org.
